WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.337 --> 00:00:15.417
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV,

3
00:00:15.417 --> 00:00:17.100
I'm your host Mike Rodrick.

4
00:00:17.100 --> 00:00:19.580
And today we're doing
Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

5
00:00:19.580 --> 00:00:23.410
And specifically in this episode,
it's time for

6
00:00:23.410 --> 00:00:26.610
another one of those exciting,
try it out exercises.

7
00:00:26.610 --> 00:00:28.540
And here with us today, is Mr. Nick Page.

8
00:00:28.540 --> 00:00:29.320
How you doing, Nick?

9
00:00:29.320 --> 00:00:31.190
>> Pretty good.
I'm ready to try it out with these

10
00:00:31.190 --> 00:00:32.548
clipping masks and layers masks.

11
00:00:32.548 --> 00:00:33.066
>> All right.

12
00:00:33.066 --> 00:00:35.080
>> So let's dive into Photoshop here.

13
00:00:35.080 --> 00:00:37.660
And I'm gonna start by
opening a project file.

14
00:00:37.660 --> 00:00:43.430
So let's go to file, open right here,
and then let's open sunflower three.

15
00:00:45.300 --> 00:00:48.330
So here we have sunflower three,
looks rather nice, so

16
00:00:48.330 --> 00:00:51.260
first off let's make it
look a little nicer.

17
00:00:51.260 --> 00:00:52.020
>> All right.

18
00:00:52.020 --> 00:00:58.160
>> Layers,
I will unlock the layer, and then.

19
00:00:58.160 --> 00:01:01.860
Let's go to create a layer style up here.

20
00:01:01.860 --> 00:01:02.860
Click that.

21
00:01:02.860 --> 00:01:06.530
And then let's do the,
what do I want to do?

22
00:01:07.630 --> 00:01:09.660
Let's mess with some Vibrance.

23
00:01:11.950 --> 00:01:16.450
Adjust that up there,
make it much yellower, saturate it more,

24
00:01:16.450 --> 00:01:17.519
add some more orange to it.

25
00:01:18.910 --> 00:01:20.610
And then there we go.

26
00:01:20.610 --> 00:01:22.400
So now we have a Vibrance layer on there.

27
00:01:22.400 --> 00:01:26.110
I could also take it off if I wanted
to if I didn't like it too much.

28
00:01:26.110 --> 00:01:28.640
Or I could adjust it further, later.

29
00:01:28.640 --> 00:01:30.070
So we have this.

30
00:01:30.070 --> 00:01:33.200
Now let's create a cool design thing.

31
00:01:33.200 --> 00:01:35.330
It's kind of more modern.

32
00:01:35.330 --> 00:01:37.800
I've noticed that everyone is kind of, or

33
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:42.950
a lot of companies seem
to be into more shapes.

34
00:01:42.950 --> 00:01:43.886
>> Mm hm.

35
00:01:43.886 --> 00:01:46.853
>> I see a lot of hexagon stuff,
let's do a hexagon.

36
00:01:46.853 --> 00:01:47.451
>> Okay.
>> I want to create a hexagon.

37
00:01:47.451 --> 00:01:50.622
Down at the bottom left,
down on the left on your tools section,

38
00:01:50.622 --> 00:01:51.810
there's a shape tool.

39
00:01:53.400 --> 00:01:56.200
It'd probably be rectangle tool or
custom shaped tool.

40
00:01:56.200 --> 00:01:57.390
I'm going to go to polygon.

41
00:01:58.670 --> 00:02:01.580
Here I can adjust the size,
the sides of it.

42
00:02:01.580 --> 00:02:04.010
So it's default is set to five, I believe.

43
00:02:04.010 --> 00:02:05.918
So it's a pentagon.

44
00:02:05.918 --> 00:02:07.960
Pentagon?
Yeah, so I want to switch to six,

45
00:02:07.960 --> 00:02:08.675
so hexagon.

46
00:02:08.675 --> 00:02:11.020
>> Okay.
>> So there you go, six right up here.

47
00:02:12.020 --> 00:02:13.430
And then let's draw one.

48
00:02:13.430 --> 00:02:14.380
I'll just draw one in.

49
00:02:15.490 --> 00:02:17.990
I'll hold shift and
drag out to the right to keep it the same.

50
00:02:20.000 --> 00:02:22.220
To keep it a consistent size.

51
00:02:23.270 --> 00:02:27.030
And then here's my hexagon.

52
00:02:27.030 --> 00:02:31.500
Now I'll create more of these so
be artsy about this.

53
00:02:31.500 --> 00:02:34.310
To duplicate I'll hold alt and

54
00:02:34.310 --> 00:02:38.050
then make sure I am on my move tool,
hold alt and click and drag.

55
00:02:38.050 --> 00:02:41.610
There I have another one,
then do it one more time.

56
00:02:42.780 --> 00:02:46.470
So there are three hexagons there.

57
00:02:46.470 --> 00:02:48.230
What am I going to do with this?

58
00:02:48.230 --> 00:02:49.710
I kind of want to create
a clipping mask now.

59
00:02:49.710 --> 00:02:54.030
So let's go,drag these below so

60
00:02:54.030 --> 00:03:00.380
my picture that I want to clip is above
those shapes and then I'll right click.

61
00:03:00.380 --> 00:03:01.280
Create Clipping Mask.

62
00:03:02.410 --> 00:03:04.570
So now, what just happened?

63
00:03:04.570 --> 00:03:08.040
You see, it only happened to one of those,
you can only see, there's one of

64
00:03:08.040 --> 00:03:11.586
the polygons that actually got [CROSSTALK]
>> Just the one layer that was directly

65
00:03:11.586 --> 00:03:12.462
below your image.

66
00:03:12.462 --> 00:03:14.778
>> Exactly.

67
00:03:14.778 --> 00:03:18.070
So, to kind of fix this,
I want all three of them to be there.

68
00:03:18.070 --> 00:03:23.860
So, what I'll do is, I will actually take
these three, click on the first one.

69
00:03:23.860 --> 00:03:26.650
Hold your Shift button and
click on the last one.

70
00:03:26.650 --> 00:03:27.700
So now all three are selected.

71
00:03:27.700 --> 00:03:30.240
I'm gonna put these in a group.

72
00:03:30.240 --> 00:03:34.640
So then it's one group object
below that clipping mask, so

73
00:03:34.640 --> 00:03:37.700
it'll still be the object directly below,
except it'll have more objects in it.

74
00:03:37.700 --> 00:03:41.540
So easy way to do this,
make sure they're all highlighted,

75
00:03:41.540 --> 00:03:43.840
click them,
drag them onto the folder down here.

76
00:03:45.320 --> 00:03:46.750
Now I have a group.

77
00:03:46.750 --> 00:03:48.990
So now this happened.

78
00:03:48.990 --> 00:03:51.840
It kind of brought my
clipping mask in with it.

79
00:03:53.260 --> 00:03:56.550
So it's a good practice to group
them first and then clip it.

80
00:03:56.550 --> 00:04:01.330
So I'll just pull this clipping
mask out of the group right there.

81
00:04:01.330 --> 00:04:02.380
And then reclip it.

82
00:04:02.380 --> 00:04:07.000
So now if I do right click,
clipping mask, now they're all selected.

83
00:04:07.000 --> 00:04:07.760
>> Perfect.

84
00:04:07.760 --> 00:04:09.730
>> So now I have this really cool design.

85
00:04:09.730 --> 00:04:13.860
I could either change the positioning
of the sunflower there, or

86
00:04:13.860 --> 00:04:17.180
I can change the positioning
of the hexagons.

87
00:04:17.180 --> 00:04:19.230
So whatever looks really cool to me.

88
00:04:19.230 --> 00:04:22.670
Let me just put these down here,
on the bottom left,

89
00:04:22.670 --> 00:04:27.960
then move my picture so
kind of works like that.

90
00:04:27.960 --> 00:04:29.260
Let's get a good part of the picture.

91
00:04:30.260 --> 00:04:33.350
I guess that's good for now.

92
00:04:33.350 --> 00:04:37.094
So now, I want to create a,
let's create like a white background, or

93
00:04:37.094 --> 00:04:40.950
a color background actually,
so, I'll create a new layer.

94
00:04:40.950 --> 00:04:42.340
And then still want it
to be in the background,

95
00:04:42.340 --> 00:04:46.920
I'll drag it all way to the bottom so
it's behind all the other ones.

96
00:04:46.920 --> 00:04:54.710
And a way to nondestructively add a fill
of colors, it's really simple actually,

97
00:04:54.710 --> 00:04:58.350
instead of taking my paint bucket tool
I'm just like filling it with black.

98
00:04:59.460 --> 00:05:07.900
I can actually go to down to the bottom
here where I'll do the layer styles.

99
00:05:07.900 --> 00:05:09.890
And I could actually go to, what was it?

100
00:05:09.890 --> 00:05:13.991
Solid Color or Gradient, but if I click
that, it'll give me an option for

101
00:05:13.991 --> 00:05:17.500
a solid color,
let's make a big old red background.

102
00:05:17.500 --> 00:05:18.750
Hit OK.

103
00:05:18.750 --> 00:05:23.870
So now this is a,
it has a layer mask on that layer so

104
00:05:23.870 --> 00:05:28.470
if I wanted to add things to it before
I can actually adjust this further by

105
00:05:30.520 --> 00:05:34.049
painting black or white.

106
00:05:35.090 --> 00:05:37.720
To kind of erase part of
the color background,

107
00:05:37.720 --> 00:05:40.830
even though I'm not really erasing it.

108
00:05:40.830 --> 00:05:43.140
So, let me undo that,
leave the solid for now.

109
00:05:45.750 --> 00:05:51.070
And then say if I, there we go,
keep going back, there.

110
00:05:51.070 --> 00:05:56.590
So, say if I have these three hexagons
there, I don't want all three of them.

111
00:05:56.590 --> 00:05:59.070
And like to be part of the flower.

112
00:05:59.070 --> 00:06:02.140
So if I wanted to I could
open this group up, and

113
00:06:02.140 --> 00:06:05.830
then pull one of these out of the group
if I wanted to no longer clip.

114
00:06:05.830 --> 00:06:09.840
So let me pull this polygon
out of the group down below.

115
00:06:09.840 --> 00:06:13.190
And it's no longer part
of that clipping mask.

116
00:06:13.190 --> 00:06:14.780
Same goes the other way.

117
00:06:14.780 --> 00:06:18.100
If I wanted to re-add it, there we go.

118
00:06:18.100 --> 00:06:23.140
And I could also, let me create
a picture or create another shape.

119
00:06:23.140 --> 00:06:25.520
Let me do a big one.

120
00:06:26.830 --> 00:06:29.380
Let's do it that way, just like that.

121
00:06:30.802 --> 00:06:34.030
This one, not look as good
because we'll have to see.

122
00:06:36.140 --> 00:06:38.546
There so I can add another one to it,
or I can take it out.

123
00:06:38.546 --> 00:06:41.757
Take it out.

124
00:06:44.540 --> 00:06:48.496
Sometimes it's difficult removing things
from the folder cuz you have to get right

125
00:06:48.496 --> 00:06:50.060
outside of the little barrier.

126
00:06:50.060 --> 00:06:51.330
>> Especially down there at the bottom.

127
00:06:51.330 --> 00:06:52.360
>> Right, mm-hm.

128
00:06:52.360 --> 00:06:58.140
So now this one, it kinda thinks that it
should be a part of the clipping mask.

129
00:06:58.140 --> 00:07:00.680
If you drag it up out of the thing.

130
00:07:00.680 --> 00:07:06.400
So that can easily be fixed if you just
keep dragging it up, or right click on it.

131
00:07:06.400 --> 00:07:10.260
And you can release clipping mask,
that's a way too.

132
00:07:10.260 --> 00:07:15.640
Say I didn't want this flower to be
a clipping mask anymore, right click it,

133
00:07:15.640 --> 00:07:16.610
or right click the name.

134
00:07:16.610 --> 00:07:19.800
Release clicking mask so
it'll just be there.

135
00:07:21.820 --> 00:07:25.240
So now let me pull this back and
make this look good.

136
00:07:25.240 --> 00:07:26.360
I'll pull this back into the group.

137
00:07:26.360 --> 00:07:30.920
And then let's move this flower around so
it actually, there we go.

138
00:07:30.920 --> 00:07:32.895
So now it all kind of melts together.

139
00:07:32.895 --> 00:07:37.430
>> Mm-hm.
>> And that's just a basic kind of

140
00:07:37.430 --> 00:07:41.440
intro to the clipping masks and
you can be really creative with this,

141
00:07:41.440 --> 00:07:42.810
you can do same thing with text.

142
00:07:42.810 --> 00:07:47.430
Say if I wanted to have a text
have the sunflower background

143
00:07:47.430 --> 00:07:50.680
same thing as I would with the shapes
I just use a text layer instead.

144
00:07:50.680 --> 00:07:51.620
>> Very cool Nick.

145
00:07:51.620 --> 00:07:54.604
I tell you what, it makes you think about
some of those images I've seen out there

146
00:07:54.604 --> 00:07:58.085
and realize wait, I bet ya they're
using some type of layer mask or

147
00:07:58.085 --> 00:07:59.465
a clipping mask on that.

148
00:07:59.465 --> 00:08:00.045
So very cool.

149
00:08:00.045 --> 00:08:02.765
Now we can start to make some
professional looking graphics.

150
00:08:02.765 --> 00:08:03.505
Appreciate that.

151
00:08:03.505 --> 00:08:05.165
Hope everybody out there enjoyed it.

152
00:08:05.165 --> 00:08:07.455
Signing off for ITProTV, I'm Mike Rodrik.

153
00:08:07.455 --> 00:08:08.215
>> And I'm Nick Page.

154
00:08:08.215 --> 00:08:10.121
>> And we'll see you next time.

155
00:08:10.121 --> 00:08:18.139
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Typography in Photoshop
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.011 --> 00:00:10.011
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.332 --> 00:00:12.930
Hello! Welcome to another exciting
episode here at IT PRO TV.

3
00:00:16.080 --> 00:00:19.440
I'm your host, Mike Rodrick, and
today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

4
00:00:19.440 --> 00:00:24.890
And specifically in this episode,
we're gonna be looking at typography.

5
00:00:24.890 --> 00:00:26.720
Not one of the first things
that comes to mind, maybe,

6
00:00:26.720 --> 00:00:29.430
when you think about Photoshopping
working with photos.

7
00:00:29.430 --> 00:00:32.770
But as we get into our more complex
projects we definitely got to bring some

8
00:00:32.770 --> 00:00:33.400
type in there.

9
00:00:33.400 --> 00:00:36.030
So, to help us with that here we have Ms.
Kara Page.

10
00:00:36.030 --> 00:00:37.060
How you doing, Kara?

11
00:00:37.060 --> 00:00:38.630
>> I'm great.
You ready to start playing around

12
00:00:38.630 --> 00:00:40.010
with some text and Photoshop?

13
00:00:40.010 --> 00:00:41.240
>> I am ready.

14
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:41.930
>> All right.

15
00:00:41.930 --> 00:00:45.510
So, let's get Photoshop up and running.

16
00:00:45.510 --> 00:00:48.370
And we are going to just
open a blank document.

17
00:00:48.370 --> 00:00:53.980
So go to File > New or click New, and
I'm going to change it to US Paper.

18
00:00:53.980 --> 00:00:57.190
We are going to pretend like we're
making something for prints.

19
00:00:57.190 --> 00:00:59.810
It maybe a resume or an advertisement.

20
00:00:59.810 --> 00:01:04.400
So I'm going to make sure it
says eight and a half by 11,

21
00:01:04.400 --> 00:01:06.170
300 CMIK, White background.

22
00:01:06.170 --> 00:01:09.640
So long as all that checks out we
are good to go so go ahead and click OK.

23
00:01:11.630 --> 00:01:16.660
So the whole little lecture we're giving
today is devoted to the Type Tool,

24
00:01:16.660 --> 00:01:18.270
the little T in your toolbar.

25
00:01:18.270 --> 00:01:21.480
So let's find that first and
we're gonna talk about it.

26
00:01:21.480 --> 00:01:23.340
So the T is over on the left.

27
00:01:23.340 --> 00:01:27.690
If you click on it, you'll notice that
now we have a tool options bar that has

28
00:01:27.690 --> 00:01:29.940
all of these different options.

29
00:01:29.940 --> 00:01:33.020
So you'll see your defaulted font here.

30
00:01:33.020 --> 00:01:34.890
If you click on the drop down here,

31
00:01:34.890 --> 00:01:40.030
you'll see all the different fonts
available to you in Photoshop.

32
00:01:40.030 --> 00:01:41.590
Now I download a lot of fonts so

33
00:01:41.590 --> 00:01:44.980
you probably aren't going to have this
many fonts, I really really love fonts.

34
00:01:44.980 --> 00:01:48.020
Fonts, I download them all the time.

35
00:01:48.020 --> 00:01:51.450
You can also add fonts with Adobe Typekit,
so

36
00:01:51.450 --> 00:01:53.360
you'll notice that you have that
little option in the corner.

37
00:01:53.360 --> 00:01:54.530
So you can definitely do that.

38
00:01:54.530 --> 00:01:56.150
You can add fonts from there.

39
00:01:56.150 --> 00:01:57.900
You can also download fonts online.

40
00:01:57.900 --> 00:02:01.880
There are tons and tons of websites
available for you for fonts.

41
00:02:01.880 --> 00:02:05.140
By telling you, once you start doing it,
it's like you go down a rabbit hole and

42
00:02:05.140 --> 00:02:06.860
you just download, download, download.

43
00:02:06.860 --> 00:02:09.260
I might download 25 fonts in a day.

44
00:02:09.260 --> 00:02:11.220
Wow.
>> You just keep finding more and

45
00:02:11.220 --> 00:02:11.860
more fonts.

46
00:02:11.860 --> 00:02:16.300
But when you do that, make sure to
pay attention to their licenses.

47
00:02:16.300 --> 00:02:18.890
So that goes back to our
little copyright lecture.

48
00:02:18.890 --> 00:02:22.060
So you'll notice with every
font that you have to download,

49
00:02:22.060 --> 00:02:24.170
it'll tell you how you can use it.

50
00:02:24.170 --> 00:02:29.310
It'll say free for personal use,
100% free, small donation.

51
00:02:29.310 --> 00:02:32.890
So, pay attention to what
the artist requests for

52
00:02:32.890 --> 00:02:37.000
their font before you download and
use in a commercial piece, okay?

53
00:02:37.000 --> 00:02:38.680
So pretty much all of them are free for

54
00:02:38.680 --> 00:02:42.060
personal use if you find them
on a main typography website.

55
00:02:42.060 --> 00:02:45.640
But do note that you don't want to use
that same font in a commercial case

56
00:02:45.640 --> 00:02:48.410
without paying the artist for it.

57
00:02:48.410 --> 00:02:51.780
Okay, so now that we've gotten
the legality out of the way,

58
00:02:51.780 --> 00:02:53.850
Let's pick a font to play with.

59
00:02:53.850 --> 00:02:55.960
I'm actually going to pick
one that I did download.

60
00:02:55.960 --> 00:02:57.510
It's called Davis New.

61
00:02:57.510 --> 00:02:59.180
It's 100% free.

62
00:02:59.180 --> 00:03:02.875
If you find it on one of the font websites
you'll see that it gets downloaded about

63
00:03:02.875 --> 00:03:04.310
12,000 times a day.

64
00:03:04.310 --> 00:03:07.210
>> Wow.
>> It's extremely popular

65
00:03:07.210 --> 00:03:09.250
because it's very clean and easy to read.

66
00:03:09.250 --> 00:03:11.230
So let's select that.

67
00:03:11.230 --> 00:03:15.170
You'll notice also, before I select it,
it'll show you previews of the font, so

68
00:03:15.170 --> 00:03:16.230
that way you're not guessing,

69
00:03:16.230 --> 00:03:21.030
okay what in the world does Miriad Pro
look like versus Baskerville versus Alora.

70
00:03:21.030 --> 00:03:23.740
You know, you don't have to
know their personalities.

71
00:03:23.740 --> 00:03:25.280
>> Nice.
>> Okay, you can see them here.

72
00:03:25.280 --> 00:03:28.720
You can also change this
default size as well.

73
00:03:28.720 --> 00:03:29.750
You can edit that size.

74
00:03:29.750 --> 00:03:31.990
If you want it to be larger,
you we certainly can make it larger.

75
00:03:31.990 --> 00:03:32.980
So let's select out font.

76
00:03:32.980 --> 00:03:38.650
We're gonna select Bebas Neue, and then
if it were a font that had options like

77
00:03:38.650 --> 00:03:43.010
regular bold, italicized, they would be
right here where my regular is grayed out.

78
00:03:43.010 --> 00:03:47.780
So let me show you what would happen if
we picked something like, let's choose,

79
00:03:47.780 --> 00:03:49.610
I don't know, Ariel.

80
00:03:49.610 --> 00:03:54.290
Nice Ariel, you'll see how bold, regular
italic, bold italic are there for you.

81
00:03:54.290 --> 00:03:57.590
Okay, I am gonna go back to
Bebas just cuz it's nice to see.

82
00:03:57.590 --> 00:04:00.350
The nice thing about Photoshop and
Adobe products in general is,

83
00:04:00.350 --> 00:04:03.120
they show you your most
recent fonts up at the top.

84
00:04:03.120 --> 00:04:05.640
So, I didn't have to scroll
all the way to Bebas or

85
00:04:05.640 --> 00:04:07.880
I didn't have to type in Bebas,
I just clicked on it.

86
00:04:07.880 --> 00:04:10.500
>> That, very importantly, when you're
a font collector, like you are.

87
00:04:10.500 --> 00:04:11.775
You got a list of 2000 fonts.

88
00:04:11.775 --> 00:04:14.220
[LAUGH]
>> Exactly, exactly.

89
00:04:14.220 --> 00:04:18.500
So, I am going to see,
now that what my font size is so

90
00:04:18.500 --> 00:04:21.550
you'll notice that it's 12 pt so
12 point font.

91
00:04:21.550 --> 00:04:26.710
You can click on the drop-down to select a
size or you can type your size yourself so

92
00:04:26.710 --> 00:04:29.310
if you didn't want it to be
12 you can make it larger.

93
00:04:29.310 --> 00:04:33.010
So, let's try making ours,
let's do a nice 50, okay?

94
00:04:33.010 --> 00:04:35.350
I'm going to hit enter to commit that.

95
00:04:35.350 --> 00:04:37.870
The next thing you'll see is
something that say smooth.

96
00:04:37.870 --> 00:04:41.320
So, you'll have smooth,
strong, crisp, none, sharp.

97
00:04:41.320 --> 00:04:43.520
This is called anti-aliasing.

98
00:04:43.520 --> 00:04:47.210
So anti-aliasing changes
how sharp the word looks.

99
00:04:47.210 --> 00:04:49.650
So let's practice that.

100
00:04:49.650 --> 00:04:50.790
Now if I were to type right now,

101
00:04:50.790 --> 00:04:55.080
you wouldn't be able to see
it because my color is white.

102
00:04:55.080 --> 00:04:57.160
Okay?
So let's change the color.

103
00:04:57.160 --> 00:05:03.780
I'm going to just pick a nice black
here for you and let's type, practice.

104
00:05:05.060 --> 00:05:05.560
Okay.

105
00:05:07.650 --> 00:05:09.200
I'm moving it with the move tool.

106
00:05:09.200 --> 00:05:12.570
Now, to get my text options back,
I need to select my type tool.

107
00:05:13.840 --> 00:05:16.460
I'm going to zoom into this so
you can see it a lot better.

108
00:05:16.460 --> 00:05:19.080
And I'm going to pan using my spacebar.

109
00:05:21.430 --> 00:05:23.200
And there we go,
it brings up our hand tools.

110
00:05:23.200 --> 00:05:24.780
So now you can see practice pretty well.

111
00:05:24.780 --> 00:05:29.040
I'm gonna make this font even larger
than it is so let's take it up to 100.

112
00:05:29.040 --> 00:05:31.380
There we go, nice and large.

113
00:05:31.380 --> 00:05:33.260
There's practice for us.

114
00:05:33.260 --> 00:05:36.330
Fold highlight and see what happens if
we were to choose a different option.

115
00:05:36.330 --> 00:05:37.466
So let's look at strong.

116
00:05:40.317 --> 00:05:44.300
Strong, okay,
we're looking along the edges of.

117
00:05:44.300 --> 00:05:46.120
The letter.
So, let's look at sharp.

118
00:05:46.120 --> 00:05:48.250
You'll notice that it tightens
up just a little bit.

119
00:05:50.070 --> 00:05:54.070
Crisp, smooth,
they all do slightly different things.

120
00:05:54.070 --> 00:05:56.600
So, if you're having issues
with- Let's say you're making

121
00:05:56.600 --> 00:06:00.800
a banner advertisement at 72, Pixels.

122
00:06:00.800 --> 00:06:02.980
Then it might look a little pixellated,
the font.

123
00:06:02.980 --> 00:06:06.830
So you would play around with
these anti aliasing methods

124
00:06:06.830 --> 00:06:08.380
to make it look more smooth.

125
00:06:08.380 --> 00:06:09.020
Or crisp.

126
00:06:09.020 --> 00:06:09.580
Or strong.

127
00:06:09.580 --> 00:06:11.200
Depending on your font.

128
00:06:11.200 --> 00:06:14.160
Now Davis is one that looks good
pretty much no matter what.

129
00:06:14.160 --> 00:06:16.660
So let's try changing it
to something like Arial.

130
00:06:16.660 --> 00:06:18.230
Just to see the difference.

131
00:06:18.230 --> 00:06:23.220
Let's change it to Arial Bold and see
if we get more of a change here at all.

132
00:06:23.220 --> 00:06:23.720
So.

133
00:06:26.109 --> 00:06:27.295
Of course, I picked two fonts.

134
00:06:27.295 --> 00:06:29.510
>> Mm-hm.
>> That just a pretty good, there.

135
00:06:29.510 --> 00:06:32.000
So, let's look at this,
let's look at none.

136
00:06:32.000 --> 00:06:33.760
So none if we zoom in to the C,

137
00:06:33.760 --> 00:06:36.525
you'll notice that is have
a very pixellated edge.

138
00:06:36.525 --> 00:06:37.340
>> Mm-hm.

139
00:06:37.340 --> 00:06:38.220
>> That's not what we want.

140
00:06:38.220 --> 00:06:40.460
So let's compare that to sharp.

141
00:06:40.460 --> 00:06:43.370
For sharp smooths it out ever so slightly.

142
00:06:43.370 --> 00:06:45.650
Crisp, very similar.

143
00:06:45.650 --> 00:06:46.210
Strong.

144
00:06:46.210 --> 00:06:49.330
And then you have your smooth.

145
00:06:49.330 --> 00:06:55.170
Okay, so find what works best for
your font and go about that way.

146
00:06:55.170 --> 00:06:59.500
Alright so you'll also notice along the
top that we have alignment options too.

147
00:06:59.500 --> 00:07:01.820
So we have left align,
center align and right align.

148
00:07:01.820 --> 00:07:05.840
So if you were to click on left align,
it will left align but

149
00:07:05.840 --> 00:07:07.890
you might have to drag it back over.

150
00:07:07.890 --> 00:07:10.120
Now it's just a single line of text so

151
00:07:10.120 --> 00:07:12.770
really aligning with a single
line is kind of silly.

152
00:07:12.770 --> 00:07:15.030
But if I have more text
It might be helpful.

153
00:07:15.030 --> 00:07:18.310
Let's say that I wanted to
highlight my text again.

154
00:07:18.310 --> 00:07:21.490
So I wanted io edit it and
change my font maybe.

155
00:07:21.490 --> 00:07:22.790
There are several ways to do it.

156
00:07:22.790 --> 00:07:29.050
You can click on your type tool and
highlight it or you could do my favorite

157
00:07:29.050 --> 00:07:32.545
method which is to go to your Layers
panel and double-click on the text T.

158
00:07:32.545 --> 00:07:35.750
Double-clicking on the T
selects everything.

159
00:07:35.750 --> 00:07:37.979
The problem with using
the type tool to select,

160
00:07:37.979 --> 00:07:40.720
is it's very easy to accidentally
start a new text layer.

161
00:07:40.720 --> 00:07:44.364
[LAUGH] So you have to be very
exact with where you're clicking,

162
00:07:44.364 --> 00:07:48.298
this takes away that margin of
error by double-clicking on your T.

163
00:07:48.298 --> 00:07:54.148
You'll also notice that when you do create
text, it automatically names your layer.

164
00:07:54.148 --> 00:07:56.376
Whatever your text says.

165
00:07:56.376 --> 00:07:59.922
So it kind of saves you from doing that
layer organization that we went over much

166
00:07:59.922 --> 00:08:00.520
earlier on.

167
00:08:00.520 --> 00:08:02.983
You don't have to go back and
rename, very helpful.

168
00:08:02.983 --> 00:08:07.600
Okay, so
that's just your basic line of text.

169
00:08:07.600 --> 00:08:09.737
So let's say that we wanted
to add a different line, and

170
00:08:09.737 --> 00:08:10.990
we wanted to change the font.

171
00:08:10.990 --> 00:08:15.030
What we could do is we could go to our
Text Tool, click somewhere that's away

172
00:08:15.030 --> 00:08:19.830
from your top PRACTICE, and
I'm gonna change the font over here.

173
00:08:19.830 --> 00:08:24.168
Let's change it to, I don't know.

174
00:08:24.168 --> 00:08:28.950
Let's go to, we'll do Arial Bold,
just so you can see, Bold Italic,

175
00:08:28.950 --> 00:08:30.660
actually, so
we can really see a difference.

176
00:08:30.660 --> 00:08:34.789
I'm gonna change this to be 30.

177
00:08:34.789 --> 00:08:40.460
I'll change it to be this nice little
blue color, and now I'll write something.

178
00:08:40.460 --> 00:08:43.730
So let's do, This is fun!

179
00:08:43.730 --> 00:08:45.920
Okay, so there, now I have this.

180
00:08:45.920 --> 00:08:49.600
If I wanted to change maybe
the spacing of my letters, or

181
00:08:49.600 --> 00:08:53.260
I wanted to change the distance
between lines, so let's see.

182
00:08:53.260 --> 00:08:56.093
This is another line.

183
00:08:56.093 --> 00:09:00.130
Now I need to pull up my panel that
allows me to do additional edits.

184
00:09:00.130 --> 00:09:03.960
So to do that,
you can click on this little folder icon.

185
00:09:03.960 --> 00:09:07.820
This folder is the toggle to your
character or paragraph panels.

186
00:09:07.820 --> 00:09:12.060
So you can click on it here,
or you can go to Window, and

187
00:09:12.060 --> 00:09:14.960
select Character or
Paragraph there as well.

188
00:09:14.960 --> 00:09:18.230
I think it's a lot easier to
just click on this fly out menu.

189
00:09:18.230 --> 00:09:22.851
So when you do, you'll notice that we
have this little box that appears.

190
00:09:22.851 --> 00:09:27.531
And you'll notice we have the font here,
the type here, so bold,

191
00:09:27.531 --> 00:09:30.020
italic, whatever, the size.

192
00:09:30.020 --> 00:09:31.935
And then you have this
thing that says Auto.

193
00:09:31.935 --> 00:09:37.140
Now if you hover over each of these little
icons, it'll tell you what it does.

194
00:09:37.140 --> 00:09:41.370
So this A stacked on top of the A,
this is something called leading.

195
00:09:41.370 --> 00:09:47.950
Leading, which looks like leading,
L-E-A-D-I-N-G, is the space between lines.

196
00:09:47.950 --> 00:09:51.090
So if we wanted to change
the space between these two lines,

197
00:09:51.090 --> 00:09:53.260
we could highlight our text.

198
00:09:53.260 --> 00:09:56.840
And right now, it's set to Auto,
which basically means that the font

199
00:09:56.840 --> 00:09:59.830
automatically knows how
far apart it should be.

200
00:09:59.830 --> 00:10:02.160
But let's say that we didn't like that,
and we wanted to change it.

201
00:10:02.160 --> 00:10:05.350
Let's see what were to
happen if we did 10 points.

202
00:10:06.490 --> 00:10:10.120
There, and now you'll notice that our
lines are stacked on top of each other.

203
00:10:10.120 --> 00:10:13.443
That's not ideal, let's try 30.

204
00:10:13.443 --> 00:10:18.424
30 is very similar to what we had
originally, and then let's try 60.

205
00:10:18.424 --> 00:10:20.740
So you'll notice we're
adding line spacing.

206
00:10:20.740 --> 00:10:24.697
It's kind of similar to Microsoft Word,
where you add double spacing or one and

207
00:10:24.697 --> 00:10:26.894
a half spacing, but you have more options.

208
00:10:26.894 --> 00:10:30.364
Okay, so I'm gonna change it back to Auto,
cuz Auto actually looks pretty good for

209
00:10:30.364 --> 00:10:30.870
this font.

210
00:10:31.950 --> 00:10:35.010
Then we have down here, this V and this A.

211
00:10:35.010 --> 00:10:39.110
So if we hover over it, it'll say
that you're setting the tracking.

212
00:10:39.110 --> 00:10:42.770
The tracking is the spacing
between all letters.

213
00:10:42.770 --> 00:10:46.160
So, let's see what would happen if we
changed it from something other than 0.

214
00:10:46.160 --> 00:10:48.139
Let's try -50 first.

215
00:10:49.182 --> 00:10:53.292
So -50 just pulled all the letters
slightly closer together.

216
00:10:53.292 --> 00:10:58.507
All right, so let's try the other
direction, let's try 200.

217
00:10:58.507 --> 00:11:02.110
Now all of our letters are evenly
spaced throughout the line,

218
00:11:02.110 --> 00:11:04.750
which is great, but
this is very spread out.

219
00:11:04.750 --> 00:11:05.940
I don't really like what this looks like.

220
00:11:05.940 --> 00:11:08.950
So let's just go back to 0,
which is what its default is, okay.

221
00:11:10.100 --> 00:11:15.420
Let's say that we wanted to maybe
change how close this N and O were.

222
00:11:15.420 --> 00:11:19.830
So if you wanted to do something more
specific, that would be kerning.

223
00:11:19.830 --> 00:11:22.428
So kerning is this V-A.

224
00:11:22.428 --> 00:11:25.820
You'll notice that it's set to metrics or
optical.

225
00:11:25.820 --> 00:11:27.780
You can change this.

226
00:11:27.780 --> 00:11:30.450
And you can edit your text.

227
00:11:30.450 --> 00:11:34.890
So just two letters are closer together,
one letter is closer to the other.

228
00:11:34.890 --> 00:11:35.920
That's available for you.

229
00:11:37.280 --> 00:11:39.540
Then you have this T with
the tall double arrow.

230
00:11:39.540 --> 00:11:41.000
This is vertical scale.

231
00:11:41.000 --> 00:11:42.790
So if we were to change
the scale vertically,

232
00:11:42.790 --> 00:11:47.519
let's see what would
happen if we put in 300%.

233
00:11:47.519 --> 00:11:50.340
It'd help if I highlighted my text.

234
00:11:50.340 --> 00:11:57.730
Hold on, let's highlight you,
and let's change you to 300%.

235
00:11:57.730 --> 00:12:00.429
Okay, that looks a little
bit distorted because we

236
00:12:00.429 --> 00:12:03.820
vertically scaled it three
times larger than what it was.

237
00:12:03.820 --> 00:12:07.070
That doesn't look great, but if you were
trying to do that, if you're trying to

238
00:12:07.070 --> 00:12:10.990
create some kind of word art where
you needed to do that, you could.

239
00:12:10.990 --> 00:12:13.445
You'd probably just wanna go back and
change your leading.

240
00:12:14.520 --> 00:12:16.010
You can also type in your leading here.

241
00:12:16.010 --> 00:12:19.630
So I'm gonna change it to, let's do 200.

242
00:12:19.630 --> 00:12:21.470
Now they're really spread out.

243
00:12:21.470 --> 00:12:23.562
But it looks better cuz they're
not stacked on top of each other.

244
00:12:23.562 --> 00:12:28.760
[LAUGH] All right, let's go back
to our default there of 100 and

245
00:12:28.760 --> 00:12:30.847
our default of Auto here.

246
00:12:30.847 --> 00:12:34.698
Okay, this next T, where the arrows
are pointing horizontally,

247
00:12:34.698 --> 00:12:37.110
that's your horizontal scale.

248
00:12:37.110 --> 00:12:43.252
So let's see what would happen if we
did 200% there, scales it horizontally.

249
00:12:43.252 --> 00:12:45.230
Here, go back to 100.

250
00:12:45.230 --> 00:12:49.150
All right, this next one right
here is the baseline shift.

251
00:12:49.150 --> 00:12:52.170
So if you wanted to change
how a certain letter looked,

252
00:12:52.170 --> 00:12:56.610
let's say that you're doing something like
H2O, so you're dealing with chemistry.

253
00:12:56.610 --> 00:13:00.550
You can highlight a letter and
change the baseline.

254
00:13:00.550 --> 00:13:03.864
Let's do -20.

255
00:13:03.864 --> 00:13:07.090
You'll notice that now my s is by itself.

256
00:13:07.090 --> 00:13:08.260
It's kind of hanging down there.

257
00:13:08.260 --> 00:13:11.380
Let's see what would happen
if we did positive 20.

258
00:13:11.380 --> 00:13:15.020
So, let's say that you were doing math,
and you were typing out math equations,

259
00:13:15.020 --> 00:13:16.750
and you need to do x squared.

260
00:13:16.750 --> 00:13:19.210
This is how you would
adjust that baseline.

261
00:13:19.210 --> 00:13:20.795
>> Very nice.

262
00:13:20.795 --> 00:13:23.790
>> Okay, so, let's just go back to 0 for

263
00:13:23.790 --> 00:13:26.630
that so
[LAUGH] it looks just like everybody else.

264
00:13:26.630 --> 00:13:29.780
If you wanted to change the color, you can
highlight each letter individually, or

265
00:13:29.780 --> 00:13:32.080
you can select everything at once or
one line.

266
00:13:32.080 --> 00:13:33.902
So let's just change this one line.

267
00:13:33.902 --> 00:13:37.920
I'm gonna use our lovely color picker,
and I'll just choose a green.

268
00:13:37.920 --> 00:13:39.360
Click OK.

269
00:13:39.360 --> 00:13:41.450
So now we have two lines of text.

270
00:13:41.450 --> 00:13:44.430
With these lines of text, we can
also play around with alignment now.

271
00:13:44.430 --> 00:13:46.581
So we can highlight the whole thing.

272
00:13:46.581 --> 00:13:51.612
You can also do Cmd+A or Ctrl+A, as long
as you have your type tool selected.

273
00:13:51.612 --> 00:13:53.810
And let's do Center Align.

274
00:13:56.830 --> 00:14:00.070
Now as you drag this over,
you'll notice that a purple line appears.

275
00:14:00.070 --> 00:14:04.107
This purple line in the middle is a guide
telling you you've hit the center of

276
00:14:04.107 --> 00:14:04.745
your page.

277
00:14:04.745 --> 00:14:09.490
So if you wanted everything to be center
aligned, this is where you would go, okay.

278
00:14:09.490 --> 00:14:12.680
So beyond that,
we have additional options available.

279
00:14:14.090 --> 00:14:17.030
So this whole line here,
they all do different things.

280
00:14:17.030 --> 00:14:21.637
If you hover over them, this is for
bold, for italic, all caps.

281
00:14:21.637 --> 00:14:25.327
So let's say that you wanted to change
something to all caps because you think

282
00:14:25.327 --> 00:14:29.129
it's easier to read, instead of typing
the whole thing out again in Caps Lock,

283
00:14:29.129 --> 00:14:32.516
you could just click the two tall Ts,
automatically changes for you.

284
00:14:32.516 --> 00:14:33.660
>> Very nice.

285
00:14:33.660 --> 00:14:37.455
>> You can also add small caps,
superscript, subscripts,

286
00:14:37.455 --> 00:14:39.473
underline, strike through.

287
00:14:39.473 --> 00:14:43.472
They're all there for you as options,
so it's up to you to explore them,

288
00:14:43.472 --> 00:14:44.900
figure out what you like.

289
00:14:46.190 --> 00:14:50.940
Okay, so now that we've created some
basic text, let's work with styles.

290
00:14:50.940 --> 00:14:53.320
So for
those of you who have ever used InDesign,

291
00:14:53.320 --> 00:14:56.580
you're probably familiar with
character and paragraph styles.

292
00:14:56.580 --> 00:15:02.140
So let's test that out, let's go ahead and
create some kind of header.

293
00:15:02.140 --> 00:15:03.280
So I'm gonna type in header.

294
00:15:04.650 --> 00:15:08.520
I'm gonna make it, well,
let's do it kind of bright pink.

295
00:15:09.670 --> 00:15:14.630
I'm gonna change the text to
this Arial Black Regular.

296
00:15:14.630 --> 00:15:16.093
I'll make it 60.

297
00:15:19.017 --> 00:15:23.711
So now we have this header, which is
great, but I wanna be able to apply

298
00:15:23.711 --> 00:15:28.310
this same character style to
other words on my document.

299
00:15:28.310 --> 00:15:30.700
So what I'll do is I'll make sure
that my text is selected, and

300
00:15:30.700 --> 00:15:34.100
I'll go up to Window > Character Styles.

301
00:15:36.330 --> 00:15:38.650
Now you'll notice there's
a None with a + next to it.

302
00:15:38.650 --> 00:15:42.790
The + is telling you that you've made
some modifications from the default.

303
00:15:42.790 --> 00:15:46.450
So let's say that I wanted to create
a layer style based on what I did

304
00:15:46.450 --> 00:15:47.510
on my document.

305
00:15:47.510 --> 00:15:51.500
I would click on this little button that
looks like our New Layer button, but

306
00:15:51.500 --> 00:15:52.950
it's a new character style.

307
00:15:52.950 --> 00:15:54.735
So let's click that.

308
00:15:54.735 --> 00:16:00.601
And I'm going to name it by double
clicking, I'm gonna put header.

309
00:16:00.601 --> 00:16:03.593
Now you'll notice that it saved all
that information you already put.

310
00:16:03.593 --> 00:16:07.820
Put in Photoshop so it has your font
family, your font size, your colour.

311
00:16:07.820 --> 00:16:11.700
All of that is here and
it automatically knows.

312
00:16:11.700 --> 00:16:12.390
So you can click.

313
00:16:13.610 --> 00:16:16.390
Okay, so
now we have a header style selected.

314
00:16:16.390 --> 00:16:20.535
Let's say we wanted to adjust
one of our other layers of type.

315
00:16:20.535 --> 00:16:24.025
We want it to take practice now and
change it to header.

316
00:16:25.425 --> 00:16:29.745
You can click header, commit.

317
00:16:29.745 --> 00:16:32.396
But see, the way that I did that
it automatically said, okay,

318
00:16:32.396 --> 00:16:34.095
you're changing this one to that one.

319
00:16:34.095 --> 00:16:35.190
>> Mm-hm.

320
00:16:35.190 --> 00:16:38.680
>> So it can be kinda of confusing,
so let's undo that.

321
00:16:38.680 --> 00:16:40.180
So there we go.

322
00:16:40.180 --> 00:16:44.530
Now if you don't hit that check box it
will just do what you intended to do,

323
00:16:44.530 --> 00:16:47.990
just to change your practice to header.

324
00:16:47.990 --> 00:16:51.660
So when you use character styles,
character styles are used for

325
00:16:51.660 --> 00:16:53.600
things like headings.

326
00:16:53.600 --> 00:16:57.720
Or if you just have small lines of text,
that's a character style.

327
00:16:57.720 --> 00:17:00.060
We need to learn to work
with paragraphs as well,

328
00:17:00.060 --> 00:17:03.680
cause sometimes you do have
paragraphs in Photoshop.

329
00:17:03.680 --> 00:17:10.232
So what we are going to do is, we are
going to Create a paragraph in Photoshop.

330
00:17:10.232 --> 00:17:13.280
So there are two different ways
to create a textbox in Photoshop.

331
00:17:13.280 --> 00:17:17.250
You can single click which is my preferred
method or you can draw a textbox.

332
00:17:17.250 --> 00:17:20.136
Let's draw a little textbox here.

333
00:17:20.136 --> 00:17:22.964
And lets change it so it's not 100.

334
00:17:22.964 --> 00:17:26.370
Let's do 12 and we'll write,
this is a paragraph.

335
00:17:28.850 --> 00:17:30.870
Now, I'm going to copy this.

336
00:17:30.870 --> 00:17:35.156
So I'm going to do Cmd+A or Ctrl+A to
select everything in that text box.

337
00:17:35.156 --> 00:17:41.725
I'm gonna do Cmd+C and
I'm just going to paste a few times.

338
00:17:41.725 --> 00:17:47.431
I'm actually gonna copy this over
again paste it, paste it, paste it.

339
00:17:47.431 --> 00:17:49.540
Okay, so
now we have a lot of text in here.

340
00:17:50.700 --> 00:17:52.930
But it doesn't fit in our text box.

341
00:17:52.930 --> 00:17:55.860
You'll notice that we have
a little plus sign at the box,

342
00:17:55.860 --> 00:18:00.790
that's telling you that you have over
set text it's not fitting in the box.

343
00:18:00.790 --> 00:18:03.460
Let's say that you went to the move and
you're moving this around and

344
00:18:03.460 --> 00:18:08.730
you realize my gosh this sentence
is cut off, it ends at this.

345
00:18:08.730 --> 00:18:13.037
That's not appropriate, so
you try to stretch out the box this way.

346
00:18:13.037 --> 00:18:16.600
Stretching out the box this
way stretches your text, okay?

347
00:18:16.600 --> 00:18:18.610
So we don't wanna do that,undo that.

348
00:18:18.610 --> 00:18:22.050
It's something that happens all
the time cause you just think I'm here,

349
00:18:22.050 --> 00:18:24.940
I have this little box that
tells me I can stretch it.

350
00:18:24.940 --> 00:18:26.757
No, don't do it that way.

351
00:18:26.757 --> 00:18:29.170
Let's go back to our type tool,
our text tool.

352
00:18:30.990 --> 00:18:34.580
And to make sure that our box is selected
and then you'll have, it'll look the same.

353
00:18:34.580 --> 00:18:36.220
You have your transform controls.

354
00:18:36.220 --> 00:18:40.515
But you can drag it out and
now our text is there.

355
00:18:40.515 --> 00:18:46.218
So a little tricky thing,
make sure that you know what you're doing.

356
00:18:46.218 --> 00:18:47.120
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] All right,

357
00:18:47.120 --> 00:18:50.790
let's say that we want to create
a style based on this paragraph text.

358
00:18:50.790 --> 00:18:57.380
We can go to window, paragraph styles,
and we can create a new paragraph style.

359
00:18:57.380 --> 00:18:59.430
Now you'll notice now it looks crazy.

360
00:18:59.430 --> 00:19:00.690
We don't want that to happen.

361
00:19:00.690 --> 00:19:03.320
The reason why is because for
some odd reason in Adobe,

362
00:19:03.320 --> 00:19:06.580
character size override paragraph styles.

363
00:19:06.580 --> 00:19:08.335
So let's go to our Character style panel.

364
00:19:08.335 --> 00:19:09.800
>> [LAUGH]
>> And you'll notice it has header

365
00:19:09.800 --> 00:19:10.650
selected.

366
00:19:10.650 --> 00:19:12.810
Not cool, not what we want,
let's click none.

367
00:19:14.260 --> 00:19:18.040
And now,
we just have our paragraph style applied.

368
00:19:18.040 --> 00:19:21.970
Now paragraph styles are really, really
powerful in all of the Adobe programs.

369
00:19:21.970 --> 00:19:26.400
If we double click, it'll allow
us to name it, all these things.

370
00:19:26.400 --> 00:19:29.160
There are advanced
options with paragraphs.

371
00:19:29.160 --> 00:19:33.520
So you can change your vertical scale,
your horizontal scale,

372
00:19:33.520 --> 00:19:36.970
your open type features,
indents and spacing.

373
00:19:36.970 --> 00:19:41.650
Indents and spacing is pretty useful,
you can create tab indents.

374
00:19:41.650 --> 00:19:44.690
Or spacing between lines here.

375
00:19:44.690 --> 00:19:48.820
You can also do something with
composition, justification or

376
00:19:48.820 --> 00:19:51.350
hyphenation which is my favorite.

377
00:19:51.350 --> 00:19:54.820
So I personally hate, hate,
hate, hyphens in design.

378
00:19:54.820 --> 00:19:56.160
I think it looks lazy.

379
00:19:56.160 --> 00:19:59.250
I feel like you should be able to
justify your text better than that.

380
00:19:59.250 --> 00:20:03.430
So I like to uncheck hyphenation, okay?

381
00:20:03.430 --> 00:20:05.390
So if you uncheck hyphenation,

382
00:20:05.390 --> 00:20:10.440
it's going to shift your text so
it's no longer hyphenated anywhere.

383
00:20:10.440 --> 00:20:14.690
It'll move that last word
to the next line down.

384
00:20:16.010 --> 00:20:19.060
Okay, let's see that you wanted to
create a style not based off of another

385
00:20:19.060 --> 00:20:20.480
style like we've been doing.

386
00:20:20.480 --> 00:20:23.930
You can still click New, double click and

387
00:20:23.930 --> 00:20:27.330
then select everything from here as well,
okay?

388
00:20:27.330 --> 00:20:28.720
So it's all there for you.

389
00:20:29.830 --> 00:20:30.380
>> Fantastic.

390
00:20:30.380 --> 00:20:32.790
>> Cancel.
>> See where this be a big help as you see

391
00:20:32.790 --> 00:20:36.690
there's a lot of options to deal with but
text as well as paragraphs and

392
00:20:36.690 --> 00:20:38.430
you're working on different projects.

393
00:20:38.430 --> 00:20:42.700
You might have set a font up just
right for a particular customer and

394
00:20:42.700 --> 00:20:46.390
then you gonna go back and to work for
that customer again months later.

395
00:20:46.390 --> 00:20:50.490
You gonna get to remember all those
settings or look at some past work, or

396
00:20:50.490 --> 00:20:54.140
you can have preset right there
labelled by customer name and

397
00:20:54.140 --> 00:20:56.180
you are good to go after
working on your next project.

398
00:20:56.180 --> 00:20:59.890
>> Yeah, now there is just one more
thing I wanna show you in Photoshop, and

399
00:20:59.890 --> 00:21:02.190
that is how to warp text.

400
00:21:02.190 --> 00:21:02.860
>> Warping.

401
00:21:02.860 --> 00:21:05.100
>> Warping yeah this is
gonna be pretty fun,

402
00:21:05.100 --> 00:21:09.150
am actually going to delete this paragraph
text so we have a little bit more space.

403
00:21:09.150 --> 00:21:10.920
So I'm just going to make
sure it's selected, and

404
00:21:10.920 --> 00:21:12.930
I'll just drag it down to the trash can.

405
00:21:12.930 --> 00:21:14.660
Okay, now we have some room.

406
00:21:14.660 --> 00:21:17.480
Let's create a new layer of
text by single-clicking and

407
00:21:17.480 --> 00:21:20.550
I'm going to write the word inflate.

408
00:21:22.720 --> 00:21:25.790
Gonna make sure it's selected, let's
drag it over so you can actually see it.

409
00:21:26.810 --> 00:21:30.110
And with our type tool selected,
we'll have options up here.

410
00:21:30.110 --> 00:21:32.660
One of them that we didn't touch
on is this T with this little

411
00:21:32.660 --> 00:21:34.060
curve underneath it.

412
00:21:34.060 --> 00:21:37.700
This is your create text warp options.

413
00:21:37.700 --> 00:21:40.906
So if you click on that box,
you'll see you have styles here.

414
00:21:40.906 --> 00:21:42.470
You have none, you have ark.

415
00:21:42.470 --> 00:21:45.110
Ark-lore, upper,
all sorts of different things.

416
00:21:45.110 --> 00:21:49.210
Let's say that we wanna use inflate
cuz we wrote the word inflate.

417
00:21:49.210 --> 00:21:52.380
We click on it then you
can change the bend.

418
00:21:52.380 --> 00:21:54.560
You can change the distortion.

419
00:21:54.560 --> 00:21:55.557
You can change.

420
00:21:57.980 --> 00:21:59.672
Anything that you want about it.

421
00:21:59.672 --> 00:22:01.560
So there we go, now we have inflate.

422
00:22:03.240 --> 00:22:05.120
You can still do things
like change the colors,

423
00:22:05.120 --> 00:22:06.890
change the font, after you're warped it.

424
00:22:06.890 --> 00:22:07.901
So let's change the color.

425
00:22:07.901 --> 00:22:11.701
I'm gonna double click, come over here,

426
00:22:11.701 --> 00:22:15.932
change the color, and
now we have warped text.

427
00:22:15.932 --> 00:22:18.405
Lets try another version of warped text.

428
00:22:18.405 --> 00:22:22.430
So, lets go ahead and
single click and lets do Rise.

429
00:22:23.855 --> 00:22:27.780
Okay, with Rise selected,
I will come up here to text warp and

430
00:22:27.780 --> 00:22:30.180
then we have an option for Rise.

431
00:22:31.430 --> 00:22:36.527
See, you could do horizontal, you could
do vertical, you can change the bend make

432
00:22:36.527 --> 00:22:42.250
it rise more,
all of these options are here for you.

433
00:22:42.250 --> 00:22:45.350
So if you're asked on the exam
to create warped text or

434
00:22:45.350 --> 00:22:49.330
to inflate text or to make it
rise this is where you would go.

435
00:22:49.330 --> 00:22:52.600
Just make sure you're one the type tool,
you're on the correct layer and

436
00:22:52.600 --> 00:22:54.060
go to your warped text.

437
00:22:55.240 --> 00:22:58.200
>> Very cool Kara, again,
a lot of things you can do

438
00:22:58.200 --> 00:23:02.732
when it comes to manipulating your text
and your paragraphs within Photoshop.

439
00:23:02.732 --> 00:23:05.850
All right, I hope everybody
out there enjoyed this one.

440
00:23:05.850 --> 00:23:08.680
Signing off for ITPRO TV I'm Mike Rodrick.

441
00:23:08.680 --> 00:23:09.577
>> And I'm Kara Paige.

442
00:23:09.577 --> 00:23:11.679
>> And we'll see you next time.

443
00:23:11.679 --> 00:23:19.700
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Shapes and Layer Styles
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.228 --> 00:00:15.489
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.489 --> 00:00:20.780
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, and today
we're doing Adobe Photoshop's CC 2015.

4
00:00:20.780 --> 00:00:26.320
Specifically in this episode, we're going
to be looking at shapes and layer styles.

5
00:00:26.320 --> 00:00:28.420
Here to help us with
that is Miss Kara Paige.

6
00:00:28.420 --> 00:00:29.680
How are you doing Kara?

7
00:00:29.680 --> 00:00:32.345
>> I'm great,
I'm excited to start working with shapes.

8
00:00:32.345 --> 00:00:33.740
[LAUGH]
>> All right.

9
00:00:33.740 --> 00:00:35.140
>> All right, are you ready?

10
00:00:35.140 --> 00:00:35.650
>> I'm ready.

11
00:00:35.650 --> 00:00:40.650
>> Okay, so go ahead and get Photoshop
up and running, so we're ready to go.

12
00:00:40.650 --> 00:00:43.060
And we're going to make a new document, so

13
00:00:43.060 --> 00:00:47.510
I'm either going to click the new
button or I'm going to go to file-new.

14
00:00:47.510 --> 00:00:51.310
I'm just going to select a preset here,
so if you go to your document type and

15
00:00:51.310 --> 00:00:53.190
choose photo.

16
00:00:53.190 --> 00:00:55.740
I'm going to choose my size,
landscape 8x10's,

17
00:00:55.740 --> 00:00:59.290
that way we have a nice wide
area to experiment with.

18
00:00:59.290 --> 00:01:00.150
All right?

19
00:01:00.150 --> 00:01:01.560
So click okay.

20
00:01:01.560 --> 00:01:02.160
And there we go.

21
00:01:02.160 --> 00:01:06.343
We have have our nice, just blank canvass
ready for us to practice the shapes.

22
00:01:06.343 --> 00:01:07.836
>> Plenty of room to get creative.

23
00:01:07.836 --> 00:01:09.180
>> Plenty of room.

24
00:01:09.180 --> 00:01:13.110
So what we're going to do is we're
going to access our shapes tool.

25
00:01:13.110 --> 00:01:18.330
So your shapes tool is in the bottom
corner of your tool panel.

26
00:01:18.330 --> 00:01:22.210
Chances are you have this rectangle tool
on top, if not that's completely fine.

27
00:01:22.210 --> 00:01:25.980
You can just click on your shape and
not fly out of he menu up here.

28
00:01:25.980 --> 00:01:28.160
So, let's test out this
rectangle tool first.

29
00:01:28.160 --> 00:01:29.170
Just to see what it does.

30
00:01:30.230 --> 00:01:33.240
All right so I'm just going to click,
hold and drag out.

31
00:01:35.080 --> 00:01:39.201
And now you'll see that I
have a nice solid rectangle.

32
00:01:39.201 --> 00:01:43.440
So if you notice I have this
properties box that comes up here and

33
00:01:43.440 --> 00:01:45.890
I have a little box that's just black.

34
00:01:45.890 --> 00:01:47.820
This is my fill color.

35
00:01:47.820 --> 00:01:51.160
So if you hover over it,
it will well you, this is my fill type.

36
00:01:51.160 --> 00:01:55.180
So your fill is what is within
your boundary lines of your shape.

37
00:01:55.180 --> 00:01:56.210
So ours is black right now.

38
00:01:56.210 --> 00:01:59.030
Let's go ahead and change that to
something a little bit more festive.

39
00:01:59.030 --> 00:02:00.940
So I'm gonna change it to maybe a fuchsia.

40
00:02:02.090 --> 00:02:02.900
All right?

41
00:02:02.900 --> 00:02:05.680
Okay, so now we have our Fill layer,
filled in.

42
00:02:05.680 --> 00:02:07.220
Now we want to add a stroke.

43
00:02:07.220 --> 00:02:10.680
So a stroke is a boarder or
an outline to your shape or your path, or

44
00:02:10.680 --> 00:02:11.870
whatever it is.

45
00:02:11.870 --> 00:02:14.570
So you can tell right now we don't
have a stroke because it's a white

46
00:02:14.570 --> 00:02:16.660
box with a red line through it.

47
00:02:16.660 --> 00:02:21.900
So if I were to add a color, I would click
on My Stroke and I would select a color.

48
00:02:21.900 --> 00:02:24.910
So I'm gonna pick this nice bright green.

49
00:02:24.910 --> 00:02:30.190
Now I have green, I have a size,
which is 15, I don't want it to be 15,

50
00:02:30.190 --> 00:02:34.910
I'm going to take it down to 5,
enter there to commit that change, and

51
00:02:34.910 --> 00:02:38.260
I'm going to change my stroke style.

52
00:02:38.260 --> 00:02:42.439
Right now it's set on these dots, I'm
going to change mine to the solid line.

53
00:02:44.090 --> 00:02:46.950
Okay, and now we have a nice rectangle, so

54
00:02:46.950 --> 00:02:51.010
if we wanted to move it we could use
our move tool, put it wherever we want.

55
00:02:51.010 --> 00:02:57.380
If we look at our layers panel,
you'll see that we have a rectangle, okay?

56
00:02:57.380 --> 00:02:58.480
So easy enough.

57
00:02:58.480 --> 00:02:59.640
>> Very cool.

58
00:02:59.640 --> 00:03:01.400
>> Now what if we want to make a square?

59
00:03:02.590 --> 00:03:04.760
There isn't a square-shape tool, but

60
00:03:04.760 --> 00:03:09.080
a square is basically a rectangle,
so let's take our rectangle tool.

61
00:03:09.080 --> 00:03:13.080
I'm going to create a new layer for
my new shape and

62
00:03:13.080 --> 00:03:16.760
I'm going to click,
hold down shift as I drag.

63
00:03:16.760 --> 00:03:22.750
So holding down shift and I'm dragging it
out and it's making that perfect square.

64
00:03:22.750 --> 00:03:25.360
>> Very nice.
>> So it's constraining proportions,

65
00:03:25.360 --> 00:03:26.880
which it does for other tools as well.

66
00:03:26.880 --> 00:03:28.390
You remember learning about that?

67
00:03:28.390 --> 00:03:28.950
>> I do.

68
00:03:28.950 --> 00:03:30.200
>> Okay, great.

69
00:03:30.200 --> 00:03:33.600
So now if I want to change the fill
color and the stroke color I could.

70
00:03:33.600 --> 00:03:35.960
So fill is your first box.

71
00:03:35.960 --> 00:03:37.050
Stroke is your second.

72
00:03:38.310 --> 00:03:41.815
Mine likes to default to
this silly dotted line.

73
00:03:41.815 --> 00:03:43.840
>> [LAUGH]
>> I'm going to change mine to this dashed

74
00:03:43.840 --> 00:03:45.150
line and make it a little bit smaller.

75
00:03:46.240 --> 00:03:47.822
Now, it's kind of like a crazy coupon.

76
00:03:47.822 --> 00:03:50.370
>> [LAUGH]
>> So I'm just gonna put it over here.

77
00:03:50.370 --> 00:03:53.190
All right, so
now we've experimented with the rectangle,

78
00:03:53.190 --> 00:03:56.330
we know how to make a square, so
let's move on to a different shape.

79
00:03:56.330 --> 00:03:57.070
So if I click and

80
00:03:57.070 --> 00:04:02.300
hold down on our little tool panel, you'll
see we have the rounded rectangle tool.

81
00:04:02.300 --> 00:04:04.900
Works just the same way as
our regular rectangle tool,

82
00:04:04.900 --> 00:04:06.570
but it doesn't have hard edges.

83
00:04:06.570 --> 00:04:07.840
It has rounded edges.

84
00:04:07.840 --> 00:04:10.270
So I'm gonna skip that one,
it's too similar.

85
00:04:10.270 --> 00:04:12.050
Let's go to the ellipse tool.

86
00:04:12.050 --> 00:04:13.780
So the ellipse tool is a circle.

87
00:04:13.780 --> 00:04:16.540
You probably remember it from
the elliptical marquee tool.

88
00:04:16.540 --> 00:04:19.670
The way that you create a perfect
circle is let's go ahead and

89
00:04:19.670 --> 00:04:21.100
make a new layer for my circle.

90
00:04:22.260 --> 00:04:26.110
I'm going to click on Shift and
hold as I drag.

91
00:04:26.110 --> 00:04:29.540
And I'll get a perfect circle, okay?

92
00:04:30.540 --> 00:04:34.140
So, if I wanted to do a different
way of drawing my circle, I could.

93
00:04:34.140 --> 00:04:35.580
So, I'm going to undo what I just did.

94
00:04:35.580 --> 00:04:38.280
And I'm going to hold down Alt and
drag and

95
00:04:38.280 --> 00:04:41.960
then you'll have a circle that
comes straight from the center.

96
00:04:41.960 --> 00:04:43.590
If you wanted it to be a perfect circle,

97
00:04:43.590 --> 00:04:47.040
you can combine the two and hold down
Alt and Shift as you're dragging.

98
00:04:47.040 --> 00:04:48.980
You'll have a perfect
circle from the center.

99
00:04:48.980 --> 00:04:51.990
So right now you can't actually
see our circle except for

100
00:04:51.990 --> 00:04:54.450
the outline of it because
the fill is white.

101
00:04:54.450 --> 00:04:58.615
So you can change that
to a nice bright green.

102
00:04:58.615 --> 00:05:00.602
Gonna add it up here with
the rest of my shapes.

103
00:05:00.602 --> 00:05:01.583
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] Got a nice little

104
00:05:01.583 --> 00:05:02.730
collection going up there.

105
00:05:02.730 --> 00:05:04.670
>> Yeah, we have a nice collection.

106
00:05:04.670 --> 00:05:08.300
Let's move on to our next shape,
which is the polygon tool.

107
00:05:08.300 --> 00:05:10.700
So let's try and
see what the polygon tool does.

108
00:05:10.700 --> 00:05:12.190
I'm going to click hold and drag.

109
00:05:13.460 --> 00:05:15.000
Now I have a polygon.

110
00:05:15.000 --> 00:05:18.360
Now you'll notice up at the top I have
an option to change the side numbers.

111
00:05:18.360 --> 00:05:21.200
Right now it's on five,
which is our pentagon,

112
00:05:21.200 --> 00:05:23.880
right, so if we wanted to
change our sides, we could.

113
00:05:23.880 --> 00:05:27.730
And let's draw out a new polygon.

114
00:05:29.800 --> 00:05:32.059
Now we have a nice octagon.

115
00:05:32.059 --> 00:05:33.099
>> Very neat.

116
00:05:33.099 --> 00:05:36.500
>> Okay, so if you wanted to do
shapes like that you certainly could.

117
00:05:36.500 --> 00:05:38.140
All right, then you have your line tools.

118
00:05:38.140 --> 00:05:40.858
So that's what you use if you
want to create a straight line.

119
00:05:40.858 --> 00:05:43.130
That's pretty self-explanatory.

120
00:05:43.130 --> 00:05:45.380
You can do lines a whole bunch of
different ways in Photoshop so

121
00:05:45.380 --> 00:05:47.150
we're not gonna spend time on that.

122
00:05:47.150 --> 00:05:49.950
But we will talk about
this custom shape tool.

123
00:05:49.950 --> 00:05:52.900
So if you click on the custom shape tool,
you'll notice

124
00:05:52.900 --> 00:05:57.510
that you have a Shape icon up at the top
of your screen, in your tool options bar.

125
00:05:57.510 --> 00:05:59.120
If you click on this dropdown,

126
00:05:59.120 --> 00:06:03.060
it'll show you shapes that
are preloaded in Photoshop.

127
00:06:03.060 --> 00:06:07.710
This works just like your brushes
panel if you want to add shapes to it.

128
00:06:07.710 --> 00:06:09.970
So, if you click on this gear icon,

129
00:06:09.970 --> 00:06:13.940
you'll notice that you have all of
these different options down here.

130
00:06:13.940 --> 00:06:19.360
So, if we were to click on animals,
for instance, we'll have our pen or

131
00:06:19.360 --> 00:06:22.320
okay, again, okay, replaces a pen to add.

132
00:06:22.320 --> 00:06:23.340
Some of the pen to add.

133
00:06:23.340 --> 00:06:27.680
And now we have some fun
little animal shapes.

134
00:06:27.680 --> 00:06:31.930
So if we wanted to add a paw
print to our picture, we could.

135
00:06:31.930 --> 00:06:35.010
I'm going to change the color, we've got
a lot of green going on right now so.

136
00:06:35.010 --> 00:06:40.480
Make sure when you do that, though
>> You have the right shape selected.

137
00:06:40.480 --> 00:06:42.180
>> Yep,
we still have the last shape selected so

138
00:06:42.180 --> 00:06:46.780
I'm gonna do a new layer,
change my fill to blue, and

139
00:06:46.780 --> 00:06:50.130
I'm going to click, hold and drag out
>> This little paw print.

140
00:06:50.130 --> 00:06:52.450
So if you want it to be perfect,
you going to hold down shift.

141
00:06:55.720 --> 00:06:57.830
And now we have a fun paw print.

142
00:06:57.830 --> 00:06:58.390
>> Nice.

143
00:06:58.390 --> 00:07:02.090
>> You can also create your own
custom shapes, if you like.

144
00:07:02.090 --> 00:07:04.890
So if you want to use the pen tool,
which you'll be learning about.

145
00:07:04.890 --> 00:07:08.530
You can draw some custom shapes,
save them and

146
00:07:08.530 --> 00:07:10.750
really just lots of different options for
shapes.

147
00:07:10.750 --> 00:07:13.290
So if you're designing
something like a web page and

148
00:07:13.290 --> 00:07:17.720
you don't wanna go through the trouble
of making an icon for an email or

149
00:07:17.720 --> 00:07:21.050
something like that,
Photoshop has one for you already.

150
00:07:21.050 --> 00:07:21.790
>> Very neat.

151
00:07:21.790 --> 00:07:25.100
>> So, quick, simple,
little trick there, right.

152
00:07:25.100 --> 00:07:28.940
Let's say that we wanted to
learn how to align these Layers.

153

You'll notice that my

00:15:26.710 --> 00:15:29.820

00:15:29.820 --> 00:15:33.870
This is a very cool effect to do,

You can change the angle, so

You can change the spread,

And if you just keep changing the angle,

00:18:02.250 --> 00:18:05.700
It's also a way to create

As soon as you made that shadow come out,

00:18:17.230 --> 00:18:20.880
So, we didn't want the drop shadow
