So let's try something smaller, maybe 20.

384
00:19:42.530 --> 00:19:45.570
Okay, let's do Bob's Biscuits.

385
00:19:45.570 --> 00:19:48.110
But I can't see it,
do you know why I can't see it?

386
00:19:48.110 --> 00:19:49.870
>> Maybe our text is black?

387
00:19:49.870 --> 00:19:51.280
>> Our text is black.

388
00:19:51.280 --> 00:19:54.220
So you can do Cmd+a to
select all of your text and

389
00:19:54.220 --> 00:19:56.150
I'm going to change the text to white.

390
00:19:57.680 --> 00:20:00.060
Okay, so now we have Bob's Biscuits,
that can be bigger.

391
00:20:00.060 --> 00:20:03.580
20 is a little small, so
let's make it bigger.

392
00:20:03.580 --> 00:20:10.360
Let's try 36, and there we go,
let's just enter that down a little bit.

393
00:20:10.360 --> 00:20:13.280
Okay, so now we have Bob's Biscuits.

394
00:20:13.280 --> 00:20:14.980
Here he is.

395
00:20:14.980 --> 00:20:18.620
I'm just going to drag my
text up a little bit so

396
00:20:18.620 --> 00:20:21.880
that way it's in the center of my circle.

397
00:20:21.880 --> 00:20:23.950
Let's add some special effects
to this Bob's Biscuits.

398
00:20:23.950 --> 00:20:27.960
This is really boring, Bob needs something
a little bit more exciting in his life.

399
00:20:27.960 --> 00:20:30.810
He does, he needs a little flair so
he can really sell these biscuits.

400
00:20:30.810 --> 00:20:31.830
>> He does, he does.

401
00:20:31.830 --> 00:20:35.230
So let's first play around with
this circle, cuz it's boring.

402
00:20:35.230 --> 00:20:37.590
So let's click on our ellipse.

403
00:20:37.590 --> 00:20:40.060
Make sure that your ellipse
tool is selected, and

404
00:20:40.060 --> 00:20:42.840
then let's give it a stroke up at the top.

405
00:20:42.840 --> 00:20:45.500
So what color do you think
this stroke should be?

406
00:20:45.500 --> 00:20:48.340
>> If we're sticking with black
I kind of like that yellow

407
00:20:48.340 --> 00:20:50.630
that you were using with the black
earlier, that was a nice contrast.

408
00:20:50.630 --> 00:20:51.690
>> All right, let's do yellow.

409
00:20:51.690 --> 00:20:54.310
So let's click on yellow, and

410
00:20:54.310 --> 00:20:56.650
let's not do those dots cuz I
just really don't like them.

411
00:20:56.650 --> 00:21:00.020
So let's change it to this dash line and
make it smaller.

412
00:21:00.020 --> 00:21:03.922
Dash lines kind of have
this homey feel to them.

413
00:21:03.922 --> 00:21:07.490
So there we go, Bob's Biscuits, nice.

414
00:21:07.490 --> 00:21:11.430
Now we need to add some effects to the
text so let's go to our layers panel and

415
00:21:11.430 --> 00:21:13.380
click on FX for our layer styles.

416
00:21:15.000 --> 00:21:19.150
And let's do a stroke for Bob's Biscuits.

417
00:21:19.150 --> 00:21:20.480
That yellow is a little bit much.

418
00:21:20.480 --> 00:21:22.260
So I'm going to drag it down a little bit.

419
00:21:25.000 --> 00:21:27.380
And then, let's just go crazy with this.

420
00:21:27.380 --> 00:21:31.259
And let's add some kind of gradient
overlay to Bob's Biscuits.

421
00:21:32.820 --> 00:21:34.990
So I'm just gonna use one
that's already in here,

422
00:21:34.990 --> 00:21:39.290
I'm gonna make it really bold,
there we go.

423
00:21:39.290 --> 00:21:40.350
Now we have Bob's Biscuit.

424
00:21:40.350 --> 00:21:46.830
So here we have our first logo option for
Bob, so it's simple, easy.

425
00:21:46.830 --> 00:21:49.370
Let's go ahead and make this into a group.

426
00:21:49.370 --> 00:21:51.120
So we learned about
groups a long time ago,

427
00:21:51.120 --> 00:21:54.510
the way that we make a group,
is by either clicking on the folder and

428
00:21:54.510 --> 00:21:58.828
dragging the layers in, or by selecting
our layers and dragging them to a folder.

429
00:21:58.828 --> 00:22:03.910
So I'm gonna do that, I'm going to
click Shift and drag into a folder.

430
00:22:03.910 --> 00:22:05.820
Now we have group one.

431
00:22:05.820 --> 00:22:08.220
So I'm just gonna name it logo1.

432
00:22:10.950 --> 00:22:13.760
I'm going to expand this so
I can still see it.

433
00:22:13.760 --> 00:22:18.010
Let's actually make a copy of this logo,
so maybe he likes this look but

434
00:22:18.010 --> 00:22:18.990
he doesn't like the colors.

435
00:22:18.990 --> 00:22:23.990
So let's see what we can do,
so let's go ahead and

436
00:22:23.990 --> 00:22:26.280
I'm just gonna copy this ellipse.

437
00:22:26.280 --> 00:22:29.230
So I'm going to,
over here with my move tool,

438
00:22:29.230 --> 00:22:32.675
I'm gonna do my favorite form of copying,
which is doing Alt+drag.

439
00:22:35.060 --> 00:22:37.250
And now we have a different ellipse.

440
00:22:37.250 --> 00:22:38.840
But it's in our logo1 folder.

441
00:22:38.840 --> 00:22:40.900
We don't want that,
that's not what we want.

442
00:22:40.900 --> 00:22:45.142
So let's drag it above our logo1,

443
00:22:45.142 --> 00:22:50.090
and now it's not inside that logo1 folder.

444
00:22:50.090 --> 00:22:52.230
Let's change our stroke color,
so to do that,

445
00:22:52.230 --> 00:22:54.070
we need to make sure we're
on our ellipse tool.

446
00:22:55.360 --> 00:22:59.100
Let's change this one,
let's choose maybe a nice, subtle blue.

447
00:22:59.100 --> 00:23:02.870
So now we have a nice blue.

448
00:23:02.870 --> 00:23:04.380
Let's try a different font for

449
00:23:04.380 --> 00:23:09.570
Bob's Biscuits, because it needs to look
different more than just the colors.

450
00:23:09.570 --> 00:23:14.240
So I am going to click inside of my
circle and let's pick a different font.

451
00:23:14.240 --> 00:23:19.469
So I'm just gonna pick,
let's do one that's more of a script font,

452
00:23:19.469 --> 00:23:23.629
so a cursive font, and
let's see what happens there.

453
00:23:28.521 --> 00:23:29.877
>> Nice.

454
00:23:29.877 --> 00:23:33.282
>> Okay, so now we have
Bob's Biscuits hanging out there.

455
00:23:33.282 --> 00:23:37.020
I'm gonna move it down so
that way it looks pretty good on my shape.

456
00:23:37.020 --> 00:23:41.880
I can also make this font a little bit
larger, so let's change this to maybe 45,

457
00:23:41.880 --> 00:23:43.940
there we go that's better.

458
00:23:45.960 --> 00:23:47.036
Center Bob, there he is.

459
00:23:47.036 --> 00:23:49.919
Okay, so
we've got Bob's Biscuits we're good, but

460
00:23:49.919 --> 00:23:53.187
maybe Bob likes the text effects
that we did on the other logo.

461
00:23:53.187 --> 00:23:55.824
We can actually copy those layer effects.

462
00:23:55.824 --> 00:23:57.100
So let's see how we do that.

463
00:23:58.340 --> 00:24:03.443
Let's expand this folder so we can
actually see our Bob's Biscuit's effects.

464
00:24:03.443 --> 00:24:08.140
If we right-click on Effects,
you can copy layer style.

465
00:24:09.470 --> 00:24:15.350
Then if we click on Bob's Biscuits, we can
right click and paste our layer style.

466
00:24:15.350 --> 00:24:15.850
>> Wow.

467
00:24:17.180 --> 00:24:19.170
>> Okay, so that saved us
a whole bunch of steps there.

468
00:24:19.170 --> 00:24:19.910
>> Absolutely.

469
00:24:19.910 --> 00:24:21.390
>> Quick and easy.

470
00:24:21.390 --> 00:24:25.180
But let's say that on this one he
doesn't like the stroke around Bob's.

471
00:24:25.180 --> 00:24:28.880
You can actually click on the little
eyeball icon next to stroke and

472
00:24:28.880 --> 00:24:30.300
turn off that stroke.

473
00:24:31.600 --> 00:24:34.800
So if you're trying to figure out
how to get rid of a layer style or

474
00:24:34.800 --> 00:24:35.900
you're trying to modify it.

475
00:24:35.900 --> 00:24:38.930
You can click on the eyeballs or
you can right click and

476
00:24:38.930 --> 00:24:40.830
you can do Remove Layer Style, copy it.

477
00:24:40.830 --> 00:24:42.200
You can do all sorts of things there.

478
00:24:42.200 --> 00:24:46.710
You can also always add
additional layer styles to it.

479
00:24:46.710 --> 00:24:49.790
It'll just add to your effects.

480
00:24:49.790 --> 00:24:53.140
Now if you have a lot of effects maybe
you have ten effects on something and

481
00:24:53.140 --> 00:24:56.800
you don't like that and you need to
collapse it just click on up arrow here.

482
00:24:57.930 --> 00:25:02.732
All right, so let's make one more
layer folder and we're gonna name it

483
00:25:02.732 --> 00:25:08.090
Logo2 and now we're going to talk
about something called a layer comp.

484
00:25:08.090 --> 00:25:13.960
So a layer comp is where you do, let's
say two example of something like a logo.

485
00:25:13.960 --> 00:25:15.860
You want to show the client both, but

486
00:25:15.860 --> 00:25:19.070
you don't want to overwhelm them
by showing them all at once.

487
00:25:19.070 --> 00:25:21.500
This might be a good way for
you to save time,

488
00:25:21.500 --> 00:25:26.330
and for the client to save a headache,
by doing something called a layer comp.

489
00:25:26.330 --> 00:25:29.370
So, let's access that layer comp menu.

490
00:25:29.370 --> 00:25:31.660
What we're going to do is,
we're gonna go up to Window, and

491
00:25:31.660 --> 00:25:37.050
we're going to select Layer Comps, okay.

492
00:25:37.050 --> 00:25:41.450
And I'm going to take out
the visibility of logo 2, so that way,

493
00:25:41.450 --> 00:25:43.133
we only see logo 1 here.

494
00:25:43.133 --> 00:25:44.147
Okay.

495
00:25:44.147 --> 00:25:47.518
And I'm going to click on this new icon,

496
00:25:47.518 --> 00:25:51.791
just like a new layer and
I'm gonna name it Logo1.

497
00:25:51.791 --> 00:25:55.553
Okay, now I'm gonna hide
the visibility on Logo1,

498
00:25:55.553 --> 00:26:00.584
turn on the visibility of Logo2,
create a new layer, name it Logo2.

499
00:26:01.745 --> 00:26:06.345
And now you can click
between our two states and

500
00:26:06.345 --> 00:26:08.215
see our totally different logos.

501
00:26:08.215 --> 00:26:10.335
>> Very cool.

502
00:26:10.335 --> 00:26:12.995
>> Okay, so those are layer comps.

503
00:26:12.995 --> 00:26:14.815
Now I'm pretty much sums up this lesson.

504
00:26:14.815 --> 00:26:15.955
>> Fantastic Cara.

505
00:26:15.955 --> 00:26:16.965
Great look there.

506
00:26:16.965 --> 00:26:20.125
We started off creating shapes,
lots of different shapes.

507
00:26:20.125 --> 00:26:22.626
Then we took a like at
those effects those,

508
00:26:22.626 --> 00:26:26.806
layer styles that we could apply and
to round things off with layer cos.

509
00:26:26.806 --> 00:26:29.392
Great stuff,
great demonstrations we appreciate that.

510
00:26:29.392 --> 00:26:32.959
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching,
signing off for ITPro.TV,

511
00:26:32.959 --> 00:26:33.945
I'm Mike Rodrick.

512
00:26:33.945 --> 00:26:34.699
>> And I'm Cara Paige.

513
00:26:34.699 --> 00:26:36.742
>> And we'll see you next time.

514
00:26:36.742 --> 00:26:44.940
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Try It Out! Layer Styles and Shapes
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.287 --> 00:00:15.782
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.782 --> 00:00:17.105
I'm your host Mike Rodrick.

4
00:00:17.105 --> 00:00:21.006
And today we're doing
Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

5
00:00:21.006 --> 00:00:23.974
And specifically,
in this episode, it's time for

6
00:00:23.974 --> 00:00:26.410
another one of those exciting try it outs.

7
00:00:26.410 --> 00:00:30.150
And in this one, we're gonna be
doing layer styles and shapes.

8
00:00:30.150 --> 00:00:32.141
And here to help us with
that is Miss Kara Page.

9
00:00:32.141 --> 00:00:33.040
How are you doing Kara?

10
00:00:33.040 --> 00:00:33.677
>> I'm great.

11
00:00:33.677 --> 00:00:36.170
Are you ready to start
applying what we just learned?

12
00:00:36.170 --> 00:00:37.370
>> I'm ready.

13
00:00:37.370 --> 00:00:37.950
>> All right.

14
00:00:37.950 --> 00:00:43.184
So today, we're actually going to be
creating a logo for you, a designer.

15
00:00:43.184 --> 00:00:44.903
So, get excited.

16
00:00:44.903 --> 00:00:46.054
>> I am excited.

17
00:00:46.054 --> 00:00:46.702
>> I'm glad.

18
00:00:46.702 --> 00:00:49.311
We're gonna use a whole bunch of
the tools that we've learned so

19
00:00:49.311 --> 00:00:51.470
far to create a logo for yourself.

20
00:00:51.470 --> 00:00:56.850
So go ahead and open Photoshop and
we're going to create a new document.

21
00:00:56.850 --> 00:00:58.950
Okay, this one's gonna be custom.

22
00:00:58.950 --> 00:01:03.423
So, I'm gonna change it from inches,
to pixels, and

23
00:01:03.423 --> 00:01:10.444
I'm gonna do a 600 by 600 pixel document,
so, that way, it's a nice square.

24
00:01:10.444 --> 00:01:12.430
I prefer to design in
squares when I do logos.

25
00:01:12.430 --> 00:01:14.185
I don't know why.
That's just my personal preference.

26
00:01:14.185 --> 00:01:15.840
>> [LAUGH]
>> So, we're gonna do a square.

27
00:01:15.840 --> 00:01:20.180
I'm gonna change my color mode to CMYK,
resolution's Fine, but

28
00:01:20.180 --> 00:01:21.490
we don't want a background.

29
00:01:21.490 --> 00:01:25.450
We want it to be transparent, that way we
can use our logo a whole bunch of places

30
00:01:25.450 --> 00:01:27.796
without having a white
background attached.

31
00:01:27.796 --> 00:01:30.510
So, let's do Transparent and OK.

32
00:01:31.790 --> 00:01:34.560
So now, we have our nice background.

33
00:01:34.560 --> 00:01:35.380
It's blank.

34
00:01:35.380 --> 00:01:35.880
That's great.

35
00:01:36.890 --> 00:01:40.655
Now, to make sure that we're
doing everything centered,

36
00:01:40.655 --> 00:01:42.701
we're going to create guides.

37
00:01:42.701 --> 00:01:45.707
So, guides aren't something
that you've done yet, so

38
00:01:45.707 --> 00:01:47.532
we're gonna learn how to do them.

39
00:01:47.532 --> 00:01:50.820
The first thing that we wanna do is
make sure you have your rulers enabled.

40
00:01:50.820 --> 00:01:55.680
If not, go up to your View menu and
click on Rulers, okay.

41
00:01:55.680 --> 00:01:57.580
Once you have your rulers created,

42
00:01:57.580 --> 00:02:02.660
my favorite way to create a guide is to
click on the ruler, hold and drag out.

43
00:02:03.690 --> 00:02:08.630
Now, the nice thing about being a 600
by 600 pixel document is that it has

44
00:02:08.630 --> 00:02:10.465
a nice even middle.

45
00:02:10.465 --> 00:02:12.180
>> [LAUGH]
>> So it ends up being one inch.

46
00:02:12.180 --> 00:02:16.130
Now you'll notice that we're in pixels but
my ruler's in inches.

47
00:02:16.130 --> 00:02:20.990
I can always change my preferences of
my ruler by right-clicking on it and

48
00:02:20.990 --> 00:02:22.860
changing it to Pixels.

49
00:02:22.860 --> 00:02:23.680
Okay?

50
00:02:23.680 --> 00:02:25.380
So, if we change it to Pixels,
there we go.

51
00:02:25.380 --> 00:02:28.040
Now, let's drag a guide
from the other side.

52
00:02:28.040 --> 00:02:31.674
So, I'm gonna drag a guide from here,
and, this time, I'm going to 300.

53
00:02:31.674 --> 00:02:35.210
All right, so once you're there,
there you go, so now you have guides.

54
00:02:35.210 --> 00:02:39.990
So these are telling you exactly
where the center of your document is.

55
00:02:39.990 --> 00:02:42.710
So the first thing we're gonna do
is we're going to create a shape.

56
00:02:42.710 --> 00:02:45.190
So we're going to create a circle.

57
00:02:45.190 --> 00:02:53.320
So, we're gonna grab our circle and I'm
going to click on these crosshairs, okay.

58
00:02:53.320 --> 00:02:57.040
I have From Center selected, so that's
gonna say it's gonna go from the center of

59
00:02:57.040 --> 00:03:01.820
my document, and I'm going to make it
a width of 600 by 6, actually, no.

60
00:03:01.820 --> 00:03:03.710
Let's not do 600,
cuz that's the size of our document.

61
00:03:03.710 --> 00:03:08.202
Let's do 500 by 500, click OK.

62
00:03:08.202 --> 00:03:10.950
And now we have a nice circle.

63
00:03:12.160 --> 00:03:14.880
So I'm actually going to
keep my circle black,

64
00:03:14.880 --> 00:03:17.970
cuz that's going to be
my bottom-most circle.

65
00:03:17.970 --> 00:03:20.220
But I wanna make another
circle on top of it.

66
00:03:20.220 --> 00:03:23.600
So let's click on the crosshairs again.

67
00:03:23.600 --> 00:03:30.340
And this time,
I'm going to do 480 by 480, click OK.

68
00:03:30.340 --> 00:03:33.170
Now you can't see the circle,
because it's the same color.

69
00:03:33.170 --> 00:03:36.820
But you can see the outline of the circle.

70
00:03:36.820 --> 00:03:39.270
So let's give this guy a stroke.

71
00:03:39.270 --> 00:03:41.490
So I'm gonna click on
my little Stroke box.

72
00:03:41.490 --> 00:03:43.640
Right now we don't have a stroke so
I'm gonna click on this.

73
00:03:45.190 --> 00:03:49.691
And let's do this nice bright blue color,
okay?

74
00:03:49.691 --> 00:03:51.519
And again, I have those circles up.

75
00:03:51.519 --> 00:03:53.950
I'm gonna change it to a solid line.

76
00:03:53.950 --> 00:03:58.460
And let's make it, 2 points.

77
00:03:58.460 --> 00:04:01.224
Now, I'm gonna change
the interior of my shape as well,

78
00:04:01.224 --> 00:04:05.650
cuz I wanna have this nice kind of dark
grey, black/blue color scheme going on.

79
00:04:05.650 --> 00:04:11.290
So I'm gonna change my shape
color to a nice dark gray.

80
00:04:11.290 --> 00:04:13.760
So I just chose the 90% gray.

81
00:04:13.760 --> 00:04:18.296
You can pick whatever gray you like.

82
00:04:18.296 --> 00:04:26.220
All right, so, now I want to convert
this shape into a path, okay?

83
00:04:26.220 --> 00:04:32.100
So I'm going to click up here where
it says Shape and click Path.

84
00:04:33.820 --> 00:04:36.410
And I'm going to single-click
on my crosshairs again,

85
00:04:36.410 --> 00:04:38.800
now you'll notice that
my icon has changed.

86
00:04:38.800 --> 00:04:39.562
All right?

87
00:04:39.562 --> 00:04:44.568
From the single-click,
and I'm going to do,

88
00:04:44.568 --> 00:04:49.333
let's do maybe 470 by 470, click OK.

89
00:04:49.333 --> 00:04:54.554
Now, you'll notice that we have
this little line here, all right?

90
00:04:54.554 --> 00:04:57.596
I wanna add text to this line.

91
00:04:57.596 --> 00:05:02.996
So, I'm going to select my Type tool and
if I hover over my path,

92
00:05:02.996 --> 00:05:06.696
you'll see that I have that swirly cursor.

93
00:05:06.696 --> 00:05:11.323
So, I'm gonna single-click and
I am going to write a,

94
00:05:11.323 --> 00:05:15.073
Established, E-S-T, 2016, okay?

95
00:05:15.073 --> 00:05:17.520
Or you can put your year of birth if
you want, that's completely fine.

96
00:05:17.520 --> 00:05:20.300
Or what year you started designing,
it's totally up to you.

97
00:05:20.300 --> 00:05:26.710
I'm gonna change this to Arial, and
I'm going to change it to Arial Bold.

98
00:05:26.710 --> 00:05:29.884
Right now it's at 45 which is
a little bit large for this.

99
00:05:29.884 --> 00:05:34.413
So, let's take it down to maybe, 10.

100
00:05:34.413 --> 00:05:38.209
Okay, so,
I need to flip my established around.

101
00:05:38.209 --> 00:05:42.992
So, I need to make sure that my
Direct Selection tool is selected.

102
00:05:42.992 --> 00:05:46.870
And you'll notice that now I have
this little cursor with these arrows.

103
00:05:46.870 --> 00:05:53.940
If I were to click, hold and flip, I could
add my established to the bottom there.

104
00:05:53.940 --> 00:05:54.485
>> Very cool.

105
00:05:54.485 --> 00:05:56.140
>> Mm-hm.

106
00:05:56.140 --> 00:06:01.830
All right, let's add another circle
to our little logo here that we have.

107
00:06:01.830 --> 00:06:05.670
So I'm going to go back to my circle,
or my Ellipse tool, and

108
00:06:05.670 --> 00:06:07.605
I need to change it back to a shape.

109
00:06:07.605 --> 00:06:10.863
Cuz right now it's on a path, so
it's not going to show me anything.

110
00:06:10.863 --> 00:06:12.941
So I need to go to Shape.

111
00:06:12.941 --> 00:06:19.978
I'm gonna single-click, and
let's do this one 400 by 400.

112
00:06:19.978 --> 00:06:23.290
Okay, so
now we have this nice solid color.

113
00:06:23.290 --> 00:06:26.640
Now, I want this to be the exact
same color as my stroke, so

114
00:06:26.640 --> 00:06:29.340
I'm gonna click on my Fill, and

115
00:06:29.340 --> 00:06:33.650
it'll be right up here in your recently
used colors, since you've just used it.

116
00:06:33.650 --> 00:06:35.660
So I'm wanna single-click on that, and

117
00:06:35.660 --> 00:06:38.770
I do wanna ad a stroke
to this interior circle.

118
00:06:38.770 --> 00:06:41.370
Just to spice it up,
add a little bit of flair.

119
00:06:41.370 --> 00:06:45.672
So I'm gonna change my stroke to white,
and

120
00:06:45.672 --> 00:06:51.620
actually I'm going to use the dot
this time but not crazily.

121
00:06:51.620 --> 00:06:53.059
So, I'm going to change my dots.

122
00:06:53.059 --> 00:06:54.569
Let's try 5, see what that looks like.

123
00:06:55.850 --> 00:06:56.697
That's not bad.

124
00:06:56.697 --> 00:07:00.063
I'm gonna actually take it down to may 3,
so it's a little bit more subtle.

125
00:07:00.063 --> 00:07:01.723
There we go, that's more classy.

126
00:07:01.723 --> 00:07:02.617
>> Mm-hm.

127
00:07:02.617 --> 00:07:06.285
All right, so we have a logo,
it says established 2016, but

128
00:07:06.285 --> 00:07:08.300
we don't have what the logo is for.

129
00:07:08.300 --> 00:07:09.630
So we need to add some text.

130
00:07:10.820 --> 00:07:16.020
So I'm going to select my type tool and
I'm actually going to just single-click

131
00:07:16.020 --> 00:07:19.740
outside and drag in cuz I'm gonna show
you, you can do it that way as well.

132
00:07:19.740 --> 00:07:21.460
Now I'm gonna type in designs.

133
00:07:22.930 --> 00:07:26.930
I'll highlight it, lets make it,
lets make it this dark gray color.

134
00:07:29.530 --> 00:07:32.990
Now we can see it,
I'm gonna drag it up here.

135
00:07:32.990 --> 00:07:36.752
And you'll know when you're right in
the center because your guide lines will

136
00:07:36.752 --> 00:07:39.730
highlight, so you'll see now it's purple.

137
00:07:39.730 --> 00:07:42.500
So this is the very
very center of my logo.

138
00:07:42.500 --> 00:07:45.553
Now, I don't want it to be in the exact
center cuz we're gonna add a line of text

139
00:07:45.553 --> 00:07:46.074
beneath it.

140
00:07:46.074 --> 00:07:49.908
So, I'm gonna drag it up some,
but it's still along my guide so

141
00:07:49.908 --> 00:07:51.554
I know it's in the center.

142
00:07:51.554 --> 00:07:54.350
I'm gonna double-click on my t to
highlight and let's change this.

143
00:07:54.350 --> 00:07:57.820
You can pick any kind of
script font that you want.

144
00:07:57.820 --> 00:08:00.634
I wanna make it a lot bigger.

145
00:08:00.634 --> 00:08:03.072
Maybe not that big, let's try 32.

146
00:08:03.072 --> 00:08:05.457
Nope, nope, 28.

147
00:08:05.457 --> 00:08:07.336
That's gonna be the winner.

148
00:08:07.336 --> 00:08:09.900
All right, and
I'm gonna drag it down just a little bit.

149
00:08:11.830 --> 00:08:14.720
Okay, so
now we have Designs which looks nice.

150
00:08:14.720 --> 00:08:18.200
But we can add some layer styles to it.

151
00:08:18.200 --> 00:08:20.170
So if you click on your FX at the bottom.

152
00:08:21.210 --> 00:08:23.930
I'm going to add a slight stroke to mine.

153
00:08:23.930 --> 00:08:26.000
So if you click on your Stroke,

154
00:08:26.000 --> 00:08:28.870
right now mine is yellow cuz that's
the last stroke that we made.

155
00:08:28.870 --> 00:08:30.260
I'm going to change it to white.

156
00:08:32.000 --> 00:08:35.110
And I'm actually gonna leave it at
3 cuz I like the way that looks.

157
00:08:36.950 --> 00:08:38.830
I'm just gonna click OK.

158
00:08:38.830 --> 00:08:39.930
So now we have designs.

159
00:08:39.930 --> 00:08:42.120
It's nice, simple, just has a stroke.

160
00:08:42.120 --> 00:08:44.366
It just stands out a little
bit more with that stroke.

161
00:08:44.366 --> 00:08:45.446
>> Mm-hm.

162
00:08:45.446 --> 00:08:47.600
>> All right, and
let's just add one more line of text.

163
00:08:47.600 --> 00:08:49.290
So I'm gonna click on my T.

164
00:08:50.440 --> 00:08:54.220
Now I'm just gonna single-click down here,
and I'm gonna put by me.

165
00:08:54.220 --> 00:08:56.230
You can put whatever your name is.

166
00:08:56.230 --> 00:08:57.540
That's completely fine.

167
00:08:57.540 --> 00:09:01.580
I'm just gonna go back to an Arial,
let's do just Arial Bold.

168
00:09:01.580 --> 00:09:09.610
I'm gonna change it to 16 pixels,
drag it over and

169
00:09:09.610 --> 00:09:13.140
you can use these guides cuz they'll tell
you, okay good, you're lined up properly.

170
00:09:14.778 --> 00:09:17.380
There you go, so
if you wanted to add the same layer style,

171
00:09:17.380 --> 00:09:18.740
if you want it to look the same.

172
00:09:18.740 --> 00:09:23.821
Remember, you can right-click
on your layer style,

173
00:09:23.821 --> 00:09:29.134
copy your layer style, and
then paste your layer style.

174
00:09:29.134 --> 00:09:32.397
All right, so now, if you wanted to do
a different version of the logo, so

175
00:09:32.397 --> 00:09:35.240
if you wanted to change out the colors and
see what you want to do,

176
00:09:35.240 --> 00:09:37.081
you could do layer comps if you wanted, so

177
00:09:37.081 --> 00:09:40.326
that way you could compare your
different layers, compare your logos.

178
00:09:40.326 --> 00:09:43.572
Now, if we were to save this logo
cuz we wanna use it in the future,

179
00:09:43.572 --> 00:09:46.470
we need to save it as
the right file type now.

180
00:09:46.470 --> 00:09:50.260
Okay, so, we need to save it as a file
type that is going to preserve this

181
00:09:50.260 --> 00:09:52.070
transparent background.

182
00:09:52.070 --> 00:09:54.810
So, I would recommend
saving this as a PNG.

183
00:09:56.020 --> 00:09:57.570
All right, and there you have it.

184
00:09:57.570 --> 00:10:00.150
That's how to make a logo in Photoshop.

185
00:10:00.150 --> 00:10:01.110
Fantastic.

186
00:10:01.110 --> 00:10:02.800
Try it out exercise, lots of fun.

187
00:10:02.800 --> 00:10:05.660
We got a brand new logo
in less than ten minutes.

188
00:10:05.660 --> 00:10:07.650
Thank you for that Kara,
we appreciate that.

189
00:10:07.650 --> 00:10:09.590
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

190
00:10:09.590 --> 00:10:11.264
Signing off for ITproTV.

191
00:10:11.264 --> 00:10:12.124
I'm Mike Rodrick.

192
00:10:12.124 --> 00:10:12.984
>> And I'm Kara Page.

193
00:10:12.984 --> 00:10:14.935
>> And we'll see you next time.

194
00:10:14.935 --> 00:10:22.467
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Pens, Puppets and Channels
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.133 --> 00:00:10.133
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.981 --> 00:00:12.533
Hello.

3
00:00:12.533 --> 00:00:15.544
Welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITProTV.

4
00:00:15.544 --> 00:00:20.667
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and
today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

5
00:00:20.667 --> 00:00:25.573
And specifically in this episode we're
gonna be looking at pins, puppets and

6
00:00:25.573 --> 00:00:26.328
channels.

7
00:00:26.328 --> 00:00:29.969
Now they might not seem like they go
together, and maybe they don't, but

8
00:00:29.969 --> 00:00:33.684
they're some of the more advanced
things that we can do within Photoshop.

9
00:00:33.684 --> 00:00:36.216
And here to help us with all
of this is Mr. Nick Page.

10
00:00:36.216 --> 00:00:37.183
How are you doing Nick?

11
00:00:37.183 --> 00:00:38.305
>> I'm doing pretty well.

12
00:00:38.305 --> 00:00:40.092
Time to take a look at this.

13
00:00:40.092 --> 00:00:42.258
When you think of pens,
puppets and channels,

14
00:00:42.258 --> 00:00:44.108
they really really don't go together.

15
00:00:44.108 --> 00:00:47.345
>> [LAUGH]
>> So here, let's start with the pen tool.

16
00:00:47.345 --> 00:00:52.004
It's a more advanced selection app tool,
so it works in the realm of

17
00:00:52.004 --> 00:00:56.993
vectors instead of raster,
which most other photo editing pieces are,

18
00:00:56.993 --> 00:01:00.861
deal with pixels,
little tiny squares on your screen.

19
00:01:00.861 --> 00:01:04.467
Vectors are more, you have a path and
it's filled with something.

20
00:01:04.467 --> 00:01:07.794
So, it's more scalable.

21
00:01:07.794 --> 00:01:11.256
So I started down in the Photoshop and

22
00:01:11.256 --> 00:01:16.281
get you started off by,
let's open up a new file, and

23
00:01:16.281 --> 00:01:21.774
then select default Photoshop size,
and I'll click OK.

24
00:01:21.774 --> 00:01:26.247
So our pen tool is located on
the left side on the tools panel,

25
00:01:26.247 --> 00:01:30.217
and then right down here,
right below the blur tool.

26
00:01:30.217 --> 00:01:34.074
And it can be activated
with the P shortcut.

27
00:01:34.074 --> 00:01:38.442
So let's first start off by making a path.

28
00:01:38.442 --> 00:01:43.233
When you think of a pen you'd normally
think just clicking and dragging.

29
00:01:43.233 --> 00:01:49.929
But in the pen tool, it has that option,
but the main use of it is line segments.

30
00:01:49.929 --> 00:01:54.118
So we'll start off by creating an anchor
point for where the line will begin, and

31
00:01:54.118 --> 00:01:57.703
then click where the line will end,
so I'll click to the right of it.

32
00:01:57.703 --> 00:02:01.356
>> So you actually let go, you didn't
hold the mouse button down that time

33
00:02:01.356 --> 00:02:02.332
>> Right, so let go.

34
00:02:02.332 --> 00:02:02.968
>> Okay.

35
00:02:02.968 --> 00:02:07.403
>> So we created a line segment right
here, just a portion of a line,

36
00:02:07.403 --> 00:02:09.835
and it's very boring, straight.

37
00:02:09.835 --> 00:02:13.623
>> [LAUGH]
>> So let's undo, I'll hit Ctrl+Z, or

38
00:02:13.623 --> 00:02:18.631
Cmd+Z on a Mac, and then step
back one more time by Ctrl+Alt+Z.

39
00:02:18.631 --> 00:02:22.919
And then now, let's do the same thing,
but a perfectly straight version of it.

40
00:02:22.919 --> 00:02:25.892
So click once, let go.

41
00:02:25.892 --> 00:02:29.199
Then I'll hold Shift, and
then click at the ending point.

42
00:02:29.199 --> 00:02:30.329
This is a straight line.

43
00:02:30.329 --> 00:02:34.352
Just holding shift constrains the-
>> So even if you were off,

44
00:02:34.352 --> 00:02:37.529
if you were trying to draw that horizontal
line, that Shift constrained it.

45
00:02:37.529 --> 00:02:38.460
>> Exactly.
>> Okay.

46
00:02:38.460 --> 00:02:41.325
>> So let's take another step in this, and

47
00:02:41.325 --> 00:02:46.315
I'll just back out once, undo once,
and now I'm gonna make a curve.

48
00:02:46.315 --> 00:02:48.164
So when you make a curve,

49
00:02:48.164 --> 00:02:53.020
essentially you're creating
something called a Bezier curve.

50
00:02:53.020 --> 00:02:58.150
So let me click my ending point, what I'm
gonna do, I'm gonna click, hold, and drag.

51
00:02:58.150 --> 00:02:59.694
So here we'll go.

52
00:02:59.694 --> 00:03:04.100
Click, then now I drag around, and
you see it's adding a curve to that line.

53
00:03:05.820 --> 00:03:06.740
>> Very cool.

54
00:03:06.740 --> 00:03:08.430
>> Very cool indeed.

55
00:03:08.430 --> 00:03:10.978
Being a Bezier curve,
it's very mathematical and

56
00:03:10.978 --> 00:03:13.654
all the calculations are going
on in the background.

57
00:03:13.654 --> 00:03:18.663
Very complicated thing, but with these
handles, we can modify the curve.

58
00:03:18.663 --> 00:03:22.557
So here I let go of the curve so
now it's what you see.

59
00:03:22.557 --> 00:03:25.691
And I can modify the anchor
points on to the left and

60
00:03:25.691 --> 00:03:28.234
right of the main points that I clicked.

61
00:03:28.234 --> 00:03:33.319
So I can do that by holding Shift on
my pen tool, or on my keyboard, and

62
00:03:33.319 --> 00:03:38.705
then I can just drag a handle and
you see it's moving the existing curve.

63
00:03:38.705 --> 00:03:41.348
So if I was drawing a shape and
I was a little off,

64
00:03:41.348 --> 00:03:45.332
I could use these handles to tweak it and
correct it to how I want it to be.

65
00:03:45.332 --> 00:03:45.981
>> Nice.

66
00:03:45.981 --> 00:03:50.104
And with this tool, you seem to get a nice
perfect curve, whereas if I try to do it

67
00:03:50.104 --> 00:03:53.505
freehand with a brush or
something like that, maybe not so good.

68
00:03:53.505 --> 00:03:54.670
>> Exactly.

69
00:03:54.670 --> 00:03:59.010
So right now, I'm gonna show you
how to create a better selection or

70
00:03:59.010 --> 00:04:01.130
a more accurate selection
with the pen tool.

71
00:04:01.130 --> 00:04:04.742
So let's take a look at this, and what
we're gonna do for this is we're gonna

72
00:04:04.742 --> 00:04:07.985
type a letter, and then select
the letter and create a path out of it.

73
00:04:07.985 --> 00:04:13.160
So first thing's first, we need to work
on finishing up our existing path.

74
00:04:13.160 --> 00:04:19.739
Well, to complete a path,
I'll create a few more pieces and

75
00:04:19.739 --> 00:04:24.899
then, once you hover
over the starting point,

76
00:04:24.899 --> 00:04:29.042
you will see a circle on your pen tool.

77
00:04:29.042 --> 00:04:31.491
When you do this, if you click on it,
it will finish the path.

78
00:04:31.491 --> 00:04:34.842
Very similar to polygonal lasso tool and
creating those paths.

79
00:04:34.842 --> 00:04:36.651
The selections, sorry.

80
00:04:36.651 --> 00:04:44.924
So now we have completed path here which
we could view in the paths window.

81
00:04:44.924 --> 00:04:49.565
So if we want to delete this path
because we're done with it right now,

82
00:04:49.565 --> 00:04:54.439
we could go to, in the path window,
click on select path right there, and

83
00:04:54.439 --> 00:04:58.315
then go to the trash can on
the bottom right, right there.

84
00:04:58.315 --> 00:05:01.870
>> Or, you can just select it,
either in the paths window, and

85
00:05:01.870 --> 00:05:04.690
then hit delete, on the keyboard.

86
00:05:04.690 --> 00:05:05.196
Gone.

87
00:05:05.196 --> 00:05:05.830
>> Easy.

88
00:05:05.830 --> 00:05:07.711
>> So, now we are back to a blank slate.

89
00:05:07.711 --> 00:05:12.315
>> So, what we're gonna do now is go
over creating a better, more accurate

90
00:05:12.315 --> 00:05:17.383
selection, and it's one of the more,
one of the applications on the pen tool.

91
00:05:17.383 --> 00:05:24.460
So we'll start with creating,
typing an O with the text tool.

92
00:05:24.460 --> 00:05:28.638
And then let's make it a little
bit bigger so it's easier to see.

93
00:05:32.200 --> 00:05:34.592
There we go.

94
00:05:34.592 --> 00:05:38.470
Now, let's change the color so
you'll be able to see the pen tool path.

95
00:05:38.470 --> 00:05:43.022
>> [LAUGH]
>> So I'll do that and go up to here and

96
00:05:43.022 --> 00:05:45.502
then change a nice yellow.

97
00:05:45.502 --> 00:05:46.672
Hopefully it's not hard on your eyes.

98
00:05:46.672 --> 00:05:49.256
>> [LAUGH]
>> All right.

99
00:05:49.256 --> 00:05:51.898
So, let's go back to our pen tool.

100
00:05:51.898 --> 00:05:53.209
There we go.

101
00:05:53.209 --> 00:05:55.273
And then, I'm gonna zoom in a little bit.

102
00:05:57.871 --> 00:05:59.326
That's too much.

103
00:05:59.326 --> 00:06:01.853
So, selecting with the pen tool, you wanna

104
00:06:01.853 --> 00:06:06.104
try to create the smoothest paths with
the least amount of anchor points.

105
00:06:06.104 --> 00:06:09.848
Just so you don't have jagged
paths going like this.

106
00:06:09.848 --> 00:06:12.240
It just will not create a smooth path.

107
00:06:12.240 --> 00:06:13.950
>> It will not be a very nice O.

108
00:06:13.950 --> 00:06:15.052
>> Exactly.

109
00:06:15.052 --> 00:06:16.973
I wanna back out of that.

110
00:06:16.973 --> 00:06:24.983
So, let's start off by clicking on the
left side of this O and, just click, done.

111
00:06:24.983 --> 00:06:29.719
Now I'm gonna go to the top, and then,
so we can get this little curve here,

112
00:06:29.719 --> 00:06:33.876
this top curve, and I will click and
hold and then start dragging.

113
00:06:33.876 --> 00:06:38.740
Dragging all around you can see only
one direction really kinda looks good,

114
00:06:38.740 --> 00:06:42.854
so I will be dragging clockwise,
you'll see I'm going right.

115
00:06:42.854 --> 00:06:48.161
So now, I'm gonna hold Shift to kind
of straighten out these anchor points,

116
00:06:48.161 --> 00:06:51.770
or these handles,
until it looks just about right.

117
00:06:51.770 --> 00:06:52.481
That looks good to me.

118
00:06:52.481 --> 00:06:53.585
>> Very nice.

119
00:06:53.585 --> 00:06:58.433
>> So, next one down, I'm gonna click
on the right side of this circle.

120
00:06:58.433 --> 00:07:00.035
And then I'll hold.

121
00:07:00.035 --> 00:07:06.989
Then go down a little bit just to
kind of make it very accurate.

122
00:07:06.989 --> 00:07:11.386
And, same thing with the bottom
at the six o'clock area.

123
00:07:11.386 --> 00:07:16.442
And then, when creating these,
you always want to create your path,

124
00:07:16.442 --> 00:07:22.112
or you mostly always wanna create your
path and drag it towards your next path.

125
00:07:22.112 --> 00:07:24.161
So the same direction.

126
00:07:24.161 --> 00:07:29.053
So that's why you see me going
clockwise with my selections.

127
00:07:29.053 --> 00:07:31.965
So now that's about right, there.

128
00:07:31.965 --> 00:07:35.918
And then to finish it off I can either
click here to finish the path, but

129
00:07:35.918 --> 00:07:39.080
you see it kind of chopped off
a piece of my circle there.

130
00:07:40.110 --> 00:07:42.522
So, let's-
>> Can we fix that?

131
00:07:42.522 --> 00:07:43.404
>> Yeah, let's fix that.

132
00:07:43.404 --> 00:07:45.038
So, I'm gonna undue this one.

133
00:07:45.038 --> 00:07:51.481
When you're completing a path,
I did not right here you'll see,

134
00:07:51.481 --> 00:07:55.402
if I drag right at the end, I can edit it.

135
00:07:55.402 --> 00:07:57.131
Let's go back one more time.

136
00:07:57.131 --> 00:08:00.933
How I did it before,
just clicking it, finish the path and

137
00:08:00.933 --> 00:08:05.744
it didn't have my right curves going
on with the handles, so if I click and

138
00:08:05.744 --> 00:08:10.966
hold, I can adjust the handles and then
once I release it, the path is compete.

139
00:08:10.966 --> 00:08:16.790
So let's go to the bottom
right area of this circle.

140
00:08:16.790 --> 00:08:18.550
See it's a little bit off.

141
00:08:18.550 --> 00:08:24.777
You see some white space between
the path and the yellow part.

142
00:08:24.777 --> 00:08:27.225
So let's edit this.

143
00:08:27.225 --> 00:08:31.833
With this we're going to
use the convert point tool.

144
00:08:31.833 --> 00:08:34.255
It's under the pen tool on the left side.

145
00:08:34.255 --> 00:08:35.303
You click and hold.

146
00:08:35.303 --> 00:08:38.517
You got the pen tool, free form pen tool,
add anchor point tool,

147
00:08:38.517 --> 00:08:41.037
delete anchor point tool,
and the convert point.

148
00:08:41.037 --> 00:08:42.975
So I click convert point.

149
00:08:42.975 --> 00:08:46.625
And then now, I see this point right here.

150
00:08:46.625 --> 00:08:50.913
Now this is your mouse, so
you see the big picture.

151
00:08:50.913 --> 00:08:52.296
There.

152
00:08:52.296 --> 00:08:54.066
So I'll click this.

153
00:08:54.066 --> 00:08:56.650
And I just lost my handles.

154
00:08:56.650 --> 00:08:59.000
So, if I clicked an held.

155
00:08:59.000 --> 00:09:04.148
So now I'm kind of resetting
each side of this.

156
00:09:04.148 --> 00:09:05.941
So I can edit it this way.

157
00:09:05.941 --> 00:09:11.811
But you see I still have one side of it as
a not as perfect yet as I want it to be.

158
00:09:11.811 --> 00:09:12.501
>> Mm-hm.

159
00:09:12.501 --> 00:09:17.435
>> So what I wanna do here is
select the part of the path

160
00:09:17.435 --> 00:09:21.913
between this point here and
this point here.

161
00:09:21.913 --> 00:09:27.945
So what I'll do, there's this arrow down
here, right below where the pen tool is.

162
00:09:27.945 --> 00:09:31.139
It's called the path selection tool.

163
00:09:31.139 --> 00:09:34.160
Below, or in that tool,
like a subtool for it,

164
00:09:34.160 --> 00:09:37.270
is the direct path,
the direct selection tool.

165
00:09:37.270 --> 00:09:41.573
This is what I can use to
select segments of the path.

166
00:09:41.573 --> 00:09:44.550
So, in this case,
I'll just click and drag.

167
00:09:44.550 --> 00:09:45.872
In the area where I want to edit.

168
00:09:45.872 --> 00:09:49.661
And you can see the handles that
are pertaining to the thing

169
00:09:49.661 --> 00:09:52.451
that I selected are being shown right now.

170
00:09:52.451 --> 00:09:57.867
Not the other sides, so with this, I can
actually edit these handles individually.

171
00:09:57.867 --> 00:09:58.698
>> I see.

172
00:09:58.698 --> 00:10:03.278
>> So it's good for
minor tweaking of your path.

173
00:10:03.278 --> 00:10:07.383
So, with this selection tool,
select that, and

174
00:10:07.383 --> 00:10:11.292
then I'll go back to my
convert point tool, and

175
00:10:11.292 --> 00:10:17.082
then I can tweak these just a little
bit on each side to make it perfect.

176
00:10:17.082 --> 00:10:18.288
There we go.

177
00:10:18.288 --> 00:10:22.222
So now it's pretty much
a perfect selection.

178
00:10:22.222 --> 00:10:26.588
>> A lot more accurate than you're gonna
get trying to use one of your other tools

179
00:10:26.588 --> 00:10:28.941
where you're creating line segments and

180
00:10:28.941 --> 00:10:33.056
you end up with a hexagon looking
selection or multi faceted selection.

181
00:10:33.056 --> 00:10:34.567
>> Definitely.
>> Nice smooth curve.

182
00:10:34.567 --> 00:10:40.122
>> Mm-hm, so that's really good for the
pen tool and what you can do with this,

183
00:10:40.122 --> 00:10:44.827
if you create logos you'll learn
about this in Illustrator, but

184
00:10:44.827 --> 00:10:48.418
Photoshop you can create
logos with vectors, and

185
00:10:48.418 --> 00:10:53.581
then also you could take these paths and
convert them to custom shapes.

186
00:10:53.581 --> 00:10:57.758
With the custom shapes you can use
the custom shape tool to make that shape

187
00:10:57.758 --> 00:11:01.336
as big as you want it to be, and
it will not be distorted at all.

188
00:11:01.336 --> 00:11:06.390
You won't have any quality loss,
cuz it's all vector based.

189
00:11:06.390 --> 00:11:07.280
>> Yeah, exactly.

190
00:11:07.280 --> 00:11:08.729
Like you said, it was vector, not pixels.

191
00:11:08.729 --> 00:11:09.266
>> Right.

192
00:11:09.266 --> 00:11:09.857
>> Or raster.

193
00:11:09.857 --> 00:11:15.405
>> Mm-hm, exactly, so back to our O.

194
00:11:15.405 --> 00:11:17.416
Now you see I have
the outer part of it done.

195
00:11:17.416 --> 00:11:19.729
Let's create the inner part, so

196
00:11:19.729 --> 00:11:24.684
I'll go to my path window in the bottom
right, and then I'll uncheck or

197
00:11:24.684 --> 00:11:29.239
unselect this path, just click in
the empty space of the window.

198
00:11:29.239 --> 00:11:33.200
And then I'll pull out the pen tool again,
there we go, and

199
00:11:33.200 --> 00:11:36.698
then let's do the same thing but
just on the inside.

200
00:11:36.698 --> 00:11:38.927
So I'll zoom in a little bit.

201
00:11:38.927 --> 00:11:44.065
And now with this, I'll show you
my way of doing the drawing paths,

202
00:11:44.065 --> 00:11:49.114
so I'll start off with the place
we started before, I'll click,

203
00:11:49.114 --> 00:11:54.642
and then I'm gonna add a little bit of
curve to it without even seeing it.

204
00:11:54.642 --> 00:11:57.410
I'm just kind of
pre-curving it if you will.

205
00:11:57.410 --> 00:11:59.184
>> Mm-hm [LAUGH] doing
a little guesstimate.

206
00:11:59.184 --> 00:12:00.069
>> Right.

207
00:12:00.069 --> 00:12:03.314
And I'm holding Shift while doing
this to show it's perfectly,

208
00:12:03.314 --> 00:12:05.027
it's going straight up and down.

209
00:12:05.027 --> 00:12:06.235
And I'll let go.

210
00:12:06.235 --> 00:12:07.695
Now I'll do the next one.

211
00:12:07.695 --> 00:12:08.770
Up at the top.

212
00:12:08.770 --> 00:12:09.324
Click.

213
00:12:09.324 --> 00:12:12.259
And then I'll hold Shift,
and then I'll drag it over.

214
00:12:14.256 --> 00:12:14.817
There we go.

215
00:12:14.817 --> 00:12:17.403
Let's do the third one, on the right side.

216
00:12:17.403 --> 00:12:22.674
Click, hold Shift,
drag down towards my next point.

217
00:12:22.674 --> 00:12:28.702
Then on the bottom, I'll click, hold,
and then hold Shift, and then drag left.

218
00:12:28.702 --> 00:12:30.246
There we go.

219
00:12:30.246 --> 00:12:35.452
And then next one, finally,
I'll close it off, I'll click.

220
00:12:35.452 --> 00:12:39.578
And now because I already did the handles
on that first one, the beginning,

221
00:12:39.578 --> 00:12:41.846
I don't really have to do them at the end.

222
00:12:41.846 --> 00:12:46.497
So that's what that beginning
kind of pre-curving was for.

223
00:12:46.497 --> 00:12:50.002
>> And this is where the experience
you have if you use the pen tool for

224
00:12:50.002 --> 00:12:51.826
several years and
>> you get a feel for

225
00:12:51.826 --> 00:12:54.037
where it's gonna go or
what you need to do.

226
00:12:54.037 --> 00:12:55.508
>> Exactly.

227
00:12:55.508 --> 00:13:01.085
So now I have this,
I think I lost my first path.

228
00:13:01.085 --> 00:13:05.813
All right, I appear to have lost my
first path, so this always happens,

229
00:13:05.813 --> 00:13:09.467
so this is a good time to show
more about the path window.

230
00:13:09.467 --> 00:13:11.739
>> Okay.
Let's drag this up here just so

231
00:13:11.739 --> 00:13:13.164
you can see it better.

232
00:13:13.164 --> 00:13:16.875
Paths, I'm gonna click,
this is how you would create a new layer,

233
00:13:16.875 --> 00:13:18.250
I'll create a new path.

234
00:13:18.250 --> 00:13:19.805
So I'll click it here.

235
00:13:19.805 --> 00:13:22.169
So now our path one is right there.

236
00:13:22.169 --> 00:13:27.907
I wanna select the existing
path that I have.

237
00:13:27.907 --> 00:13:30.103
I'll cut that with Ctrl+X.

238
00:13:30.103 --> 00:13:34.076
And then go into path one and paste it to
show that it's the path one that I have.

239
00:13:34.076 --> 00:13:39.305
I wanna name this one inner O.

240
00:13:39.305 --> 00:13:44.191
So now I wanna recreate the outer O,
but I'll do this much quicker,

241
00:13:44.191 --> 00:13:50.396
exactly how I did it before, I'll create
a new path here, I'll rename this outer O.

242
00:13:50.396 --> 00:13:54.977
And then let's create that quick quickly,
so outer O,

243
00:13:54.977 --> 00:13:57.714
here we go, here go, here we go.

244
00:13:59.946 --> 00:14:05.056
And then also holding the space bar while
you're working it's a way to pan around,

245
00:14:05.056 --> 00:14:07.620
very, very useful when using a pen tool.

246
00:14:10.981 --> 00:14:14.356
Yeah I can see we're going to spend a lot
of time zoomed in really close to be

247
00:14:14.356 --> 00:14:15.960
working with that kind of tool.

248
00:14:15.960 --> 00:14:16.619
>> Yes.
>> So being

249
00:14:16.619 --> 00:14:20.345
able to switch quickly to pan around, to
move a little bit over on your image and

250
00:14:20.345 --> 00:14:24.087
continue to select without actually
switching tools has gotta be very handy.

251
00:14:24.087 --> 00:14:25.455
>> Very handy.

252
00:14:25.455 --> 00:14:30.767
So I created the inner O, created
the outer O, now, I'll go to my layers and

253
00:14:30.767 --> 00:14:34.592
I will make this O,
the actual text layer O invisible.

254
00:14:34.592 --> 00:14:37.767
So you could see exactly what the path is.

255
00:14:37.767 --> 00:14:41.223
So I'll go back to the paths now and
then select both of them.

256
00:14:41.223 --> 00:14:43.327
Hold Ctrl and select the other one.

257
00:14:43.327 --> 00:14:47.400
So now this is the path that
I created using, I just.

258
00:14:47.400 --> 00:14:48.136
>> Looks like a perfect match.

259
00:14:48.136 --> 00:14:49.279
>> Exactly.

260
00:14:49.279 --> 00:14:55.910
So I recommend using text or
fonts and there's different letters.

261
00:14:55.910 --> 00:14:57.318
Very good practice.

262
00:14:57.318 --> 00:15:00.397
Very, cuz you have a ton of them there.

263
00:15:00.397 --> 00:15:01.592
So you might as well.

264
00:15:01.592 --> 00:15:02.785
It's free practice tools.

265
00:15:02.785 --> 00:15:06.301
>> [LAUGHTER]
>> Very, very cool

266
00:15:06.301 --> 00:15:07.301
>> Yeah.

267
00:15:07.301 --> 00:15:12.471
Then, now let's go for.

268
00:15:12.471 --> 00:15:17.942
Say we wanted to take this and
create a selection out of it.

269
00:15:17.942 --> 00:15:20.539
I'll just take the outer O right here.

270
00:15:20.539 --> 00:15:24.890
If you wanna create a selection out
of your path, say if you cut out

271
00:15:24.890 --> 00:15:29.797
something very very complex, and
you wanna create a selection out of it,

272
00:15:29.797 --> 00:15:34.017
say if you wanna do a border around it or
do some kind of masking.

273
00:15:34.017 --> 00:15:38.329
You could go to your path
selection tool right here,

274
00:15:38.329 --> 00:15:43.138
select your path,
right-click on it, make selection.

275
00:15:43.138 --> 00:15:48.301
Then you could change the feathering,
anti-aliasing in case, because

276
00:15:48.301 --> 00:15:54.213
the vectors are absolute, when you switch
to pixels it becomes a little more fuzzy,

277
00:15:54.213 --> 00:15:59.208
if you expand bigger, but with this
we're just gonna keep it at zero and

278
00:15:59.208 --> 00:16:05.400
you'll see it's a pretty good selection,
hard, there it is, see the marching ants?

279
00:16:05.400 --> 00:16:06.768
>> Mm-hm.

280
00:16:06.768 --> 00:16:11.164
So, if I wanted to go further I
could just put this on a layer and

281
00:16:11.164 --> 00:16:13.882
fill it, actually, let's do that.

282
00:16:13.882 --> 00:16:16.127
Create a new layer here.

283
00:16:16.127 --> 00:16:21.176
And I will fill this with my paint
bucket tool right there, black.

284
00:16:21.176 --> 00:16:22.708
>> Very cool.

285
00:16:22.708 --> 00:16:24.580
So you've got a lot of uses for
that pen tool.

286
00:16:24.580 --> 00:16:26.912
>> Yes.

287
00:16:26.912 --> 00:16:33.729
All right, so
now let's make this a little bit smaller.

288
00:16:33.729 --> 00:16:37.673
We're gonna do a little segue right here.

289
00:16:37.673 --> 00:16:38.925
Well, I'll just do a little more pen tool.

290
00:16:38.925 --> 00:16:41.357
Cuz I kinda like pen tool art here.

291
00:16:41.357 --> 00:16:44.680
While we're doing this, I'll show you,
what I mentioned earlier,

292
00:16:44.680 --> 00:16:47.324
the pen tool is not, like,
really drawn with a pen, but

293
00:16:47.324 --> 00:16:50.791
there is the free form pen tool,
which is like really drawing with a pen.

294
00:16:50.791 --> 00:16:55.003
So, just draw around,
create my own little path like this.

295
00:16:55.003 --> 00:16:58.507
And it just created all those
anchor points from what I just did.

296
00:16:58.507 --> 00:17:01.928
So, it's smart, but
it's really hard to use,

297
00:17:01.928 --> 00:17:07.366
if you're just trying to be really,
really accurate with your selections.

298
00:17:07.366 --> 00:17:13.142
All right, so
now let's do a quick thing here.

299
00:17:13.142 --> 00:17:16.434
I'll keep this circle here, for now, and

300
00:17:16.434 --> 00:17:22.301
I'm gonna draw a simple path below the
circle so lets go back to the pen tool.

301
00:17:22.301 --> 00:17:28.313
I'll take this, click there, and I'll
click down here and drag to the right,

302
00:17:28.313 --> 00:17:33.999
hold Shift while I do it to keep it level,
and then the next one I will click.

303
00:17:33.999 --> 00:17:35.437
Held shift.

304
00:17:35.437 --> 00:17:36.605
There.

305
00:17:36.605 --> 00:17:38.215
Then just click.

306
00:17:38.215 --> 00:17:40.126
So now I have this little smooth path.

307
00:17:40.126 --> 00:17:42.744
It's kind of like a,
I think of a smiley face with one eye.

308
00:17:42.744 --> 00:17:45.078
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] And what I'm gonna do here.

309
00:17:45.078 --> 00:17:47.398
>> Cyclops' can be happy too
>> Exactly.

310
00:17:47.398 --> 00:17:51.325
So I'm gonna take the text tool,
and the paths are really cool,

311
00:17:51.325 --> 00:17:55.557
because you can take the text tool and
then just write along the path.

312
00:17:55.557 --> 00:18:02.523
So I change my text down a little bit,
and then I just say, smile.

313
00:18:02.523 --> 00:18:03.497
>> Very cool.

314
00:18:03.497 --> 00:18:07.614
>> And then I can adjust,
using my direct selection tool,

315
00:18:07.614 --> 00:18:11.919
I can adjust the position of
this there we go, of the text.

316
00:18:11.919 --> 00:18:18.223
And now, it's kind of hard to see,
so let me just change that up.

317
00:18:18.223 --> 00:18:20.279
There.

318
00:18:20.279 --> 00:18:24.419
So you can type along the path, that's
a very useful trick of the pen tool.

319
00:18:24.419 --> 00:18:27.588
>> So the arc doesn't actually stay there,
it just acts as a guide to the text.

320
00:18:27.588 --> 00:18:28.212
>> Exactly.

321
00:18:28.212 --> 00:18:29.582
Very cool, right?

322
00:18:29.582 --> 00:18:32.527
So, that's about it for right now,

323
00:18:32.527 --> 00:18:38.423
we're gonna continue on our next episode,
to further our drawing here.

324
00:18:38.423 --> 00:18:40.573
>> [LAUGH] All right, very good,
Nick we appreciate that,

325
00:18:40.573 --> 00:18:42.188
great demonstration with that pen tool.

326
00:18:42.188 --> 00:18:44.060
>> As Nick said it's a complex tool,

327
00:18:44.060 --> 00:18:46.913
it takes a little bit of
practice getting used to it.

328
00:18:46.913 --> 00:18:49.921
So do like Nick did,
break out just some of your fonts and

329
00:18:49.921 --> 00:18:54.021
start tracing, get used to the feel of
dragging those Bezier handles out and

330
00:18:54.021 --> 00:18:57.055
getting those curves to match
your letters just right.

331
00:18:57.055 --> 00:19:00.195
All right we appreciate that hope
everybody out there enjoyed watching.

332
00:19:00.195 --> 00:19:02.723
Signing off for ITProTV, I'm Mike Rodrick.

333
00:19:02.723 --> 00:19:03.440
>> And I'm Nick Page.

334
00:19:03.440 --> 00:19:05.491
>> And we'll see you next time.

335
00:19:05.491 --> 00:19:13.819
>> [MUSIC]

episodes.title: Pens, Puppets and Channels Part 2
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.036 --> 00:00:10.036
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.058 --> 00:00:15.022
Hello, and welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.022 --> 00:00:20.000
I'm your host, Mike Rodrick, and
today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC2015.

4
00:00:20.000 --> 00:00:24.589
And specifically in this episode, we're
gonna be looking at the pen, puppet and

5
00:00:24.589 --> 00:00:27.660
channels, and
this is actually is gonna be a part two.

6
00:00:27.660 --> 00:00:31.670
We've already started and we've worked our
way through some of the options that we

7
00:00:31.670 --> 00:00:34.650
can do with the Pen tool, and
we're just gonna continue on.

8
00:00:34.650 --> 00:00:37.240
So if you missed part one, make sure
you go back and watch that first,

9
00:00:37.240 --> 00:00:41.200
otherwise let's just dive right back
in with none other than Mr. Nick Page.

10
00:00:41.200 --> 00:00:41.910
How you doing Nick?

11
00:00:41.910 --> 00:00:44.070
>> Pretty good,
ready to continue this lesson.

12
00:00:44.070 --> 00:00:48.250
So right here, I'm gonna start
exactly where we left off at.

13
00:00:48.250 --> 00:00:53.670
So you see we have our big circle on
the top, and then a smile below it.

14
00:00:53.670 --> 00:00:56.960
So I'm gonna do, I'm gonna kind of
move smile out of the way for now.

15
00:00:56.960 --> 00:00:59.530
We're not really interested
in smiling just yet.

16
00:00:59.530 --> 00:01:01.446
You'll smile at the final product,
don't worry.

17
00:01:01.446 --> 00:01:05.357
>> [LAUGH]
>> So I'll need to make that invisible.

18
00:01:05.357 --> 00:01:09.405
So what I'm gonna do,
I'm gonna start drawing something for you.

19
00:01:10.665 --> 00:01:14.904
And also show another use of the pen or
paths in general.

20
00:01:14.904 --> 00:01:15.689
>> Okay.

21
00:01:15.689 --> 00:01:17.590
>> So what I'm gonna do is
I'm gonna go to the Pen tool.

22
00:01:17.590 --> 00:01:19.709
And I will zoom out just a little bit.

23
00:01:22.473 --> 00:01:26.964
And then I wanna start by drawing
a path starting at the top here and

24
00:01:26.964 --> 00:01:29.180
then hold Space to scroll down.

25
00:01:30.190 --> 00:01:34.120
And then I'll hold Shift and
then click that.

26
00:01:34.120 --> 00:01:35.935
That's about right.

27
00:01:35.935 --> 00:01:38.880
S, just a line, a simple line.
