00:14:35.517 --> 00:14:38.470
You could see then the green
is kind of in the middle.

261
00:14:39.550 --> 00:14:45.440
So it's a cool way to see the almost
a heat map of the colors in your picture.

262
00:14:45.440 --> 00:14:51.130
And that's really, you can,
it makes for some cool effects.

263
00:14:51.130 --> 00:14:54.540
And you could also beautiful one.

264
00:14:54.540 --> 00:14:58.400
And if you were in a different image mode,
so this is RGB image.

265
00:14:58.400 --> 00:14:59.790
>> Right.
>> If I was doing a CMYK,

266
00:14:59.790 --> 00:15:02.680
I would have a cyan,
magenta, yellow and black.

267
00:15:02.680 --> 00:15:04.340
>> So,
you'd have all four of those channels.

268
00:15:04.340 --> 00:15:06.500
>> Yep.
>> Plus a complete one that was CMYK.

269
00:15:06.500 --> 00:15:07.250
>> Exactly.

270
00:15:07.250 --> 00:15:07.940
>> Cool.

271
00:15:07.940 --> 00:15:10.857
>> So
now I can also take some channels out, so

272
00:15:10.857 --> 00:15:14.594
if I want to take all the red
out of the picture, no red.

273
00:15:14.594 --> 00:15:15.274
>> Ooh.

274
00:15:15.274 --> 00:15:17.202
>> If I wanna take all
the blue out of the picture,

275
00:15:17.202 --> 00:15:19.389
it'll probably look pretty interesting,
there.

276
00:15:19.389 --> 00:15:20.057
>> [LAUGH].

277
00:15:20.057 --> 00:15:22.692
>> And
then if I only want the red channel to go,

278
00:15:22.692 --> 00:15:26.410
you could choose the different
combinations of everything.

279
00:15:27.490 --> 00:15:27.990
>> I see.

280
00:15:29.180 --> 00:15:29.912
>> There's a good one.

281
00:15:29.912 --> 00:15:34.962
>> [LAUGH]
>> And, if you want to,

282
00:15:34.962 --> 00:15:38.582
you could just adjust.

283
00:15:38.582 --> 00:15:41.203
You can't combine them with the full
one because the full one will just have

284
00:15:41.203 --> 00:15:41.796
all the colors.

285
00:15:41.796 --> 00:15:42.349
>> Right.

286
00:15:42.349 --> 00:15:45.167
>> So that is a quick look at channels.

287
00:15:45.167 --> 00:15:47.745
>> So primarily just a way to
view where the colors are,

288
00:15:47.745 --> 00:15:50.626
not a lot as far as editing or
making use of those channels?

289
00:15:50.626 --> 00:15:52.494
>> You can make use of them in this case.

290
00:15:52.494 --> 00:15:55.042
I'll show you a quick example of.

291
00:15:55.042 --> 00:15:57.633
What I've used channels for, for a while.

292
00:15:57.633 --> 00:16:00.942
It's specific photo editing stuff.

293
00:16:00.942 --> 00:16:04.987
So, we'll come back to this peacock
in one of the later episodes.

294
00:16:04.987 --> 00:16:07.090
>> Okay.
>> So, let's exit this guy right now.

295
00:16:07.090 --> 00:16:07.790
Hey, it's our guy.

296
00:16:07.790 --> 00:16:10.150
So let's go to File > Open.

297
00:16:11.350 --> 00:16:13.590
And then I'll open smoked up JPEG.

298
00:16:13.590 --> 00:16:16.380
>> Okay, here's a picture of smoke.

299
00:16:16.380 --> 00:16:18.270
Just smoke on a black background.

300
00:16:18.270 --> 00:16:19.852
It may have some
imperfections in it you see.

301
00:16:19.852 --> 00:16:24.040
You can probably see it,
it's a little lighter on the left side.

302
00:16:24.040 --> 00:16:25.560
It's not a perfectly black background.

303
00:16:26.800 --> 00:16:32.360
So, one thing when I was doing smoke
photography, I always wanted to be able

304
00:16:32.360 --> 00:16:37.820
to extract that smoke from the background,
because setting it up was a real big job.

305
00:16:37.820 --> 00:16:41.671
So, I wanted to get the best picture
possible, so I want to take that smoke and

306
00:16:41.671 --> 00:16:45.170
put it on a black background so
that I can do cool effects with it.

307
00:16:45.170 --> 00:16:48.280
>> I can imagine trying to select like
that with the tools we've learned about so

308
00:16:48.280 --> 00:16:49.510
far could be a challenge.

309
00:16:49.510 --> 00:16:51.400
>> Exactly.
Yes, definitely.

310
00:16:51.400 --> 00:16:53.980
So, a really quick and
easy way to do this,

311
00:16:53.980 --> 00:16:59.180
it's not 100% perfect, but it's a much
better way than using anything else.

312
00:16:59.180 --> 00:17:02.778
So, you see here I have
my Background layer.

313
00:17:02.778 --> 00:17:08.110
If I wanna select it, I'll just hold
control, then I'll first unlock it.

314
00:17:08.110 --> 00:17:10.470
Hold control, then click on thumbnail.

315
00:17:10.470 --> 00:17:12.110
It selects the entire rectangle.

316
00:17:12.110 --> 00:17:13.840
I don't want that.

317
00:17:13.840 --> 00:17:15.620
I only want the smoke part.

318
00:17:15.620 --> 00:17:18.120
So I could use some of
the selection tools.

319
00:17:18.120 --> 00:17:19.711
The pen tool won't even cut it this time.

320
00:17:19.711 --> 00:17:21.791
>> [LAUGH]
>> Unless I wanted to be here for

321
00:17:21.791 --> 00:17:25.670
a few more years, but so
what I'll do is go to the channels.

322
00:17:25.670 --> 00:17:27.560
Now, let's view each
individual channel here.

323
00:17:27.560 --> 00:17:29.380
Let's go to red.

324
00:17:29.380 --> 00:17:31.480
They all look similar.

325
00:17:31.480 --> 00:17:33.390
Blue being a little bit more bright,

326
00:17:33.390 --> 00:17:36.716
because if you can see it,
the whole thing has a blue tint to it.

327
00:17:36.716 --> 00:17:38.520
>> A blue hue, yeah.

328
00:17:38.520 --> 00:17:41.690
>> So what I'm gonna do is
select the darkest one.

329
00:17:41.690 --> 00:17:44.300
This is a really,
it doesn't matter which one you select,

330
00:17:44.300 --> 00:17:47.900
you'll get the same results
either way pretty much.

331
00:17:47.900 --> 00:17:50.030
But in this case, I'm gonna go with
the darkest one because I wanna

332
00:17:50.030 --> 00:17:51.289
put it on a solid black background.

333
00:17:52.450 --> 00:17:55.770
So I'll hold Ctrl and
click on thumbnail this.

334
00:17:55.770 --> 00:17:59.660
That selects only the red
channel throughout this.

335
00:17:59.660 --> 00:18:06.785
So, now I can press Ctrl+C or
Cmd+C on the keyboard to copy that.

336
00:18:06.785 --> 00:18:11.400
Then I'll go to my layers window,
I'll create a new layer

337
00:18:12.870 --> 00:18:17.230
and then I will Ctrl+V to paste it.

338
00:18:17.230 --> 00:18:22.360
So, I'll make the original invisible so
you can see or not see.

339
00:18:22.360 --> 00:18:27.160
So that's, you can see it's a little bit-
>> I can see it there, yeah.

340
00:18:27.160 --> 00:18:27.970
>> It's there.

341
00:18:27.970 --> 00:18:30.230
It's just very smokey, if you will.

342
00:18:30.230 --> 00:18:33.030
Let's create a new layer below that, and

343
00:18:33.030 --> 00:18:36.460
then I'll fill that in
just with a paint bucket.

344
00:18:36.460 --> 00:18:37.190
Black.

345
00:18:37.190 --> 00:18:39.710
So now,
we have our smoke on a black background.

346
00:18:39.710 --> 00:18:42.120
>> On a perfectly black background now.

347
00:18:42.120 --> 00:18:42.970
>> Somewhat perfectly.

348
00:18:42.970 --> 00:18:45.880
Visually, it's perfect right now.

349
00:18:45.880 --> 00:18:50.110
But if I wanted to edit this, I can
hold control, click on the thumbnail,

350
00:18:50.110 --> 00:18:53.050
make that selection again and
then I'm gonna add some cool colors to it.

351
00:18:53.050 --> 00:18:55.870
So, I'll hold on my paint bucket,
go to the gradient.

352
00:18:57.160 --> 00:19:01.460
And I've selected this
really cool rainbow there.

353
00:19:01.460 --> 00:19:04.320
And now,
I'll make this on a new layer, just so

354
00:19:04.320 --> 00:19:06.570
I don't mess up any layers below it.

355
00:19:06.570 --> 00:19:08.871
And I'll just click from the bottom
left and drag to the top right.

356
00:19:10.667 --> 00:19:11.310
>> Wow.

357
00:19:11.310 --> 00:19:12.450
>> Cool effect, right there.

358
00:19:12.450 --> 00:19:16.230
But you can see it's not perfectly black,

359
00:19:16.230 --> 00:19:20.170
because it kinda changed part of
the background to be multicolored.

360
00:19:20.170 --> 00:19:25.406
So to fix this, it's just a simple, pull
out your eraser, and go to town on it.

361
00:19:25.406 --> 00:19:26.380
>> Okay.
>> So, that's easy.

362
00:19:26.380 --> 00:19:27.520
Just clean it up.

363
00:19:27.520 --> 00:19:31.640
And being that it's only a color layer,
it's really,

364
00:19:31.640 --> 00:19:33.760
if you mess up it's not noticeable.

365
00:19:33.760 --> 00:19:37.960
I could just do that, and you can
barely see the lack of color there.

366
00:19:37.960 --> 00:19:39.805
So, I'll clean that up.

367
00:19:39.805 --> 00:19:43.950
Aand then right now I
have my colorful smoke.

368
00:19:43.950 --> 00:19:46.160
Say I wanted to change
the background to white.

369
00:19:46.160 --> 00:19:51.580
I can just click on the background layer,
hold Ctrl, press I.

370
00:19:51.580 --> 00:19:53.990
Change that, and
now it's looking really bright.

371
00:19:53.990 --> 00:19:58.080
So, I can actually
manipulate this further.

372
00:19:58.080 --> 00:20:00.750
Let me invert the original smoke.

373
00:20:00.750 --> 00:20:03.370
So having fun with this,
just doing different things,

374
00:20:03.370 --> 00:20:07.100
inverting certain layers and
you can have some really cool effects.

375
00:20:07.100 --> 00:20:11.322
And I have this really neat looking
multicolored smoke on a white background

376
00:20:11.322 --> 00:20:11.864
now.

377
00:20:11.864 --> 00:20:14.170
So, it looks way more abstract this way.

378
00:20:14.170 --> 00:20:16.410
It's a pretty cool effect, so.

379
00:20:16.410 --> 00:20:17.060
>> Very good.

380
00:20:17.060 --> 00:20:23.642
>> Yeah, and then, to tie this all in with
the pen tool, let's just create a path.

381
00:20:23.642 --> 00:20:25.036
Pen tool.

382
00:20:25.036 --> 00:20:30.180
Let's do a simple circle.

383
00:20:30.180 --> 00:20:31.960
Let's do, well, circles are boring.

384
00:20:31.960 --> 00:20:33.460
Let's do a crazy shape.

385
00:20:33.460 --> 00:20:38.044
Something like this, then let's move.

386
00:20:46.380 --> 00:20:49.144
It's a crazy,
I don't even know what to call this shape.

387
00:20:51.625 --> 00:20:52.419
There we go.

388
00:20:52.419 --> 00:20:54.040
So now I have a shape there, a path.

389
00:20:55.250 --> 00:20:58.580
Kind of difficult to see, but
I'll put it right in this area.

390
00:20:58.580 --> 00:21:02.885
What I can do, I'll right-click on here,
and then do something.

391
00:21:02.885 --> 00:21:04.710
Create a vector mask.

392
00:21:04.710 --> 00:21:08.360
Just like a clipping mask,
just like a layer mask, but with vectors.

393
00:21:09.400 --> 00:21:13.430
So now,
you see only a portion of this is colored.

394
00:21:13.430 --> 00:21:16.060
So this kinda ties
everything back together.

395
00:21:16.060 --> 00:21:17.390
>> Very cool.

396
00:21:17.390 --> 00:21:18.230
All right, Nick.

397
00:21:18.230 --> 00:21:22.500
A very good look at some of the more
complex things we can do inside Photoshop.

398
00:21:22.500 --> 00:21:24.440
We took a look at the,
in the previous episode, or

399
00:21:24.440 --> 00:21:27.990
part one, we saw a really
good look at that pen tool.

400
00:21:27.990 --> 00:21:32.640
And then, in this episode, we've worked
our through our, let's see, the puppet.

401
00:21:32.640 --> 00:21:35.280
I mean, how can we forget
the dancing stick figure?

402
00:21:35.280 --> 00:21:37.930
And then,
taking a look at channels and some

403
00:21:37.930 --> 00:21:41.590
of the really cool effects we can come
up if we work with that channels panel.

404
00:21:41.590 --> 00:21:42.530
So, we thank you for that Nick.

405
00:21:42.530 --> 00:21:43.820
Great demonstrations.

406
00:21:43.820 --> 00:21:45.530
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

407
00:21:45.530 --> 00:21:47.840
Signing out for ITProTV, I'm Mike Rodrick.

408
00:21:47.840 --> 00:21:49.228
>> And I'm Nick Page.

409
00:21:49.228 --> 00:21:55.580
>> And we'll see you next time.

410
00:21:55.580 --> 00:21:58.360
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Try It Out! Pen Tool
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.885 --> 00:00:15.465
Hello and welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.465 --> 00:00:20.408
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and
today we are doing Adobe Photoshop CC2015.

4
00:00:20.408 --> 00:00:24.560
And specifically in this episode it's time
for another one of those try-it-outs.

5
00:00:24.560 --> 00:00:27.440
In this on we are gonna be
using the good old pen tool.

6
00:00:27.440 --> 00:00:29.210
Here to help us with that is Mr.
Nick Page.

7
00:00:29.210 --> 00:00:30.140
How are you doing, Nick?

8
00:00:30.140 --> 00:00:32.290
>> Pretty good,
very excited to do this pen tool.

9
00:00:32.290 --> 00:00:37.010
So let's dive right into Photoshop,
and let's start off.

10
00:00:37.010 --> 00:00:39.760
So I'm gonna go to Photoshop,
and then I'll go to File > Open.

11
00:00:39.760 --> 00:00:42.670
And then I'm gonna open the peacock,

12
00:00:42.670 --> 00:00:45.500
that we saw in the last episode,
very friendly guy.

13
00:00:45.500 --> 00:00:50.640
What we're gonna do here,
is try to trace out part of him.

14
00:00:50.640 --> 00:00:53.878
I particularly am fond
of this blue body parts.

15
00:00:53.878 --> 00:00:57.139
So we will see how this works, for

16
00:00:57.139 --> 00:01:00.661
your viewing pleasure I guess
>> [LAUGH]

17
00:01:00.661 --> 00:01:03.006
>> I will be putting a bit of white paint

18
00:01:03.006 --> 00:01:07.456
on top of it just so you can see
the stroke a lot easier of the pen tool,

19
00:01:07.456 --> 00:01:09.821
you'll see what I mean in a second.

20
00:01:09.821 --> 00:01:12.830
So first I'll unlock the peacock layer.

21
00:01:12.830 --> 00:01:16.460
And then let me just start
by doing a pen tool sample.

22
00:01:16.460 --> 00:01:21.080
So that is what you would normally have.

23
00:01:21.080 --> 00:01:22.750
You cannot see that at all.

24
00:01:22.750 --> 00:01:27.110
So I will make this little edit for you.

25
00:01:27.110 --> 00:01:31.700
Not necessary on your end just so
you can see what I am doing.

26
00:01:32.700 --> 00:01:34.390
I'll just scribble a bunch of light here.

27
00:01:34.390 --> 00:01:36.980
And then change the opacity down so

28
00:01:36.980 --> 00:01:41.660
now we could see the peacock and
we could see the line a little bit better.

29
00:01:41.660 --> 00:01:44.970
>> Very clever, could actually be
useful when you're trying to do a photo

30
00:01:44.970 --> 00:01:47.550
that's got a lot of or
not a lot of contrast there.

31
00:01:47.550 --> 00:01:52.140
>> Definitely, so
I'm gonna go back and undo this.

32
00:01:52.140 --> 00:01:54.700
No, can't undo that.

33
00:01:54.700 --> 00:01:55.600
Let's redo this.

34
00:01:56.690 --> 00:02:00.430
Now I'll delete this path that I just
created and actually, there we go,

35
00:02:00.430 --> 00:02:02.300
select it, and then hit delete.

36
00:02:02.300 --> 00:02:04.100
So back to the Pen tool.

37
00:02:04.100 --> 00:02:09.520
Now looking at an image like this,
it's very complex.

38
00:02:09.520 --> 00:02:11.900
You don't really know where to start.

39
00:02:11.900 --> 00:02:14.340
And where to start is
completely up to you, but

40
00:02:14.340 --> 00:02:17.090
usually I like to start
on part of a curve.

41
00:02:18.620 --> 00:02:22.070
But it really doesn't matter,
it's more you use the pen tool,

42
00:02:22.070 --> 00:02:27.330
you'll develop favorite places on
what style, what contour to start at.

43
00:02:27.330 --> 00:02:31.275
So in this case, I also like to start on
the left side if you haven't noticed.

44
00:02:31.275 --> 00:02:33.170
>> [LAUGH]
>> I'll start on the left side.

45
00:02:33.170 --> 00:02:35.149
Click, let me zoom in a little bit.

46
00:02:36.660 --> 00:02:37.160
Oops sorry.

47
00:02:39.210 --> 00:02:43.420
Okay, Ill click right here,
starting point.

48
00:02:43.420 --> 00:02:45.980
Now I will look at the,

49
00:02:45.980 --> 00:02:52.640
how this peacocks neck goes up and
lets start with this first curve here.

50
00:02:52.640 --> 00:02:56.260
So I'll probably bring it
up to just about here and

51
00:02:56.260 --> 00:02:58.000
then start manipulating my handles.

52
00:02:59.300 --> 00:03:00.790
Until it looks just about right.

53
00:03:00.790 --> 00:03:03.390
That looks good to me.

54
00:03:03.390 --> 00:03:07.630
There we go and when you see it do
that I'm kind of setting up for

55
00:03:07.630 --> 00:03:09.760
my next anchor point.

56
00:03:09.760 --> 00:03:12.170
Because now if I just click here you

57
00:03:12.170 --> 00:03:16.550
see it kind of pretty much
makes that what I wanted to be.

58
00:03:16.550 --> 00:03:17.970
That's not always the case.

59
00:03:19.170 --> 00:03:24.310
I'll show you later on but this one let
me zoom it a little more so you can see

60
00:03:24.310 --> 00:03:31.350
it a little better and then change its
opacity of this guy just, there we go.

61
00:03:32.660 --> 00:03:35.470
So I'll make the next point right here.

62
00:03:35.470 --> 00:03:39.420
See it's a little bit off but I'm just
gonna, when you're still holding and

63
00:03:39.420 --> 00:03:43.610
while you're able to drag your handles.

64
00:03:43.610 --> 00:03:46.880
I can hold the space bar while
I'm still holding the mouse and

65
00:03:46.880 --> 00:03:49.880
float that anchor point, so I could.

66
00:03:49.880 --> 00:03:51.560
>> So you click just a little bit off.

67
00:03:51.560 --> 00:03:53.540
You can actually move the point and

68
00:03:53.540 --> 00:03:55.400
still work with the handles
all at the same time.

69
00:03:55.400 --> 00:03:55.900
>> Exactly.

70
00:03:55.900 --> 00:03:58.110
>> Wow.
>> So now you see this,

71
00:03:58.110 --> 00:04:02.080
I can't really get this to go
how I want it to because of that

72
00:04:02.080 --> 00:04:06.410
handle on the right side that are staying
there so let's put it as close as I can so

73
00:04:06.410 --> 00:04:11.080
I'll start right here and
then I'm gonna edit this handle.

74
00:04:11.080 --> 00:04:15.500
Usually I'll go to the convert point tool
but being that we want to kind of learn

75
00:04:15.500 --> 00:04:20.590
a little bit more about the pen
tool I want to use the pen tool.

76
00:04:20.590 --> 00:04:23.860
So pen tool has a lot of shortcuts to it.

77
00:04:23.860 --> 00:04:28.550
If you hold Ctrl, it would get
you to the direct selection tool.

78
00:04:30.280 --> 00:04:32.588
So holding Ctrl brings you to that.

79
00:04:32.588 --> 00:04:38.330
And then holding Alt will change
it to the convert point tool.

80
00:04:39.790 --> 00:04:42.710
So it's if you wanna make your edits
on the fly without having to switch

81
00:04:42.710 --> 00:04:44.070
tools, and.

82
00:04:44.070 --> 00:04:44.820
>> Very convenient.

83
00:04:44.820 --> 00:04:45.348
>> Very convenient.

84
00:04:45.348 --> 00:04:48.361
So I'll be doing a lot of that and
whenever I'd do it I'll say

85
00:04:48.361 --> 00:04:52.084
I'm holding alt and changing or
holding control or holding shift, just so

86
00:04:52.084 --> 00:04:55.360
you can see and visualize what
I'm doing to see what's going on.

87
00:04:55.360 --> 00:05:01.230
So I'm going to convert this
point a little bit, so hold Alt.

88
00:05:01.230 --> 00:05:05.123
Then drag it up a little,
drag it down a little bit,

89
00:05:05.123 --> 00:05:08.130
just to kinda fit that curve properly.

90
00:05:08.130 --> 00:05:09.640
So now let's go to the next point.

91
00:05:09.640 --> 00:05:12.940
Let's go right about here,
and see what happens.

92
00:05:12.940 --> 00:05:17.650
Oops, I still have this,
this portion selected.

93
00:05:17.650 --> 00:05:22.030
So need to select whether that before
right there so I'm clicking on that.

94
00:05:24.030 --> 00:05:26.000
Let me see if that works.

95
00:05:26.000 --> 00:05:27.858
It still didn't work.

96
00:05:27.858 --> 00:05:32.138
Let's go to direct.

97
00:05:32.138 --> 00:05:34.958
Is that going to work?

98
00:05:34.958 --> 00:05:35.898
Nope.

99
00:05:35.898 --> 00:05:39.280
Sometimes you'll see this problem if
you kind of left off your path and

100
00:05:39.280 --> 00:05:40.635
you wanna get back onto it.

101
00:05:40.635 --> 00:05:42.090
>> Mm-hm.

102
00:05:42.090 --> 00:05:43.725
>> Just that, that work.

103
00:05:43.725 --> 00:05:44.722
There we go.

104
00:05:44.722 --> 00:05:48.070
If you have your pen tool you wanna
click on that last path you did and

105
00:05:48.070 --> 00:05:52.310
you would see a hold on and I'll show you.

106
00:05:52.310 --> 00:05:58.950
You see this little
circle with a square and

107
00:05:58.950 --> 00:06:02.910
a line through it right there,
on the bottom right of the pen logo.

108
00:06:02.910 --> 00:06:05.460
That means it will kind of

109
00:06:05.460 --> 00:06:09.650
create your path your start from
this point continue exactly.

110
00:06:09.650 --> 00:06:14.460
So let's go on to our next
piece That's right about here.

111
00:06:14.460 --> 00:06:19.920
So I'll click, and then drag it to kind
of make it look a little nice like that.

112
00:06:19.920 --> 00:06:23.350
And then as I'm going through
I'm gonna probably edit

113
00:06:23.350 --> 00:06:25.840
this back piece just a little
bit just to kinda fit it more.

114
00:06:25.840 --> 00:06:31.480
So hold Alt and adjust this a little
further then go back up to here.

115
00:06:31.480 --> 00:06:32.960
Take the next point.

116
00:06:32.960 --> 00:06:35.990
There we go.
And then I'll zoom in so

117
00:06:35.990 --> 00:06:38.250
we can see this a little more clearly.

118
00:06:41.330 --> 00:06:45.220
Let me hold that Ctrl here and
just move it a little bit.

119
00:06:45.220 --> 00:06:48.430
Because you can see at the point
of this beak It's a little curved.

120
00:06:48.430 --> 00:06:51.000
So, kinda hit that curve right.

121
00:06:51.000 --> 00:06:54.680
Now I'll do this, and then drag out.

122
00:06:54.680 --> 00:06:55.585
There we go.

123
00:06:55.585 --> 00:07:04.340
And then make further changes.

124
00:07:04.340 --> 00:07:06.250
I don't like that curve that much.

125
00:07:06.250 --> 00:07:12.210
So when you're doing this, see this handle
is kind of gonna affect my next line.

126
00:07:12.210 --> 00:07:17.090
If I don't want it to, I can change my,
use my convert point tool

127
00:07:17.090 --> 00:07:20.740
to drag it back, so
it doesn't affect the next line as much.

128
00:07:20.740 --> 00:07:24.100
Or I can make it go in
a different direction.

129
00:07:24.100 --> 00:07:28.010
>> With those brazier handles there
the longer the handle the more

130
00:07:28.010 --> 00:07:30.600
powerful the effect would
you say on the curve.

131
00:07:30.600 --> 00:07:34.230
>> Over time it's one of the things
like if you you had a, let's see for

132
00:07:34.230 --> 00:07:36.200
example these right here.

133
00:07:36.200 --> 00:07:38.730
The longer the handle it
would pull it up more but

134
00:07:38.730 --> 00:07:43.680
if I had a short handle and up you'd see
it would kind just depends on how the.

135
00:07:43.680 --> 00:07:44.320
>> Okay.

136
00:07:44.320 --> 00:07:48.870
>> It's like a ration of length of
the handle to the angle of the handle.

137
00:07:48.870 --> 00:07:51.900
>> Okay, so it really just goes
back to your earlier point,

138
00:07:51.900 --> 00:07:53.260
a lot of practice with the pen tool.

139
00:07:53.260 --> 00:07:58.180
>> Exactly, working with these handles
it can be a nightmare sometimes.

140
00:07:58.180 --> 00:08:01.920
But I'm gonna try to make it not
seem that difficult for you guys.

141
00:08:01.920 --> 00:08:04.970
So let's check up here see if
we can get a good curve going.

142
00:08:04.970 --> 00:08:12.200
Looks pretty decent then let's keep
moving along and holding space bar and

143
00:08:12.200 --> 00:08:16.090
clicking and dragging to move it on
zoomed in so it's easier to navigate.

144
00:08:17.130 --> 00:08:21.759
Then let's go next spot probably
around here see how that works.

145
00:08:23.240 --> 00:08:27.960
Looking pretty good so
far I'm holding space to move my point.

146
00:08:27.960 --> 00:08:31.785
And then,
now you see how far out that handle is?

147
00:08:31.785 --> 00:08:32.300
>> Mm-hm.

148
00:08:32.300 --> 00:08:34.138
>> That's not gonna be good,
when I want to put a point here.

149
00:08:34.138 --> 00:08:35.274
>> Mm-hm.

150
00:08:35.274 --> 00:08:38.888
>> So let me redo that last point,
and show you a little trick.

151
00:08:38.888 --> 00:08:44.060
Hold Ctrl+Alt+Z to step back one
more lets remake this point.

152
00:08:44.060 --> 00:08:49.400
So I will click right here and drag, make
sure it looks good on the left side and

153
00:08:49.400 --> 00:08:54.170
then once I determine my left
side is good I will hold Alt.

154
00:08:56.100 --> 00:08:59.230
And that will affect,
by holding Alt while still clicking and

155
00:08:59.230 --> 00:09:04.570
dragging, I'm only now manipulating
the handle of the future.

156
00:09:04.570 --> 00:09:06.980
>> Made each side be
independent of each other now.

157
00:09:06.980 --> 00:09:10.470
>> Yep so
now it's only controlling the next

158
00:09:10.470 --> 00:09:14.320
points curve strength on the left
side if that makes sense.

159
00:09:14.320 --> 00:09:15.520
>> Yes it does.

160
00:09:15.520 --> 00:09:17.940
>> So I'm gonna now just make
that a little shorter so

161
00:09:17.940 --> 00:09:21.390
it's not as really
dominant as it was before.

162
00:09:21.390 --> 00:09:26.130
And with this I don't really
wanna select these guys.

163
00:09:26.130 --> 00:09:29.200
Just cuz you'll see why in a second.

164
00:09:29.200 --> 00:09:30.330
I'm just gonna go down to here.

165
00:09:30.330 --> 00:09:32.310
Kinda chop off his hair.

166
00:09:32.310 --> 00:09:33.920
How about that.

167
00:09:33.920 --> 00:09:39.270
And make sure that aligns relatively good.

168
00:09:40.270 --> 00:09:43.540
There we go.
And then I'll pull this in,

169
00:09:43.540 --> 00:09:45.820
hold Alt to pull in the handle.

170
00:09:47.230 --> 00:09:50.130
And just keep going down
the back of the neck.

171
00:09:53.060 --> 00:09:54.742
There we go.

172
00:09:54.742 --> 00:09:58.100
Now this point,
I wanna put one right here.

173
00:10:00.660 --> 00:10:05.460
So now, it's hard to get this one really
perfect so I'm gonna hold Alt and

174
00:10:05.460 --> 00:10:10.790
just Ctrl at this point just to
modify just it a little bit so

175
00:10:10.790 --> 00:10:14.040
it goes along nicely with the curve.

176
00:10:16.120 --> 00:10:19.210
There we go.
And then over here,

177
00:10:19.210 --> 00:10:21.310
I just want the basic shape of it.

178
00:10:21.310 --> 00:10:25.720
So I'm gonna, this one,
you'll see how my handle is out here, so

179
00:10:25.720 --> 00:10:27.260
I'll click over here.

180
00:10:27.260 --> 00:10:30.500
That is not the curve that I want.

181
00:10:30.500 --> 00:10:34.460
So it's gonna be really hard if I do that,
it kind of goes back on itself.

182
00:10:34.460 --> 00:10:36.395
>> Right.
>> So it's not really,

183
00:10:36.395 --> 00:10:38.005
this is something you
kind of want to avoid.

184
00:10:39.205 --> 00:10:40.195
This right here.

185
00:10:41.365 --> 00:10:43.095
So let's undo that.

186
00:10:43.095 --> 00:10:45.985
And then to solve that,
I'll do what we were doing before,

187
00:10:45.985 --> 00:10:49.895
hold Alt, take this point and
then just bring it in.

188
00:10:51.770 --> 00:10:52.900
Maybe bring it a little to the right,

189
00:10:52.900 --> 00:10:55.870
cuz I kinda wanna make it go towards
the next point that I'm doing.

190
00:10:55.870 --> 00:10:58.750
So, in this case, I'll just put it over
to the right a little bit like that.

191
00:10:58.750 --> 00:11:01.890
And then I'll remake this, and
that's a little bit better.

192
00:11:03.710 --> 00:11:08.640
So in this particular case,
there is a corner there and

193
00:11:08.640 --> 00:11:11.840
that's perfectly fine for
what I want it for the curve before.

194
00:11:11.840 --> 00:11:14.280
Before I had to edit that point

195
00:11:14.280 --> 00:11:17.850
it assumed I want to maintain a smooth
curve throughout the whole thing.

196
00:11:17.850 --> 00:11:21.255
This if you grab the handles in you
can do more like tighter turns.

197
00:11:21.255 --> 00:11:22.598
>> Okay.

198
00:11:22.598 --> 00:11:27.150
>> So going back through this more,
that's looking good, hold on.

199
00:11:30.390 --> 00:11:32.220
There we go.

200
00:11:32.220 --> 00:11:35.050
I just want the basic shape of it, so
I don't want to go too crazy with it.

201
00:11:35.050 --> 00:11:38.050
Actually I want to go straighten
this up a little bit.

202
00:11:38.050 --> 00:11:41.600
So I wanna hold Ctrl and
then click on this anchor point and

203
00:11:41.600 --> 00:11:43.340
this should kind of bring it back over.

204
00:11:44.880 --> 00:11:47.960
And then let's see what this
big picture looks like.

205
00:11:47.960 --> 00:11:50.330
See the tail just kind of goes out there?

206
00:11:50.330 --> 00:11:52.775
I don't wanna scaly fish part.

207
00:11:52.775 --> 00:11:57.678
[LAUGH] So, let's go to right about here,

208
00:11:57.678 --> 00:12:01.016
there we go.

209
00:12:01.016 --> 00:12:03.130
Then how's that look?

210
00:12:05.910 --> 00:12:07.790
That should be fine for now.

211
00:12:07.790 --> 00:12:09.880
And then going down to the other part,

212
00:12:09.880 --> 00:12:15.125
they'll see this will create a weird,
kind of a turn there.

213
00:12:15.125 --> 00:12:16.660
>> Mm-hm.

214
00:12:16.660 --> 00:12:19.920
>> As another point,
wanna adjust this handle in the back.

215
00:12:19.920 --> 00:12:22.500
Let's hold Alt and click that and

216
00:12:22.500 --> 00:12:25.010
just kind of modify it to
how we want it to fit.

217
00:12:28.780 --> 00:12:33.360
So now it fits a lot tighter now,
so it's really helpful like

218
00:12:33.360 --> 00:12:37.340
modifying each side of the anchor point
because there's two handles so and

219
00:12:37.340 --> 00:12:40.280
then the inner handles will
affect that current line segment.

220
00:12:40.280 --> 00:12:42.750
So, let's go to the next one here.

221
00:12:42.750 --> 00:12:45.060
Let's just, how far can I get this one.

222
00:12:50.630 --> 00:12:55.080
There we go.
I'll chop off his feet too because they

223
00:12:55.080 --> 00:12:56.977
don't work with the shape
that I wanna make.

224
00:12:58.510 --> 00:13:01.680
Now you see how I'm pulling out
to the right, that's incorrect.

225
00:13:01.680 --> 00:13:04.340
Because I want to go
towards the next point.

226
00:13:04.340 --> 00:13:07.520
In this case I'm still going clockwise so

227
00:13:07.520 --> 00:13:11.070
I'd actually want to pull left
to avoid doing the swirly thing.

228
00:13:12.440 --> 00:13:13.950
So now this one's made a little too close,

229
00:13:13.950 --> 00:13:18.160
so I'm gonna hold spacebar just
to drag it out a little further.

230
00:13:19.960 --> 00:13:22.480
Okay, and edit this side holding Alt.

231
00:13:24.900 --> 00:13:28.910
Turns out more like that, let's make
this one a little tweak there too,

232
00:13:28.910 --> 00:13:31.510
and then let's go to the next point.

233
00:13:32.600 --> 00:13:33.840
Where am I?

234
00:13:33.840 --> 00:13:37.640
I might be able, I'm trying to get this
done like the least amount of anchor

235
00:13:37.640 --> 00:13:40.860
points So, if you see a big curve
like this, you think you could do it?

236
00:13:40.860 --> 00:13:41.780
Try it?

237
00:13:41.780 --> 00:13:42.750
So, let's go.

238
00:13:42.750 --> 00:13:45.630
I'm gonna click and hold on here, and

239
00:13:45.630 --> 00:13:48.070
then drag out anchor points
to try to make it fit.

240
00:13:48.070 --> 00:13:49.090
So, click and hold.

241
00:13:50.540 --> 00:13:53.280
Now, see this happens sometimes, too.

242
00:13:53.280 --> 00:13:54.760
If you drag out the points so far, and

243
00:13:54.760 --> 00:13:57.390
you're still zoomed in it
will start scrolling you.

244
00:13:57.390 --> 00:14:01.870
>> So if this happens, I'd recommend this
to kind of get estimating where we go.

245
00:14:01.870 --> 00:14:02.760
That looks good right there.

246
00:14:02.760 --> 00:14:05.140
At least, and now my point is so far out.

247
00:14:06.400 --> 00:14:07.590
But it actually really good.

248
00:14:07.590 --> 00:14:08.850
>> Perfect.
>> Yeah, so

249
00:14:08.850 --> 00:14:13.650
if I wanted to edit anything on there,
I can go to my direct slash and tool, and

250
00:14:13.650 --> 00:14:15.940
then select that actual, Segment.

251
00:14:15.940 --> 00:14:19.050
So right here I could probably
bring this down a little bit.

252
00:14:19.050 --> 00:14:20.840
So I'll just hold Alt.

253
00:14:20.840 --> 00:14:23.370
Drag this down like that, and there we go.

254
00:14:23.370 --> 00:14:25.940
So, now I have a completed path.

255
00:14:25.940 --> 00:14:29.270
See, that is a path right there.

256
00:14:31.530 --> 00:14:37.390
And then let's take out these
things just so you can see.

257
00:14:37.390 --> 00:14:41.420
So you see on the transparent background
you can see the exact shape I made.

258
00:14:41.420 --> 00:14:45.990
And then let's paint in,
just paint a white background just so

259
00:14:45.990 --> 00:14:48.020
we can see it a little bit easier.

260
00:14:49.270 --> 00:14:52.250
So that's the shape that I just made.

261
00:14:52.250 --> 00:14:57.080
I'm going to go to the path selection
tool and now this selects the whole path,

262
00:14:57.080 --> 00:15:00.570
remember the direct selection
selects segments of the path,

263
00:15:00.570 --> 00:15:04.530
so with the path selection tool,
make sure the whole path is selected.

264
00:15:04.530 --> 00:15:09.060
And what I wanna do here,
I'll go to, [INAUDIBLE] on this one.

265
00:15:09.060 --> 00:15:12.480
Yes, right-click the path and
then go to Define Custom Shape.

266
00:15:14.860 --> 00:15:17.765
I'll name this Ducky.

267
00:15:17.765 --> 00:15:21.480
>> [LAUGH]
>> Because it's pretty cool how

268
00:15:21.480 --> 00:15:23.690
the peacock turned into a duck, right?

269
00:15:23.690 --> 00:15:25.120
It's a pretty good looking duck too.

270
00:15:25.120 --> 00:15:27.170
So it's pretty interesting.

271
00:15:27.170 --> 00:15:28.640
So now, I defined a custom shape.

272
00:15:28.640 --> 00:15:35.110
If you wanted to create this let's go to
our paths window and select this path.

273
00:15:35.110 --> 00:15:37.900
I'll just click on the blank
space in the window, done.

274
00:15:37.900 --> 00:15:39.840
So back to my Layers.

275
00:15:39.840 --> 00:15:40.680
I'll create a new layer.

276
00:15:41.730 --> 00:15:43.600
And then let's go to Custom Shape Tool.

277
00:15:43.600 --> 00:15:46.910
It's under where the rectangle,
rounded rectangle, it's at the bottom.

278
00:15:46.910 --> 00:15:48.740
So I'll go into that.

279
00:15:48.740 --> 00:15:51.620
And then on the right side, the top right
where you would select the shape you would

280
00:15:51.620 --> 00:15:54.606
have right at the end is
the shape we just created.

281
00:15:54.606 --> 00:15:58.320
So double-click on that and
I would set my foreground and

282
00:15:58.320 --> 00:16:00.120
background also
the foreground color to back.

283
00:16:00.120 --> 00:16:05.040
So it's really ease to see and then now
I gonna click and drug it out then hold

284
00:16:05.040 --> 00:16:10.850
shift to maintain proportions constrain
and there we go there's our duck.

285
00:16:10.850 --> 00:16:12.775
We created a duck out of a peacock.

286
00:16:12.775 --> 00:16:15.090
>> [LAUGH].
>> And turned it into a shape.

287
00:16:15.090 --> 00:16:15.900
>> Who would have thought.

288
00:16:15.900 --> 00:16:20.270
>> Exactly, so now this is really
cool it kind of shows the selection

289
00:16:20.270 --> 00:16:23.680
abilities of the pen tool and paths.

290
00:16:23.680 --> 00:16:26.220
In this case we took it and

291
00:16:26.220 --> 00:16:30.740
converted the path into a custom shape but
imagine doing this with a logo.

292
00:16:30.740 --> 00:16:35.370
If you took a company logo with
a path make a shape out of it and

293
00:16:35.370 --> 00:16:37.590
then you can scale the shape
to whatever size you want to.

294
00:16:37.590 --> 00:16:40.360
With this case I can take this duck and
I can put on the billboard and

295
00:16:40.360 --> 00:16:42.070
it will be a great quality.

296
00:16:42.070 --> 00:16:43.490
>> Because it was based on that vector.

297
00:16:43.490 --> 00:16:44.830
>> It starts off as vector.

298
00:16:44.830 --> 00:16:50.880
So now, at this point it's still vector
but I can also rasterize it and it turn

299
00:16:50.880 --> 00:16:55.349
it into pixels by right clicking on the
layer and then going to Rasterize Layer.

300
00:16:56.386 --> 00:17:00.870
So then I can zoom in to it a bunch and
you can start seeing the pixels.

301
00:17:00.870 --> 00:17:01.510
>> Mm-hm.

302
00:17:01.510 --> 00:17:02.760
>> Jagged it gets.

303
00:17:02.760 --> 00:17:05.480
And then if I wanna to blow
this up onto a billboard

304
00:17:05.480 --> 00:17:08.140
it won't be as good quality
because it's not vector anymore.

305
00:17:08.140 --> 00:17:09.050
>> Very cool.

306
00:17:09.050 --> 00:17:10.250
>> So, yeah.

307
00:17:10.250 --> 00:17:13.130
>> Alright Nick, a lot of great stuff
there, a lot of fun we can have with that

308
00:17:13.130 --> 00:17:15.960
pen tool,
showing you some of the complexities.

309
00:17:15.960 --> 00:17:18.880
Working with that pen tool,
remember, practice makes perfect.

310
00:17:18.880 --> 00:17:20.510
We started out with a peacock.

311
00:17:20.510 --> 00:17:22.280
We ended up with a duck.

312
00:17:22.280 --> 00:17:23.460
All right, we appreciate that.

313
00:17:23.460 --> 00:17:25.160
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

314
00:17:25.160 --> 00:17:27.500
Signing off for ITProTV,
I'm Mike Roderick.

315
00:17:27.500 --> 00:17:29.898
>> And I'm Mick Page.
>> And we'll see you next time.

316

00:00:17.290 --> 00:00:20.782
Today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

6
00:00:20.782 --> 00:00:24.646
And specifically in this episode we're
gonna be taking a look at colors, right,

7
00:00:24.646 --> 00:00:28.006
and it seems like a relatively simple
thing but when it comes down to it,

8
00:00:28.006 --> 00:00:31.320
there's a lot of things to think
about when we're looking at colors.

9
00:00:31.320 --> 00:00:34.890
And here to help us with all this is Ms.
Kara Page, how's it going Kara?

10
00:00:34.890 --> 00:00:37.340
>> I'm great, let's go ahead and
dive right into color.

11
00:00:37.340 --> 00:00:38.780
>> All right.

12
00:00:38.780 --> 00:00:39.670
>> All right, so

13
00:00:39.670 --> 00:00:44.240
what we're going to do first is
just talk about color terminology.

14
00:00:44.240 --> 00:00:46.350
So these are terms that you
may have heard before, but

15
00:00:46.350 --> 00:00:47.900
you don't really know what they mean.

16
00:00:47.900 --> 00:00:51.230
So let's start there to
just give you a basis.

17
00:00:51.230 --> 00:00:52.410
So, the word color.

18
00:00:53.750 --> 00:00:57.220
The layman's term for color,
it's actually called hue.

19
00:00:57.220 --> 00:01:00.480
So if you hear the word hue,
it's just another name for color.

20
00:01:00.480 --> 00:01:02.000
So red, green blue.

21
00:01:02.000 --> 00:01:05.090
Those are all hues, okay?

22
00:01:05.090 --> 00:01:07.020
Then we have something called a tent.

23
00:01:07.020 --> 00:01:11.830
So a tent is where you mix
your hue with a white.

24
00:01:11.830 --> 00:01:14.154
So red becoming pink.

25
00:01:14.154 --> 00:01:16.030
Pink is the tint of red.

26
00:01:16.030 --> 00:01:21.750
And you also have shade so shade, if you
think of it as being under a big tree.

27
00:01:21.750 --> 00:01:23.530
You have that dark shade.

28
00:01:23.530 --> 00:01:29.120
That's where you add black to a color so
blue to navy blue or red to maroon.

29
00:01:29.120 --> 00:01:31.980
Then there's a term called Chroma.

30
00:01:31.980 --> 00:01:37.660
So Chroma is how pure that hue is so
the higher

31
00:01:37.660 --> 00:01:42.330
the chroma the less likely the color is
to have been mixed with any other color.

32
00:01:42.330 --> 00:01:44.700
>> Very good.

33
00:01:44.700 --> 00:01:47.960
>> Okay and then the last term for

34
00:01:47.960 --> 00:01:50.750
color that I wanna go over
specifically is value.

35
00:01:50.750 --> 00:01:54.680
So value refers to the lightness or
darkness of a hue.

36
00:01:54.680 --> 00:01:55.640
>> Mm.
Okay.

37
00:01:55.640 --> 00:01:57.992
>> So, now that I have bored
you with some key terms.

38
00:01:57.992 --> 00:01:58.504
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

39
00:01:58.504 --> 00:02:00.824
>> Let's go ahead and open Photoshop.

40
00:02:00.824 --> 00:02:03.490
So, get Photoshop ready to go.

41
00:02:03.490 --> 00:02:06.600
And I'm just going to
create a new document.

42
00:02:06.600 --> 00:02:10.140
I'm just gonna do maybe an eight and
a half by 11 standard document size.

43
00:02:10.140 --> 00:02:12.820
It really doesn't matter what size we're
doing cuz we're just playing around

44
00:02:12.820 --> 00:02:14.060
with some colors.

45
00:02:14.060 --> 00:02:15.220
So I'm gonna go to File, New.

46
00:02:16.960 --> 00:02:19.740
And I'm going to change my
document type to US paper,

47
00:02:19.740 --> 00:02:21.920
which is one of our presets
that we learned about earlier.

48
00:02:21.920 --> 00:02:25.990
Okay, I'm gonna go ahead and click OK.

49
00:02:25.990 --> 00:02:28.590
All right, so
now we have our blank canvas.

50
00:02:28.590 --> 00:02:29.960
We have our nice white page up.

51
00:02:29.960 --> 00:02:32.710
Now we need to talk about colors.

52
00:02:32.710 --> 00:02:37.530
So first thing that we need to talk about
is foreground and background colors.

53
00:02:37.530 --> 00:02:42.590
If you notice, down in the bottom left
part of your tools panel in Photoshop,

54
00:02:42.590 --> 00:02:46.280
you'll see a black box
overlapping a white box.

55
00:02:46.280 --> 00:02:49.420
This is your foreground and
background color.

56
00:02:49.420 --> 00:02:51.800
If you hover the box, it'll tell you.

57
00:02:51.800 --> 00:02:54.200
So white, right now,
is our background color.

58
00:02:54.200 --> 00:02:56.550
That is the default in Photoshop.

59
00:02:56.550 --> 00:02:59.950
And then black is our foreground color.

60
00:02:59.950 --> 00:03:01.030
So, let's see what that means.

61
00:03:01.030 --> 00:03:04.600
Let's go ahead and pull up the brush
tool like we did the other day.

62
00:03:04.600 --> 00:03:06.890
Now that you know about it,
I'm going to go ahead and

63
00:03:06.890 --> 00:03:09.920
change this maybe to a 50 pixel brush.

64
00:03:09.920 --> 00:03:12.322
Again, it doesn't matter,
we're not actually creating anything.

65
00:03:12.322 --> 00:03:16.565
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So, I'm just going to scribble.

66
00:03:16.565 --> 00:03:21.940
So, we have this foreground color, which
means that whatever tool you have active,

67
00:03:21.940 --> 00:03:26.660
that top color, your foreground color
is going to be what color it displays.

68
00:03:26.660 --> 00:03:28.920
So let's try that out
with a different color.

69
00:03:28.920 --> 00:03:30.960
To pick a color from our foreground and

70
00:03:30.960 --> 00:03:33.730
background colors,
we will need to click on the box.

71
00:03:33.730 --> 00:03:36.000
So if we single click on our black box,

72
00:03:36.000 --> 00:03:39.520
you will notice that we have this
whole color spectrum pop up.

73
00:03:40.580 --> 00:03:42.910
Now I'm just going to
pick our red right here.

74
00:03:42.910 --> 00:03:44.260
It doesn't really matter.

75
00:03:44.260 --> 00:03:46.450
Go ahead and click okay.

76
00:03:46.450 --> 00:03:53.174
Now we have a different foreground color,
so when we draw we have red now.

77
00:03:53.174 --> 00:03:54.430
Okay?

78
00:03:54.430 --> 00:03:57.630
So I'm going to switch
back to my default colors.

79
00:03:57.630 --> 00:04:02.880
It's this little tiny icon with the black
box overlapping the white, right here.

80
00:04:02.880 --> 00:04:06.436
Or, you can hit the D for Default.

81
00:04:06.436 --> 00:04:10.909
So, it's very helpful to know these
keyboard shortcuts in Photoshop,

82
00:04:10.909 --> 00:04:15.748
especially when we start to learn things
like glare masks that are based on this

83
00:04:15.748 --> 00:04:17.992
black-and-white color scheme.

84
00:04:17.992 --> 00:04:20.580
All right,
let's say that we wanted something else,

85
00:04:20.580 --> 00:04:25.190
so let's say that we wanted our foreground
color to be our background color.

86
00:04:25.190 --> 00:04:28.080
How you do that is you'll notice
that we have these two arrows

87
00:04:28.080 --> 00:04:30.770
off to the right that look like a corner.

88
00:04:30.770 --> 00:04:34.350
If you were to click that button,
it will change what our foreground and

89
00:04:34.350 --> 00:04:36.240
background colors are.

90
00:04:36.240 --> 00:04:38.997
So now that we have our
brush still active,

91
00:04:38.997 --> 00:04:42.757
I'm gonna go ahead and
paint over these, with the white.

92
00:04:42.757 --> 00:04:43.788
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

93
00:04:43.788 --> 00:04:45.905
>> Maybe not the best color choice, right?

94
00:04:45.905 --> 00:04:46.630
[LAUGH]
>> No, but

95
00:04:46.630 --> 00:04:49.390
it kind of looks like
the eraser we learned about.

96
00:04:49.390 --> 00:04:52.820
But the difference between the eraser and
the brush is that the eraser

97
00:04:52.820 --> 00:04:57.708
would have removed the pixels whereas this
brush just added additional white pixels.

98
00:04:57.708 --> 00:04:59.440
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

99
00:04:59.440 --> 00:04:59.949
>> Okay.

100
00:04:59.949 --> 00:05:01.369
And then the shortcut for

101
00:05:01.369 --> 00:05:03.660
switching your color back and
forth that is x.

102
00:05:03.660 --> 00:05:08.600
So if you were to hit x a few times
you'll notice in the bottom corner that

103
00:05:08.600 --> 00:05:10.860
we're flipping back and
forth between the colors.

104
00:05:10.860 --> 00:05:11.910
>> Hm, very good.

105
00:05:11.910 --> 00:05:12.610
>> Okay.

106
00:05:12.610 --> 00:05:14.680
So let's say that we wanted
something other than red?

107
00:05:14.680 --> 00:05:18.220
Let's go ahead and
click on our foreground color.

108
00:05:18.220 --> 00:05:22.210
You'll notice that we have this whole
color spectrum right here to the right.

109
00:05:22.210 --> 00:05:23.810
Let's say that I wanted a nice blue.

110
00:05:23.810 --> 00:05:26.810
You'll notice that we don't
have any blue right here.

111
00:05:26.810 --> 00:05:31.980
So what we have to do is we have to
adjust our part of the color spectrum.

112
00:05:31.980 --> 00:05:35.090
So you can do that by
dragging your arrows, or

113
00:05:35.090 --> 00:05:37.900
by simply just clicking on the part
of the spectrum that you'd like.

114
00:05:39.170 --> 00:05:40.430
>> Very Cool.
>> Mm-hm.

115
00:05:40.430 --> 00:05:42.870
So you'll notice that
the brighter colors and

116
00:05:42.870 --> 00:05:46.000
the lighter colors are up at the top,
the farther you go down in here,

117
00:05:46.000 --> 00:05:49.285
you're getting darker and
darker because they're mixing with black.

118
00:05:49.285 --> 00:05:50.700
>> Mm-hm.

119
00:05:50.700 --> 00:05:53.130
>> So
it's our tints versus our shades here.

120
00:05:53.130 --> 00:05:58.650
So I'm gonna pick this kind of middle
of the road purple to demonstrate and

121
00:05:58.650 --> 00:06:01.629
then I'm going to change our background
color by clicking on the white box.

122
00:06:02.720 --> 00:06:07.260
And I'll go ahead and pick a nice green
because they're complimentary colors,

123
00:06:09.010 --> 00:06:12.340
but you'll notice I'm still
painting with purple.

124
00:06:12.340 --> 00:06:13.240
Why is that?

125
00:06:13.240 --> 00:06:14.430
What did I do wrong?

126
00:06:14.430 --> 00:06:19.030
>> I'm assuming maybe, cuz your brush
only uses the foreground color.

127
00:06:19.030 --> 00:06:19.730
That's correct.

128
00:06:19.730 --> 00:06:23.110
So we need to switch it
to the background color.

129
00:06:23.110 --> 00:06:25.460
So you can hit the arrow keys and

130
00:06:25.460 --> 00:06:30.390
draw with green, or you can click
your x to switch between the colors.

131
00:06:30.390 --> 00:06:31.150
>> Nice.

132
00:06:31.150 --> 00:06:33.640
So really you got foreground and
background colors over there, but

133
00:06:33.640 --> 00:06:36.800
you can almost use them as a way just
to load up two different colors, and

134
00:06:36.800 --> 00:06:39.190
switch back and
forth between them on your brush?

135
00:06:39.190 --> 00:06:40.250
>> Exactly.
>> Very cool.

136
00:06:40.250 --> 00:06:41.340
>> Yeah.

137
00:06:41.340 --> 00:06:42.060
Okay, so

138
00:06:42.060 --> 00:06:45.830
now we're going to talk about this cool
concept called the eyedropper tool.

139
00:06:45.830 --> 00:06:48.480
So I'm just going to
clear out this canvas,

140
00:06:48.480 --> 00:06:50.360
I don't really want it there anymore.

141
00:06:50.360 --> 00:06:55.220
So I'm gonna to to my layers panel,
unlock my background, create a new layer.

142
00:06:55.220 --> 00:07:00.360
And I'm just going to
fill it with this white,

143
00:07:00.360 --> 00:07:02.240
so remember white's my
background right now.

144
00:07:02.240 --> 00:07:03.540
I need to flip them.

145
00:07:03.540 --> 00:07:06.003
I'm hitting the X and clicking.

146
00:07:06.003 --> 00:07:08.500
>> Nice.
>> Okay, so that was instead of erasing.

147
00:07:08.500 --> 00:07:11.650
Skipped a step,
I don't need all those doodles anymore.

148
00:07:11.650 --> 00:07:13.960
So now we're going to use something
called the Eyedropper tool.

149
00:07:13.960 --> 00:07:16.430
Really cool tool, super useful.

150
00:07:16.430 --> 00:07:18.260
But we need a picture first.

151
00:07:18.260 --> 00:07:20.210
So let's go ahead and place an image.

152
00:07:20.210 --> 00:07:24.760
So I'm gonna go to file,
place embedded, and

153
00:07:24.760 --> 00:07:29.230
let's go ahead and do the sunset.jpg
picture that you have access to.

154
00:07:29.230 --> 00:07:35.670
So I'm gonna place this picture and
I'm just gonna go ahead and hit Enter.

155
00:07:35.670 --> 00:07:38.240
I'll zoom in a little bit so
you can see this photo better.

156
00:07:38.240 --> 00:07:40.510
So we have this very pretty
sunset over a river.

157
00:07:41.830 --> 00:07:45.870
Let's say that I really like
the color of the sunset and I wanna

158
00:07:45.870 --> 00:07:49.850
use some of these colors for something
maybe like text or adding shapes.

159
00:07:49.850 --> 00:07:51.810
You can do that with the eyedropper tool.

160
00:07:51.810 --> 00:07:54.810
There are several ways to
access the eyedropper tool.

161
00:07:54.810 --> 00:07:56.533
It is a tool in your panel.

162
00:07:56.533 --> 00:07:59.175
If you click on it right here,
it looks like an eyedropper.

163
00:07:59.175 --> 00:08:01.560
If you hover over it,
it will also say eyedropper.

164
00:08:01.560 --> 00:08:04.100
Go ahead and single click.

165
00:08:04.100 --> 00:08:08.627
Click on your background and
now you'll notice my foreground color has

166
00:08:08.627 --> 00:08:11.430
changed to this kind
of grayish blue color.

167
00:08:12.620 --> 00:08:16.510
Now if I were to click around in here,
let's say this nice deeper orange,

168
00:08:16.510 --> 00:08:17.700
you'll see that.

169
00:08:17.700 --> 00:08:24.010
So every time I click, you'll notice that
my foreground color is changing, okay?

170
00:08:24.010 --> 00:08:26.140
That's one way to access
the eye dropper tool.

171
00:08:26.140 --> 00:08:29.620
The other way to access that
tool is by clicking on the eye.

172
00:08:29.620 --> 00:08:30.745
So, eye for eye dropper.

173
00:08:30.745 --> 00:08:35.500
[LAUGH] The other way to access it,
which is probably my go to way,

174
00:08:35.500 --> 00:08:40.500
just because I tend to have my color
box open, is, if this box is open,

175
00:08:40.500 --> 00:08:43.990
it automatically gives you
access to your eye dropper tool.

176
00:08:43.990 --> 00:08:45.030
>> Nice.

177
00:08:45.030 --> 00:08:48.780
Okay, so let's say that I wanted
to save one of these colors.

178
00:08:48.780 --> 00:08:51.030
So I really like this kind of mauve color.

179
00:08:51.030 --> 00:08:53.950
I want to save it to my color libraries.

180
00:08:53.950 --> 00:08:54.830
You can do that.

181
00:08:54.830 --> 00:08:57.440
You can click on this
add to swatches button.

182
00:08:57.440 --> 00:08:58.540
So I'm going to go ahead and do that.

183
00:08:59.810 --> 00:09:03.308
It'll give you an ability to name it so
I'm just going to name it mauve.

184
00:09:03.308 --> 00:09:07.050
Then clock okay.

185
00:09:07.050 --> 00:09:08.540
I'll cancel out of that now.

186
00:09:08.540 --> 00:09:09.930
So I've saved a swatch.

187
00:09:09.930 --> 00:09:11.340
But what is a swatch?

188
00:09:11.340 --> 00:09:12.960
Lets go find out.

189
00:09:12.960 --> 00:09:15.220
So I'm going to collapse
my layers panel so

190
00:09:15.220 --> 00:09:17.810
that way it's not taking up all the space.

191
00:09:17.810 --> 00:09:22.848
You'll notice that I have this
little panel called swatches.

192
00:09:22.848 --> 00:09:27.820
If you don't have this panel, remember
you can access it by going to window.

193
00:09:27.820 --> 00:09:29.780
And then swatches.

194
00:09:29.780 --> 00:09:30.590
Okay?
Thankfully,

195
00:09:30.590 --> 00:09:34.360
this menu's in alphabetical order so,
it's faster to find things.

196
00:09:34.360 --> 00:09:36.020
And I'm gonna go ahead and click swatches.

197
00:09:37.040 --> 00:09:40.770
Now you'll notice that I have all
of these little color squares.

198
00:09:40.770 --> 00:09:45.610
These are just default colors in
Photoshop and if you hover over each one

199
00:09:45.610 --> 00:09:49.160
with your eyedropper tool you'll be
able to see exactly what they're called.

200
00:09:49.160 --> 00:09:53.150
So pastel blue violet,
there's a darker magenta red.

201
00:09:53.150 --> 00:09:54.560
These colors are pre-loaded.

202
00:09:54.560 --> 00:09:58.790
But if you remember, I saved my own
custom colors so I need to find it.

203
00:09:58.790 --> 00:10:03.040
This works in a very similar way
to our brush tool where it saves

204
00:10:03.040 --> 00:10:05.770
as your very last color in your panel.

205
00:10:05.770 --> 00:10:09.665
So if I were to hover over this
color you'll see there's my mauve.

206
00:10:11.230 --> 00:10:14.260
>> Very nice.
I see this, you were saying as a way to,

207
00:10:14.260 --> 00:10:18.330
if you got a color that you like and you
want to use it on another document, very

208
00:10:18.330 --> 00:10:22.180
easy to do by grabbing that color with the
eye dropper, saving it in your swatches

209
00:10:22.180 --> 00:10:25.740
as well as if you're editing and you
really need to match that color exactly.

210
00:10:25.740 --> 00:10:29.900
Working on a logo or something like that,
guess that what the numbers are, right?

211
00:10:29.900 --> 00:10:32.330
Just use your eyedropper tool,
get the exact color, very cool.

212
00:10:33.440 --> 00:10:37.260
>> Definitely, the other handy thing that
you can do so you don't have to place this

213
00:10:37.260 --> 00:10:42.010
photo every time, is you can actually
save your color library in Photoshop.

214
00:10:42.010 --> 00:10:46.000
So the way that you do that is you go
up to this three line hamburger menu.

215
00:10:47.200 --> 00:10:49.720
And you'll notice that it says,
save swatches.

216
00:10:49.720 --> 00:10:54.780
So if you click save swatches, you'll be
able to save them as whatever you want.

217
00:10:55.790 --> 00:10:57.750
Okay?
Go ahead and hit save.

218
00:10:57.750 --> 00:10:59.950
It'll probably save under optimized color,
or

219
00:10:59.950 --> 00:11:02.940
some other folder that
Photoshop already has built in.

220
00:11:02.940 --> 00:11:06.250
So if you're having trouble finding
your swatches, they're there somewhere.

221
00:11:06.250 --> 00:11:09.095
You just have to dig through your
Photoshop folder to find them.

222
00:11:09.095 --> 00:11:11.310
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So,

223
00:11:11.310 --> 00:11:13.580
as you remember from when
we went over brushes,

224
00:11:13.580 --> 00:11:17.550
there are several other options when
you have a flyout menu like this.

225
00:11:17.550 --> 00:11:21.690
You can also reset your swatches which
would reset them to the default colors.

226
00:11:21.690 --> 00:11:25.340
You can load swatches that maybe you've
downloaded from somewhere else or saved.

227
00:11:25.340 --> 00:11:29.600
You can save your swatches,
you can replace the swatches, or

228
00:11:29.600 --> 00:11:35.550
you'll notice that we have all of
these different listed color here.

229
00:11:35.550 --> 00:11:39.720
So if we specifically wanted paint
Pantone colors you could do that,

230
00:11:39.720 --> 00:11:42.040
you could pick Pantone solid coated.

231
00:11:42.040 --> 00:11:45.830
And you'll notice that we have
this same little box that pops up.

232
00:11:45.830 --> 00:11:49.898
Just like we had with our brushes,
where you can click OK or Append.

233
00:11:49.898 --> 00:11:53.370
So remember append is if you just
want to add them to the bottom

234
00:11:53.370 --> 00:11:55.230
of your color panel.

235
00:11:55.230 --> 00:11:58.300
Okay would be replacing all the colors
that are already in here with these

236
00:11:58.300 --> 00:12:00.260

465
00:24:04.681 --> 00:24:09.560
a lot of time on websites the buttons
have a very slight gradient to them.

466
00:24:09.560 --> 00:24:12.270
Or if you're doing some
kind of metallic design,

467
00:24:12.270 --> 00:24:14.230
it's also good to know
how to make a gradient.

468
00:24:14.230 --> 00:24:17.455
>> Almost gives you a little
depth perception, and

469
00:24:17.455 --> 00:24:21.225
sometimes a flat color just looks so,
I don't know, fake.

470
00:24:21.225 --> 00:24:25.005
I don't wanna say fake, but
if there's a technical term for

471
00:24:25.005 --> 00:24:27.725
that, yeah, but without the gradient,
it's just so plain.

472
00:24:27.725 --> 00:24:32.025
>> It is very plain,
flat designs are pretty popular,

473
00:24:32.025 --> 00:24:34.965
on the rise, but flat designs
look a lot better in illustrator,

474
00:24:34.965 --> 00:24:37.645
cuz you're working with more
of that cartoon back dropping.

475
00:24:37.645 --> 00:24:38.392
>> Right, right.

476
00:24:38.392 --> 00:24:39.710
All right, so
I'm going to click hold and drag,

477
00:24:39.710 --> 00:24:41.830
so that's just the basis of a gradient.

478
00:24:41.830 --> 00:24:44.620
So like I said, if we were to change our
colors, it would look totally different,

479
00:24:44.620 --> 00:24:46.210
so let's try that out.

480
00:24:46.210 --> 00:24:53.130
i'm going to change my foreground
color to a light blue, and now

481
00:24:53.130 --> 00:24:57.320
I'm going to click on my x, so that way
it brings my background to my foreground.

482
00:24:57.320 --> 00:25:01.060
And I'm going to choose a dark blue for
this.

483
00:25:01.060 --> 00:25:03.080
I'm gonna click X again so
they're in different spots.

484
00:25:04.630 --> 00:25:07.880
Now if I were to click, hold, and
drag, now our colors are blue.

485
00:25:07.880 --> 00:25:09.815
So now we have this nice
little ocean environment.

486
00:25:09.815 --> 00:25:11.180
[LAUGH] All right,

487
00:25:11.180 --> 00:25:14.510
let's say that you wanted to
customize this gradient even further.

488
00:25:14.510 --> 00:25:18.920
What you could do is click on
this fading gradient box and

489
00:25:18.920 --> 00:25:20.270
here's our Gradient Editor.

490
00:25:20.270 --> 00:25:24.110
So you'll notice all of our different
presets that are preloaded.

491
00:25:24.110 --> 00:25:27.500
You an also change out your colors and
where they stop.

492
00:25:27.500 --> 00:25:31.540
So if you were to drag these
little boxes along the bottom,

493
00:25:31.540 --> 00:25:33.650
it totally customizes your gradient.

494
00:25:33.650 --> 00:25:35.490
So let's go ahead and click.

495
00:25:36.530 --> 00:25:38.460
And you'll notice that
my color is right here.

496
00:25:38.460 --> 00:25:41.150
I can change my color by
clicking on the little color box.

497
00:25:42.190 --> 00:25:46.815
And let's change it to a green, so
you'll definitely see the difference.

498
00:25:46.815 --> 00:25:48.250
>> Mm-hm.
>> So you can come in here and

499
00:25:48.250 --> 00:25:52.470
completely customize what your gradient
looks like, and really control it.

500
00:25:52.470 --> 00:25:53.970
You can also add how smooth it is.

501
00:25:53.970 --> 00:25:54.470
How.

502
00:25:55.940 --> 00:25:58.180
Opaque it is, all that right here.

503
00:25:58.180 --> 00:26:02.110
So you can also save gradient and
use them later if you'd like.

504
00:26:02.110 --> 00:26:05.600
Or you can load a gradient and
save from other places.

505
00:26:06.870 --> 00:26:09.170
The other thing you can do is
click on this little gear icon.

506
00:26:09.170 --> 00:26:11.600
It's kind of small and

507
00:26:11.600 --> 00:26:15.370
you'll notice there are some other
pre built gradients in Photoshop.

508
00:26:15.370 --> 00:26:17.910
If I were to click on metal for instance.

509
00:26:17.910 --> 00:26:19.440
We're gonna get that same appender okay?

510
00:26:19.440 --> 00:26:24.650
I'm gonna click append and now we
have a few extra choices for metals.

511
00:26:24.650 --> 00:26:29.900
So, I just drag this out and
now we have a cool metallic gradient.

512
00:26:29.900 --> 00:26:30.491
>> Nice.

513
00:26:30.491 --> 00:26:31.161
Nice.

514
00:26:31.161 --> 00:26:31.831
>> Okay.

515
00:26:31.831 --> 00:26:32.950
>> Very cool.

516
00:26:32.950 --> 00:26:36.880
I tell you what Kera a lot of information
dealing with colors how to pick them out.

517
00:26:36.880 --> 00:26:40.170
How to get them loaded up in
the appropriate tool that we wanna use.

518
00:26:40.170 --> 00:26:43.390
And I know we've got More to talk
about when it comes to colors,

519
00:26:43.390 --> 00:26:46.170
but unfortunately we're out of time for
this particular episode, so

520
00:26:46.170 --> 00:26:47.080
we're gonna have to call it there.

521
00:26:47.080 --> 00:26:49.520
But, we'll be back with more color.

522
00:26:49.520 --> 00:26:51.300
So I hope everybody enjoyed watching.

523
00:26:51.300 --> 00:26:53.760
Signing off for ITProTV,
I'm Mike Roderick.

524
00:26:53.760 --> 00:26:54.400
>> And I'm Carrie Pane.

525
00:26:54.400 --> 00:26:56.345
>> And we'll see you next time.

526
00:26:56.345 --> 00:27:04.100
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Try It Out! Mood Board
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.311 --> 00:00:15.160
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.160 --> 00:00:20.249
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, today
we're doing a Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

4
00:00:20.249 --> 00:00:23.965
Specifically in this episode it's time for
another one of those try

5
00:00:23.965 --> 00:00:28.480
it out exercises and we're gonna do a mood
board or working with choosing colors.

6
00:00:28.480 --> 00:00:30.560
So get ready and let's get started.

7
00:00:30.560 --> 00:00:32.669
We'll dive in with Miss Kara Page.

8
00:00:32.669 --> 00:00:35.080
All right let's go ahead and get started.

9
00:00:35.080 --> 00:00:37.940
So, open up Photoshop,
and have it ready to go.

10
00:00:40.040 --> 00:00:41.450
So I'll just give you a second.

11
00:00:41.450 --> 00:00:42.510
Okay, hopefully you're good.

12
00:00:42.510 --> 00:00:45.490
If not, you can just pause me,
you can pause me anytime.

13
00:00:45.490 --> 00:00:47.550
[LAUGH] We're going to
open a file this time.

14
00:00:47.550 --> 00:00:49.040
So, let's go to File > Open.

15
00:00:50.200 --> 00:00:53.724
And, we are going to
find wildflowers.jpeg.

16
00:00:55.210 --> 00:00:57.210
Let's go ahead and click OK.

17
00:00:57.210 --> 00:01:01.860
So we have this lovely photo of
wild flowers in Colorado and

18
00:01:01.860 --> 00:01:06.180
we want to make our colors
based off of this image.

19
00:01:06.180 --> 00:01:09.390
So we're going to be making some
thing that's called a mood board.

20
00:01:09.390 --> 00:01:13.320
So typically a mood board has a whole
bunch of different pictures added together

21
00:01:13.320 --> 00:01:17.720
to really capture the essence of you,
or a brand, or whatever it is.

22
00:01:17.720 --> 00:01:20.430
But we're just gonna do a single
picture mood board just so

23
00:01:20.430 --> 00:01:21.780
you can see what that would like.

24
00:01:21.780 --> 00:01:24.230
So let's go ahead and dive right in.

25
00:01:25.950 --> 00:01:29.120
First things we're gonna do is
we're gonna create a new layer,

26
00:01:29.120 --> 00:01:32.350
cuz we don't really wanna do anything
disruptive to our wild flowers.

27
00:01:32.350 --> 00:01:38.560
So I'm gonna click on New, and
I'm going to create a color fill.

28
00:01:38.560 --> 00:01:40.860
So we just learned how to do that.

29
00:01:40.860 --> 00:01:44.980
I'm going to select my rectangular marquee
tool, so again it's probably hidden under

30
00:01:44.980 --> 00:01:47.770
your elliptical if you're following
along with the last lesson.

31
00:01:48.870 --> 00:01:55.470
I'm going to click+hold and
drag out to about here, and let go.

32
00:01:55.470 --> 00:02:02.226
So now I want to fill it with white,
but if I were to click Edit > Fill Now,

33
00:02:02.226 --> 00:02:06.640
it would be this top blue, so we need to
change it back to our default colors.

34
00:02:06.640 --> 00:02:08.600
So I'm gonna go ahead and click d for

35
00:02:08.600 --> 00:02:13.160
that, to change it back to default, but
black is on top, cuz that is the default,

36
00:02:13.160 --> 00:02:17.580
so let's go ahead and
click x to switch it to be white on top.

37
00:02:17.580 --> 00:02:21.780
So again, playing with shortcuts,
it's a lot faster than clicking around.

38
00:02:21.780 --> 00:02:25.360
So let's go up to Edit, and
we going to go to Fill.

39
00:02:26.990 --> 00:02:30.100
And I want it to be my foreground color,
so

40
00:02:30.100 --> 00:02:34.240
make sure you have the selected and
click OK.

41
00:02:34.240 --> 00:02:38.220
So now we have this nice little white
blank spot for us to put our colors.

42
00:02:38.220 --> 00:02:42.430
I'm going to deselect this box and
I'm going to just rename this box so

43
00:02:42.430 --> 00:02:43.460
I know what it is.

44
00:02:43.460 --> 00:02:46.190
Remember, it's always a good
idea to rename your layers so

45
00:02:46.190 --> 00:02:50.750
that way if you have a document that has
50 layers, they're not all just layer 1,

46
00:02:50.750 --> 00:02:54.150
layer 22, layer 25,
that would be extremely confusing.

47
00:02:54.150 --> 00:02:56.750
So, remember to rename your layers.

48
00:02:56.750 --> 00:03:00.746
And if you forgot how to rename them
again you just double-click on the name,

49
00:03:00.746 --> 00:03:02.710
type in the name, hit Enter,
you're good to go.

50
00:03:03.770 --> 00:03:08.590
So now we have a place to put our colors,
now we need to find our colors.

51
00:03:08.590 --> 00:03:13.500
So I'm going to click on the eye which
brings up our eye dropper tool, or

52
00:03:13.500 --> 00:03:14.709
you can click on the tool itself.

53
00:03:15.720 --> 00:03:18.440
I am going to first select a nice violet.

54
00:03:18.440 --> 00:03:22.470
So what I'm going to do is I'm going
find a flower that I really like,

55
00:03:22.470 --> 00:03:23.720
I personally like this one right here.

56
00:03:23.720 --> 00:03:27.600
And I'm gonna single-click, and now
you'll notice that we have this violet.

57
00:03:29.360 --> 00:03:32.760
I'm gonna click on it, but
I wanna add this to my swatches.

58
00:03:32.760 --> 00:03:36.660
So I'm gonna click Add Swatches,
and I'm gonna name it Violet.

59
00:03:39.480 --> 00:03:42.550
So what I'm going to do is I'm
gonna use the brush tool, and

60
00:03:42.550 --> 00:03:45.010
I'm going to create
a series of color dots so

61
00:03:45.010 --> 00:03:48.130
that way we can clearly see this
color scheme on our screen.

62
00:03:48.130 --> 00:03:50.250
So to get to the brush tool,
you can either click on it, or

63
00:03:50.250 --> 00:03:52.520
you can hit the letter b for brush.

64
00:03:52.520 --> 00:03:53.300
I'm gonna hit the letter b.

65
00:03:54.930 --> 00:03:57.270
I'm going to make my
brush quite a bit bigger.

66
00:03:57.270 --> 00:04:02.150
Again you can change it up here at size,
or you can just hit your right or

67
00:04:02.150 --> 00:04:03.500
left brackets.

68
00:04:03.500 --> 00:04:06.200
So this is still a little bit small for
my area, so

69
00:04:06.200 --> 00:04:08.380
I'm gonna hit my brackets a few times.

70
00:04:08.380 --> 00:04:11.740
Now I have a nice 300 size brush but
you can use whatever size you'd like.

71
00:04:11.740 --> 00:04:16.720
So I'm gonna single-click,
and now I have a dot.

72
00:04:16.720 --> 00:04:22.590
But, I put it on the same layer as my box,
which is not what I wanna do.

73
00:04:22.590 --> 00:04:24.880
So I'm gonna undo that,
create a new layer,

74
00:04:24.880 --> 00:04:29.720
name it Violet and
then I'm going to single-click again.

75
00:04:29.720 --> 00:04:32.350
So there's our first color,
it's our violet.

76
00:04:32.350 --> 00:04:35.300
Let's go back and choose another color,
so I'm gonna click on the eye again.

77
00:04:36.440 --> 00:04:39.580
And this time I'm going to pick one
of these nice deeper purples at

78
00:04:39.580 --> 00:04:40.900
the bottom here.

79
00:04:40.900 --> 00:04:44.440
So I'm going to click on that,
go ahead and add to swatches and

80
00:04:44.440 --> 00:04:46.182
I'll call it deep purple.

81
00:04:46.182 --> 00:04:48.130
>> [LAUGH]
>> Like the band, [LAUGH],

82
00:04:48.130 --> 00:04:51.510
you're probably too young for
that, but that's fine.

83
00:04:51.510 --> 00:04:52.555
I'm going to click OK.

84
00:04:54.120 --> 00:04:56.420
And let's create a new layer,

85
00:04:56.420 --> 00:05:01.475
go back to my brush by hitting b and
then try to line it up just so.

86
00:05:01.475 --> 00:05:03.930
Single-click, now we
have an additional color.

87
00:05:03.930 --> 00:05:06.472
I'm gonna name this one
deep purple over here,

88
00:05:06.472 --> 00:05:09.290
cuz remember naming layers saves you.

89
00:05:09.290 --> 00:05:10.980
Let's pick two more colors out of here.

90
00:05:10.980 --> 00:05:15.410
So I'm going to pick this nice little
yellow color because he's off by himself.

91
00:05:15.410 --> 00:05:17.960
And a green,
cuz we have a lot of green in this image.

92
00:05:17.960 --> 00:05:23.890
So I'm gonna click my eye for eyedropper,
click on this yellow, create a swatch for

93
00:05:23.890 --> 00:05:28.590
him, I'm gonna name him sunflower.

94
00:05:28.590 --> 00:05:32.050
Even though it's not a sunflower,
it's a sunflower yellow to me.

95
00:05:32.050 --> 00:05:39.265
So, new layer, let's rename it sunflower
and then back to brush by hitting b.

96
00:05:39.265 --> 00:05:42.490
Line it up, let go, and
now we have an additional color.

97
00:05:42.490 --> 00:05:44.700
So we are going to do that one more time.

98
00:05:44.700 --> 00:05:48.060
So I'm going to go back to i,
by now you should be a pro hopefully.

99
00:05:48.060 --> 00:05:51.840
Back to i,
I'm going to pick a green leaf down here,

100
00:05:51.840 --> 00:05:56.700
create a swatch based on that.

101
00:05:56.700 --> 00:05:57.880
So I'm gonna call this leaf.

102
00:05:59.320 --> 00:06:02.860
Okay, new layer, let's rename you leaf.

103
00:06:04.090 --> 00:06:08.450
Back to brush, so b, and single-click.

104
00:06:08.450 --> 00:06:11.480
So now we have this lovely color scheme,
but

105
00:06:11.480 --> 00:06:16.220
I want to group all of my color swatches
that I just created by making a group,

106
00:06:16.220 --> 00:06:19.500
so this is a refresher on
creating layer groups.

107
00:06:19.500 --> 00:06:25.060
I'm going to select this folder icon at
the bottom, it changed it to Group One.

108
00:06:25.060 --> 00:06:29.075
And I'll rename it by double clicking,
and I'm going to name this swatches.

109
00:06:29.075 --> 00:06:31.742
I'm gonna click on our first color swatch,

110
00:06:31.742 --> 00:06:37.440
Shift + click on our last color swatch and
drag them into my swatches folder.

111
00:06:37.440 --> 00:06:40.629
So, now I have a really organized file.

112
00:06:40.629 --> 00:06:44.093
So, typically with mood boards,
just to make it easier on yourself,

113
00:06:44.093 --> 00:06:47.323
you would want to put down the color
code for each of these colors,

114
00:06:47.323 --> 00:06:51.580
so that way you don't have to keep
opening it, you can just type in a code.

115
00:06:51.580 --> 00:06:55.340
So, to do that, let's go ahead and
click on our eyedropper tool.

116
00:06:55.340 --> 00:06:58.480
Let's click on our first top violet,
open it up, and

117
00:06:58.480 --> 00:07:02.550
then here's our CMYK,
RGB, and our hex code.

118
00:07:02.550 --> 00:07:05.180
So depending on what you're designing for,

119
00:07:05.180 --> 00:07:07.900
you would put whatever color
code corresponds to that.

120
00:07:07.900 --> 00:07:11.090
So if you're doing web design,
you put a hex code.

121
00:07:11.090 --> 00:07:13.570
If you're doing something intended for
the computer, so

122
00:07:13.570 --> 00:07:16.350
maybe an online banner ad,
you would do RGB.

123
00:07:16.350 --> 00:07:19.660
If you're doing print you would do CMYK.

124
00:07:19.660 --> 00:07:23.620
So I'm just going to test out the hex code
so I'm gonna copy this code at the bottom,

125
00:07:23.620 --> 00:07:27.420
I'm gonna to my type tool,
which we haven't learned much about,

126
00:07:27.420 --> 00:07:29.120
that's completely fine.

127
00:07:29.120 --> 00:07:35.650
I'm just gonna single-click then hashtag,
paste my number.

128
00:07:35.650 --> 00:07:37.640
And this is a little bit large,
it doesn't need to be 300, so

129
00:07:37.640 --> 00:07:39.550
I'm just gonna adjust the size at the top.

130
00:07:41.150 --> 00:07:46.910
And then scoot it over, hit Enter, and
then just click off so you can see.

131
00:07:46.910 --> 00:07:48.150
So that's what you can do for

132
00:07:48.150 --> 00:07:51.330
every color, so that way it is
just a quick reference guide for

133
00:07:51.330 --> 00:07:56.860
you later on, if you wanna just pop back
in and see what colors you wanted to use.

134
00:07:56.860 --> 00:08:01.350
So if I wanted to save that color scheme
for the future, I could to swatches and

135
00:08:01.350 --> 00:08:06.055
down at the bottom you'll see my swatches,
I'm gonna go to File

136
00:08:06.055 --> 00:08:11.170
> Save Swatches, save them for later,
so that I have my flowers there.

137
00:08:11.170 --> 00:08:14.533
>> Fantastic, great little way
to create that mood board,

138
00:08:14.533 --> 00:08:19.170
get the colors you wanna use organized
in spot, thanks for that, lots of fun.

139
00:08:19.170 --> 00:08:20.620
Hope you guys enjoyed that.

140
00:08:20.620 --> 00:08:24.022
Try it out, look forward to doing some
more with Miss Kara Page, but for

141
00:08:24.022 --> 00:08:26.610
now, signing off for
ITProTV, I'm Mike Rodrick.

142
00:08:26.610 --> 00:08:27.240
>> And I'm Kara Page.

143
00:08:27.240 --> 00:08:29.176
>> And we'll see you next time.

144
00:08:29.176 --> 00:08:36.783
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Adjustments and Filters
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.623 --> 00:00:15.281
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.281 --> 00:00:17.240
I'm your host Mike Rodrick.

4
00:00:17.240 --> 00:00:21.050
Today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

5
00:00:21.050 --> 00:00:25.070
And specifically in this episode we're
continuing to take a look at colors.

6
00:00:25.070 --> 00:00:28.210
And we're gonna dive into the world
of really of color adjustment.

7
00:00:28.210 --> 00:00:29.760
Right?
We said that color is a pretty

8
00:00:29.760 --> 00:00:30.650
complex topic.

9
00:00:30.650 --> 00:00:35.400
We've talked a lot about the basic
terminology, hues and saturation.

10
00:00:35.400 --> 00:00:37.020
But we're not stuck with what we picked.

11
00:00:37.020 --> 00:00:40.720
There's a lot of different adjustments
that we can do and we've brought in our

12
00:00:40.720 --> 00:00:43.860
color adjustment expert, Mr.
Nick Page to help us with that.

13
00:00:43.860 --> 00:00:44.630
How's it going, Nick?

14
00:00:44.630 --> 00:00:45.350
>> Pretty good.

15
00:00:45.350 --> 00:00:45.960
How you doing?

16
00:00:45.960 --> 00:00:47.020
>> Doing great.

17
00:00:47.020 --> 00:00:50.780
>> All right, so when you think of
Photoshop, what do you think of?

18
00:00:50.780 --> 00:00:54.230
>> Like if you ever Photoshop an image,
what does that mean to you?

19
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.280
>> Usually trying to maybe fix some
things that maybe I didn't like about

20
00:00:57.280 --> 00:00:58.240

00:00:58.240 --> 00:01:00.840

That is what we're gonna be doing today.

00:01:00.840 --> 00:01:04.680
We will be using colors and
adjustment layers or

00:01:04.680 --> 00:01:10.090

00:01:16.420 --> 00:01:20.060
It looks great, but I kinda wanna

00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:20.610
>> Okay.

00:01:20.610 --> 00:01:25.500

00:01:25.500 --> 00:01:28.580

00:01:28.580 --> 00:01:29.890

washed out a little bit.

00:01:29.890 --> 00:01:31.520
So, I kinda wanna fix that.

00:01:31.520 --> 00:01:37.330

Wow.
They all have to do somehow with color or

00:01:45.217 --> 00:01:50.130

00:01:50.130 --> 00:01:52.800

Obviously the image becomes brighter

00:02:01.790 --> 00:02:05.500
And the brightness essentially is
the amount of whites in the image,

42
00:02:05.500 --> 00:02:07.230

00:02:08.370 --> 00:02:12.950
If they're all up to 100,

44
00:02:12.950 --> 00:02:17.270
very white, bright image that's kind
of painful for the eyes to see.

45
00:02:17.270 --> 00:02:21.700
So and
knock it down to get a very dark image.

46
00:02:21.700 --> 00:02:23.250

00:02:23.250 --> 00:02:28.310

image so raising the contrast will make

00:02:33.070 --> 00:02:34.000

50
00:02:34.000 --> 00:02:35.250
>> Yeah, it does.

00:02:35.250 --> 00:02:35.750
Exactly.

52
00:02:37.160 --> 00:02:41.120
And a cool thing about Photoshop is if you

00:02:41.120 --> 00:02:44.620

There's a magic button here called Auto.

00:02:49.250 --> 00:02:53.420
So you hit that and then it'll change
to what it thinks is probably the cool,

00:02:53.420 --> 00:02:55.940

00:02:55.940 --> 00:02:58.530
So this is what Photoshop gave us.

00:02:58.530 --> 00:03:03.110
Let me zoom in just so

00:03:03.110 --> 00:03:04.310

And then this

00:03:04.310 --> 00:03:05.900

00:03:08.310 --> 00:03:10.990

00:03:10.990 --> 00:03:13.290

00:03:13.290 --> 00:03:14.260

00:03:24.710 --> 00:03:29.210
Levels are kind of interesting

00:03:32.000 --> 00:03:35.860
And histogram's a tool used in photography

00:03:35.860 --> 00:03:38.220

strength of blacks.

74
00:03:38.220 --> 00:03:39.830

00:03:39.830 --> 00:03:44.490
You have three sliders on here,
and ideally, in a histogram,

00:03:44.490 --> 00:03:48.910
when you're editing the levels,
you want to have the sliders over to

77
00:03:48.910 --> 00:03:54.020

And this kind of takes a long time for

00:03:57.870 --> 00:04:00.370
You do not want any of

00:04:00.370 --> 00:04:02.930
You don't want any baseline.

81
00:04:02.930 --> 00:04:03.745
You don't want a baseline in the image.

00:04:03.745 --> 00:04:07.530

actually get a color or is there so

00:04:07.530 --> 00:04:08.820

00:04:08.820 --> 00:04:09.350

85
00:04:09.350 --> 00:04:10.530
It's useless.

00:04:10.530 --> 00:04:14.150
And what we need it for is just trim
it out and then I'll make the blacks.

87
00:04:14.150 --> 00:04:17.550
This is probably,
it'll make the blacks deeper.

88
00:04:17.550 --> 00:04:22.050
And I think on the left side,
let me check, one second.

89
00:04:24.450 --> 00:04:28.440
Yes, on the left side of the histogram,
this represents the shadows.
