00:04:28.440 --> 00:04:31.390
And it actually can help you with,
if you look at the arrow there,

91
00:04:31.390 --> 00:04:33.450
it's a dark arrow.

92
00:04:33.450 --> 00:04:35.610
And then you have the right side,
which is the highlights, and

93
00:04:35.610 --> 00:04:37.230

94
00:04:37.230 --> 00:04:42.109
So editing, let's look at the preview and
when I edit the edges.

95
00:04:43.130 --> 00:04:44.670
This is editing the contrast.

96
00:04:44.670 --> 00:04:50.630
So I'm trimming the excess whites that we

97
00:04:50.630 --> 00:04:52.140
So those are darker.

98
00:04:52.140 --> 00:04:55.020
And then the middle one will

99
00:04:55.020 --> 00:04:59.390
So look at the number below my mouse
pointer, and it's right now one,

100
00:04:59.390 --> 00:05:01.430
and it's going down.

101
00:05:01.430 --> 00:05:04.930
As this number gets higher
It'll become brighter.

102
00:05:04.930 --> 00:05:07.600
>> Yeah.
>> So level's a very advanced way to edit

103
00:05:07.600 --> 00:05:12.910
the images and the different levels and
values of the black and whites.

104
00:05:12.910 --> 00:05:18.360
But it is very useful when you really
need to get the exact tone of a gray

105
00:05:18.360 --> 00:05:19.430
in a picture.

106
00:05:19.430 --> 00:05:22.950
>> So it's almost like a fine
tuning of your image there.

00:05:22.950 --> 00:05:23.590
>> Exactly.

108
00:05:23.590 --> 00:05:25.720
>> Very cool.
>> And there's also preset too.

00:05:25.720 --> 00:05:26.659
Let me just hit those for a second.

00:05:28.370 --> 00:05:30.380
Levels, presets.

111
00:05:30.380 --> 00:05:31.800
You can do the simple ones.

112
00:05:31.800 --> 00:05:37.230
Think of this as, you know when you

00:05:37.230 --> 00:05:40.740

114
00:05:40.740 --> 00:05:42.650
>> Right.
>> And just enhance the image.

115
00:05:42.650 --> 00:05:44.260
>> These are kind of like filters here.

116
00:05:44.260 --> 00:05:47.490
There are presets that could increase
the contrast, just by one click, and

00:05:47.490 --> 00:05:49.470
it did just a little bit right there.

00:05:49.470 --> 00:05:52.540

we can go down to lighten the shadows.

00:05:52.540 --> 00:05:56.130
If the shadows are too dark,

00:05:56.130 --> 00:06:02.120
These are more template things that may or

121
00:06:02.120 --> 00:06:06.090
They're just there for you to take

00:06:06.090 --> 00:06:08.080
In this case,

00:06:09.190 --> 00:06:10.030

Also use those as maybe a starting point

00:06:13.250 --> 00:06:13.890

00:06:13.890 --> 00:06:14.390

00:06:15.640 --> 00:06:18.610
>> And then also,
just like the brightness and

contrast window, the levels has

So we'll move that over so

00:06:26.290 --> 00:06:32.080
Hitting that will magically adjust

And Photoshop's pretty smart

>> So if we have that and

So, after levels we have

Curves is another visual representation of

If you wanted to manipulate it,

The steeper the curve as

So the grade just kinda

There's a way like you can just adjust,

00:07:48.635 --> 00:07:49.755

00:08:07.860 --> 00:08:11.930
Still, just a little bit of, it's

So

The next item in this little

00:08:21.701 --> 00:08:22.830

00:08:23.920 --> 00:08:27.920
In photography when you take
a picture you have your aperture,

174
00:08:27.920 --> 00:08:29.630
you have your shutter speed, and

175
00:08:29.630 --> 00:08:35.650
generally if you have your shutter speed
too low, your photo will be really bright.

176
00:08:35.650 --> 00:08:37.720
Just washed out, overexposed.

177
00:08:37.720 --> 00:08:41.400
Cuz too much light hits the sensor,
so that's generally what that means.

178
00:08:41.400 --> 00:08:45.360
Overexposure is too much white in
the image, too much light hit the sensor.

179
00:08:45.360 --> 00:08:51.940
And with this, I can either emulate that,
or I can try to combat it,

180
00:08:51.940 --> 00:08:57.270
so I could enhance the exposure here and
it looks like it's sunnier out, right?

181
00:08:57.270 --> 00:08:57.938
>> Right, yes.

182
00:08:57.938 --> 00:09:01.570

00:09:01.570 --> 00:09:04.561
But say I had an image that

00:09:04.561 --> 00:09:05.180

00:09:05.180 --> 00:09:08.630

00:09:08.630 --> 00:09:09.470

00:09:10.680 --> 00:09:15.030

00:09:15.030 --> 00:09:20.300

00:09:20.300 --> 00:09:25.860

00:09:25.860 --> 00:09:27.080

00:09:27.080 --> 00:09:28.390

And also there's other sliders

Now and next,

The first section, you see this little

These four things are mainly on

And then this next section is

00:10:16.924 --> 00:10:21.069

00:10:21.069 --> 00:10:22.870

00:10:22.870 --> 00:10:27.226
I have a,

00:10:27.226 --> 00:10:32.550

00:10:35.651 --> 00:10:39.407

00:10:44.314 --> 00:10:49.396

00:10:49.396 --> 00:10:54.192

And you can also,

So then you have your colors changed and

00:11:10.630 --> 00:11:12.510

00:11:12.510 --> 00:11:14.230

00:11:14.230 --> 00:11:19.310

00:11:19.310 --> 00:11:23.200

00:11:23.200 --> 00:11:27.140
vibrance, this is what we have,
this is what we had initially.

00:11:27.140 --> 00:11:30.715
So the picture looks ten times better.

00:11:30.715 --> 00:11:32.800

This is another way to transform,

Color Balance is just,

With photography and

If you're done with the beach for a while,

495
00:24:34.990 --> 00:24:36.919
see some other kinds of nature in life.

496
00:24:39.290 --> 00:24:45.780
Lets run a image adjustments and shadows
highlights, well selective color first.

497
00:24:47.240 --> 00:24:52.960
This is more if you would like
to manipulate a single color and

498
00:24:52.960 --> 00:24:54.150
turn it into another color.

499
00:24:54.150 --> 00:24:57.317
So start with reds,
I want to turn all my reds to blues.

500
00:25:00.126 --> 00:25:02.844
See if that works.

501
00:25:02.844 --> 00:25:04.510
It just lightens up my colors.

502
00:25:04.510 --> 00:25:06.730
>> Not a lot of reds to start
with in the image I guess.

503
00:25:06.730 --> 00:25:07.910
>> Yeah, segment of yellows and

504
00:25:07.910 --> 00:25:12.730
turn them into, increase the darkness
on the yellows, decrease the yellow.

505
00:25:12.730 --> 00:25:14.080
Then increase the magenta.

506
00:25:15.410 --> 00:25:18.280
So it's very sublet color changing,
selective color.

507
00:25:18.280 --> 00:25:19.840
You can take the greens as well.

508
00:25:19.840 --> 00:25:21.604
Look at the background for this.

509
00:25:21.604 --> 00:25:27.650
Let me increase the cyan, increase
the magenta, turn down the yellow.

510
00:25:27.650 --> 00:25:30.140
So it's a slight color editing for that.

511
00:25:30.140 --> 00:25:33.070
And there's no presets.

512
00:25:33.070 --> 00:25:34.630
>> No presets, interesting.

513
00:25:34.630 --> 00:25:35.442
>> Yeah that's a bummer.

514
00:25:35.442 --> 00:25:36.090
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

515
00:25:36.090 --> 00:25:38.360
>> And there's also the absolute option

516
00:25:38.360 --> 00:25:43.190
which can probably lead to
more noticeable changes.

517
00:25:43.190 --> 00:25:45.820
So now my greens are popping more.

518
00:25:45.820 --> 00:25:47.105
Turn down the yellow.

519
00:25:47.105 --> 00:25:48.420
Let me turn off the black.

520
00:25:48.420 --> 00:25:50.580
So you can see the preview.

521
00:25:50.580 --> 00:25:53.910
It does make subtle changes
similar to one of the earlier

522
00:25:55.020 --> 00:25:56.540
vibrants we were messing with earlier.

523
00:25:56.540 --> 00:26:01.330
So now, I'm done with this.

524
00:26:01.330 --> 00:26:05.830
Now let's try one of my favorites,
shadows and highlights.

525
00:26:05.830 --> 00:26:07.990
This one will manipulate the shadows and

526
00:26:07.990 --> 00:26:11.530
the highlights so you can get a really
cool HDR look if you want to,

527
00:26:11.530 --> 00:26:15.760
like the darkest of the dark,
lightest to the lights, mix them together.

528
00:26:15.760 --> 00:26:19.930
You'll probably be presented
with this first, but

529
00:26:19.930 --> 00:26:23.530
you want to show more options
to have some real fun.

530
00:26:23.530 --> 00:26:28.120
So, let's do some adjust in color here.

531
00:26:28.120 --> 00:26:28.620
The midtones.

532
00:26:30.580 --> 00:26:33.091
And it's really like making
the image pop a certain way.

533
00:26:33.091 --> 00:26:40.250
So let's do a, mess with the highlights,
change the tone, and add some shadows.

534
00:26:40.250 --> 00:26:42.140
We're actually darkening that so
shadows are deeper.

535
00:26:44.000 --> 00:26:46.490
So now, here's our image
after doing all the edits and

536
00:26:46.490 --> 00:26:47.760
this is what it looked like before.

537
00:26:49.110 --> 00:26:51.705
So you can really-
>> Really brought out a lot of the detail

538
00:26:51.705 --> 00:26:53.507
in the bark, and
the different layers in there.

539
00:26:53.507 --> 00:26:54.598
[CROSSTALK] That was really nice.

540
00:26:54.598 --> 00:26:57.315
>> Yeah, it's just getting more detail,
so it's pretty fun.

541
00:26:57.315 --> 00:26:58.918
Let's just keep that.

542
00:26:58.918 --> 00:27:00.751
I like it.

543
00:27:00.751 --> 00:27:05.180
[LAUGH]
More adjustments, HDR toning is pretty

544
00:27:05.180 --> 00:27:11.530
much the same thing,
except very, there's more glow.

545
00:27:11.530 --> 00:27:17.130
HDR pictures are usually composed
of three images, a overexposed,

546
00:27:17.130 --> 00:27:22.600
an underexposed and a middle and
it's a merge of all three.

547
00:27:22.600 --> 00:27:24.775
That's why you see on your
phones you have HDR options.

548
00:27:24.775 --> 00:27:25.800
>> Mm-hm.
>> That's usually what it does.

549
00:27:25.800 --> 00:27:29.160
It takes three pictures and
then merges them the best way possible and

550
00:27:29.160 --> 00:27:31.610
usually that involves an edge glow.

551
00:27:31.610 --> 00:27:36.400
So you'll see when the lights and
the darks really meet, there's a glow.

552
00:27:36.400 --> 00:27:38.270
And that's kind of
a cool effect sometimes.

553
00:27:38.270 --> 00:27:42.760
So with this,
it allows you to recreate that glow, and

554
00:27:42.760 --> 00:27:47.010
even make a single image HDR,
just by kind of running the same

555
00:27:47.010 --> 00:27:52.180
algorithms of doing the overexposed,
underexposed, and the perfect image.

556
00:27:52.180 --> 00:27:53.734
Creating an even more perfect image.

557
00:27:53.734 --> 00:27:59.693
[LAUGH]
Then next step

558
00:27:59.693 --> 00:28:05.650
we have Desaturate, we went over that,
that's just the converting to grayscale.

559
00:28:05.650 --> 00:28:09.020
And that's pretty much
it on the adjustments.

560
00:28:09.020 --> 00:28:12.300
Other things, we have the matching color,
that's if you

561
00:28:13.330 --> 00:28:16.325
found a color that you wanted, and you
want to find the same color in the image.

562
00:28:16.325 --> 00:28:17.120
>> Mm-hm.

563
00:28:17.120 --> 00:28:18.790
>> It should be relatively easy.

564
00:28:18.790 --> 00:28:21.626
Give it an image, and
then it will work with you on that.

565
00:28:21.626 --> 00:28:28.925
And then replacing the same style and
equalize is a very easy button.

566
00:28:28.925 --> 00:28:30.037
It's like the easy button.

567
00:28:30.037 --> 00:28:31.235
>> [LAUGH]
>> It just equalizes the image,

568
00:28:31.235 --> 00:28:32.965
makes it kind of balance out.

569
00:28:32.965 --> 00:28:34.255
>> No dialogue at all, it just does it.

570
00:28:34.255 --> 00:28:34.855
>> Exactly, yeah.

571
00:28:34.855 --> 00:28:39.645
And interesting thing about that,
just one last thing on a side note.

572
00:28:39.645 --> 00:28:43.755
If you look at these menus,
every command has three dots after it,

573
00:28:43.755 --> 00:28:45.760
pretty much except for equalize.

574
00:28:45.760 --> 00:28:47.835
And invert and desaturate.

575
00:28:47.835 --> 00:28:50.555
So I guess the three dots
I wanna emphasize and

576
00:28:50.555 --> 00:28:55.940
when we see that it means you're gonna
get a dialogue box after you click it.

577
00:28:55.940 --> 00:28:59.030
So, like channel mixer, dialogue box.

578
00:28:59.030 --> 00:29:02.440
And then if you go to invert,
there's no dots after it.

579
00:29:02.440 --> 00:29:04.430
That's just gonna be
the command right there.

580
00:29:04.430 --> 00:29:05.590
That's all you can do.

581
00:29:05.590 --> 00:29:07.670
So food for thought there.

582
00:29:07.670 --> 00:29:09.445
Good information to have.

583
00:29:09.445 --> 00:29:13.910
>> [LAUGH] All right Nick, well I tell
you a lot of more great information about

584
00:29:13.910 --> 00:29:16.370
working with your colors and
getting a little more specific with them,

585
00:29:16.370 --> 00:29:20.020
really getting in there and adjusting
them and not just adjusting them to fix

586
00:29:20.020 --> 00:29:22.790
the picture, which is obviously
one reason we would be doing this.

587
00:29:22.790 --> 00:29:24.650
Or to come up with some
really cool new pictures,

588
00:29:24.650 --> 00:29:26.510
using some of those tools as well.

589
00:29:26.510 --> 00:29:29.280
So we thank you for that, we hope
everybody out there enjoyed watching.

590
00:29:29.280 --> 00:29:31.800
Signing off for IT Pro TV,
I'm Mike Roderick.

591
00:29:31.800 --> 00:29:32.320
>> And I'm Nick Page.

592
00:29:32.320 --> 00:29:35.129
>> And we'll see you next time.

593
00:29:35.129 --> 00:29:40.168
[NOISE]

episodes.title: Adjustments and Filters Part 2
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.005 --> 00:00:10.005
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.257 --> 00:00:15.090
Hello, welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITPro TV.

3
00:00:15.090 --> 00:00:19.657
I'm your host Mike Roderick, today we're
doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015, and

4
00:00:19.657 --> 00:00:24.034
specifically in this episode we're
actually continuing our thought process,

5
00:00:24.034 --> 00:00:26.630
this is a part two for
adjustments and filters.

6
00:00:26.630 --> 00:00:28.500
And we're just gonna
jump right back into it.

7
00:00:28.500 --> 00:00:30.860
And here with me of course is Mr.
Nick Page.

8
00:00:30.860 --> 00:00:31.490
How's it going Nick?

9
00:00:31.490 --> 00:00:32.720
>> Pretty good, I'm doing well.

10
00:00:32.720 --> 00:00:34.045
Let's jump on it.

11
00:00:34.045 --> 00:00:34.690
>> All right.

12
00:00:34.690 --> 00:00:39.580
>> So we're gonna start with
starting back where we left off

13
00:00:39.580 --> 00:00:44.020
on the magic auto button to do
the tone contrast and coloring.

14
00:00:44.020 --> 00:00:45.620
So let's experiment with this.

15
00:00:45.620 --> 00:00:50.550
So first I'll start off by
opening this little flower File.

16
00:00:50.550 --> 00:00:54.890
So similarly to the other things that
we were doing with the brightness and

17
00:00:54.890 --> 00:01:01.260
contrast and levels and curves and tones
and all those great, awesome options.

18
00:01:01.260 --> 00:01:08.160
There are three simple easy buttons that
kind of do a very bridged version of that.

19
00:01:08.160 --> 00:01:11.130
So, in this case we look at our picture,
see how it looks.

20
00:01:11.130 --> 00:01:12.960
Looks pretty nice, sorry.

21
00:01:12.960 --> 00:01:19.620
And then, let's do image,
then auto tone, see what that does.

22
00:01:20.810 --> 00:01:21.440
There.

23
00:01:21.440 --> 00:01:26.809
It just made a little change,
but it enhanced the image.

24
00:01:28.120 --> 00:01:31.810
You could also, instead of that,
you could do auto contrast.

25
00:01:31.810 --> 00:01:32.710
It's another simple one.

26
00:01:34.170 --> 00:01:35.475
That did not do much.

27
00:01:35.475 --> 00:01:36.820
>> [INAUDIBLE]
>> That's what-

28
00:01:36.820 --> 00:01:38.590
>> It's telling us that our contrast was

29
00:01:38.590 --> 00:01:39.510
set pretty good already.

30
00:01:39.510 --> 00:01:40.800
>> Exactly.
Yep.

31
00:01:40.800 --> 00:01:42.340
So it's good when you see that.

32
00:01:43.562 --> 00:01:47.370
You wanna try using different options too,

33
00:01:47.370 --> 00:01:49.550
cuz the contrast you might
wanna change the color now.

34
00:01:49.550 --> 00:01:53.510
So let's just try that and the color,
it actually washed it out a little bit.

35
00:01:53.510 --> 00:01:55.150
A little less vibrant now.

36
00:01:56.750 --> 00:02:01.610
But this is an example of it's not
always good to go Photoshop best

37
00:02:01.610 --> 00:02:05.720
options cuz it seems easy but
it's not gonna be good in the long run.

38
00:02:05.720 --> 00:02:07.568
>> Sometimes Photoshop does not know best.

39
00:02:07.568 --> 00:02:09.525
[LAUGH]
>> Exactly.

40
00:02:09.525 --> 00:02:11.870
Yeah.
So on a little different note,

41
00:02:11.870 --> 00:02:15.920
let's do a quick photo
manipulation of this right now.

42
00:02:15.920 --> 00:02:18.520
We are going to change the color
of a flower using a magic

43
00:02:19.570 --> 00:02:22.760
tool called the color replacement tool.

44
00:02:22.760 --> 00:02:24.150
This tool is found under the brush.

45
00:02:24.150 --> 00:02:26.390
So click and hold, pop the fly out window.

46
00:02:26.390 --> 00:02:29.230
Then you have your color replacement tool.

47
00:02:29.230 --> 00:02:29.990
Let's click that.

48
00:02:31.170 --> 00:02:33.860
And with this, this uses brush options so

49
00:02:33.860 --> 00:02:36.930
we just wanna make sure we
can set all the brush sizing.

50
00:02:36.930 --> 00:02:41.840
You can either set it up here where
you're used to or you can actually

51
00:02:41.840 --> 00:02:45.600
right click on your image and then
adjust your size from here on the fly.

52
00:02:46.660 --> 00:02:52.420
So here I'm gonna change the hardness
down to probably about 75 and

53
00:02:52.420 --> 00:02:58.630
then let's keep the size,
I could change that so 132 sounds good.

54
00:02:58.630 --> 00:03:01.839
So now I'm gonna click to get out of here,
and then let me zoom in.

55
00:03:03.719 --> 00:03:05.320
What I'm gonna do here, oops sorry.

56
00:03:06.410 --> 00:03:09.900
First we wanna figure out what color
we wanna change this flower to.

57
00:03:09.900 --> 00:03:11.490
What color you got in mind there?

58
00:03:11.490 --> 00:03:12.670
>> Let's go blue.

59
00:03:12.670 --> 00:03:13.805
>> Blue, sounds great.

60
00:03:13.805 --> 00:03:16.700
>> [LAUGH]
>> Wanna go light blue or dark blue?

61
00:03:16.700 --> 00:03:17.470
>> I'll let you, yeah.

62
00:03:17.470 --> 00:03:18.320
That's a good blue right there.

63
00:03:18.320 --> 00:03:19.160
>> Like that?
>> I like it.

64
00:03:19.160 --> 00:03:20.580
>> Let's do it.

65
00:03:20.580 --> 00:03:25.550
All right, so now I'm going to
use my space bar to pan around so

66
00:03:25.550 --> 00:03:28.005
I can get all of the picture,
or all the flower.

67
00:03:28.005 --> 00:03:28.520
>> Mm-hm.

68
00:03:28.520 --> 00:03:31.750
>> What I wanna do is just
start coloring the flower.

69
00:03:31.750 --> 00:03:33.840
As simple as that it's changing the color.

70
00:03:37.220 --> 00:03:39.630
>> Still leaving some of the shadow and
contrast or

71
00:03:39.630 --> 00:03:41.710
the detail of the flower
that I can see behind there.

72
00:03:41.710 --> 00:03:47.250
>> Exactly, so it's not like you're
completely wrapping a, I broke it,

73
00:03:47.250 --> 00:03:50.130
you're not completely
overriding the colors there,

74
00:03:50.130 --> 00:03:54.070
you're kind of manipulating and
changing them to be the other.

75
00:03:54.070 --> 00:03:55.153
So I'll just keep coloring away.

76
00:03:58.996 --> 00:04:02.236
Keep going.

77
00:04:02.236 --> 00:04:03.769
And you get the idea on this.

78
00:04:03.769 --> 00:04:05.069
[LAUGH]
>> Very good.

79
00:04:05.069 --> 00:04:06.363
I like that.
>> So I'll zoom out and

80
00:04:06.363 --> 00:04:07.890
see how that part of the flower looks.

81
00:04:10.450 --> 00:04:11.370
And there we have it.

82
00:04:11.370 --> 00:04:12.190
>> Looks good.

83
00:04:12.190 --> 00:04:16.200
>> It's a pretty not the best way
to change the colors because one

84
00:04:16.200 --> 00:04:19.450
thing it does do that's really not
good is if you check at the layers,

85
00:04:19.450 --> 00:04:21.900
that just wrote right onto our image.

86
00:04:21.900 --> 00:04:24.336
So now it's stuck like
that unless we undo it.

87
00:04:24.336 --> 00:04:28.167
We can't really control
how the colors change.

88
00:04:28.167 --> 00:04:31.164
So I don't particularly
recommend this method.

89
00:04:31.164 --> 00:04:32.266
>> Pretty destructive method.

90
00:04:32.266 --> 00:04:34.290
>> Very destructive.

91
00:04:34.290 --> 00:04:38.380
In a later episode, we will learn
about non-destructive editing and

92
00:04:38.380 --> 00:04:40.360
ways to get around this to
make it more efficient.

93
00:04:40.360 --> 00:04:46.660
And more usable, make your .psd files,
when you save them, make them strong.

94
00:04:46.660 --> 00:04:47.820
>> Right.
>> It's what you want.

95
00:04:47.820 --> 00:04:48.339
>> Very good.

96
00:04:50.140 --> 00:04:52.710
So a little shift of a paste here.

97
00:04:52.710 --> 00:04:59.020
Let me undo all of this and we get back
to where we were, original opening.

98
00:04:59.020 --> 00:05:01.830
And now we're gonna go over
something called filters.

99
00:05:01.830 --> 00:05:08.140
These are similar to the social media
filters you see, but these are more fun.

100
00:05:08.140 --> 00:05:08.890
These are great.

101
00:05:10.570 --> 00:05:13.710
So it's got a filter and
then let's go to the filter gallery.

102
00:05:13.710 --> 00:05:14.720
This is really cool.

103
00:05:14.720 --> 00:05:16.460
You get to see so

104
00:05:16.460 --> 00:05:21.490
many different ways to manipulate your
image and they're all roughly one click.

105
00:05:21.490 --> 00:05:24.190
Or if you wanna adjust
you could be 100 clicks.

106
00:05:24.190 --> 00:05:26.850
But it's as easy as one click if you want.

107
00:05:26.850 --> 00:05:29.750
So I open up all these
folders on the right.

108
00:05:29.750 --> 00:05:31.820
So these are all the filter
options we have.

109
00:05:31.820 --> 00:05:35.460
>> Wow.
>> There's quite a bit there, a lot.

110
00:05:35.460 --> 00:05:37.550
So lets start with the first one,
see what it does.

111
00:05:37.550 --> 00:05:39.000
It's called colored pencil.

112
00:05:39.000 --> 00:05:42.940
It's very hard to see there, but
trust me it says colors pencil.

113
00:05:42.940 --> 00:05:43.764
Well click it, and

114
00:05:43.764 --> 00:05:47.068
then now it's making our image look
like it was drawn with a colored pencil.

115
00:05:47.068 --> 00:05:47.683
>> Yeah.

116
00:05:47.683 --> 00:05:53.750
>> The realism of this, it really
depends on your level of imagination.

117
00:05:53.750 --> 00:05:58.200
But you can actually change the pencil
width to make it seem either more or

118
00:05:58.200 --> 00:06:00.070
less realistic.

119
00:06:00.070 --> 00:06:03.010
So right now I just increased
the pencil width and

120
00:06:03.010 --> 00:06:04.910
it looks more like a drawing now.

121
00:06:04.910 --> 00:06:08.150
So tons of options to play around with.

122
00:06:08.150 --> 00:06:11.550
Sometimes if you have a big picture,
it'll take a little bit to actually-

123
00:06:11.550 --> 00:06:13.570
>> The rendering of that.

124
00:06:13.570 --> 00:06:14.540
>> Take effect.
Yeah, the rendering.

125
00:06:14.540 --> 00:06:16.650
And it also depends on
the computer speed you have,

126
00:06:16.650 --> 00:06:19.280
so keep that in mind
when adjusting things.

127
00:06:19.280 --> 00:06:20.750
But let's check the next one.

128
00:06:22.310 --> 00:06:24.430
Cut out, now this is pretty neat.

129
00:06:24.430 --> 00:06:26.130
Go for kinda a pop art style.

130
00:06:27.190 --> 00:06:30.040
So and then you could change
the different amount of levels.

131
00:06:30.040 --> 00:06:32.680
So the more or less colors that are used.

132
00:06:32.680 --> 00:06:34.586
More levels, more colors.

133
00:06:34.586 --> 00:06:40.190
Pretty artistic right there.

134
00:06:40.190 --> 00:06:43.590
So if you wanna be a fake artist,
just take a picture [LAUGH] and

135
00:06:43.590 --> 00:06:44.770
throw it in with filters on there.

136
00:06:44.770 --> 00:06:46.425
And you will be famous.

137
00:06:46.425 --> 00:06:49.285
>> [LAUGH]
>> For your friends, at least.

138
00:06:49.285 --> 00:06:52.110
>> [LAUGH]
>> So a few other ones here to check out.

139
00:06:52.110 --> 00:06:53.570
We have a dry brush.

140
00:06:53.570 --> 00:06:56.430
I'm just gonna go through these so

379
00:19:16.560 --> 00:19:19.680
And then the next one down
is a reconstruct tool.

380
00:19:19.680 --> 00:19:20.820
Then you have a pucker tool.

381
00:19:20.820 --> 00:19:22.850
And then you have a bloat tool.

382
00:19:22.850 --> 00:19:27.110
Bloat tool is kinda like that spherized
ball going through your picture.

383
00:19:28.590 --> 00:19:33.700
So let me check the different tools right
here, and there is one that's really cool.

384
00:19:33.700 --> 00:19:34.930
Yep, the pucker tool.

385
00:19:34.930 --> 00:19:39.950
It will take whatever's in your,
it's really hard to see,

386
00:19:39.950 --> 00:19:43.670
whatever's in my brush, and
then it'll just start puckering it down.

387
00:19:43.670 --> 00:19:45.060
>> Yeah,
right there towards the top-middle.

388
00:19:45.060 --> 00:19:45.560
>> Yeah.
>> Yeah.

389
00:19:47.020 --> 00:19:48.550
>> That's how you would slim someone down.

390
00:19:48.550 --> 00:19:49.410
And I'll go here.

391
00:19:49.410 --> 00:19:52.020
I'll slim down this black
area on the top right.

392
00:19:52.020 --> 00:19:52.858
See that's get slimmed down.

393
00:19:52.858 --> 00:19:54.527
Gone.

394
00:19:54.527 --> 00:19:55.780
>> Wow.

395
00:19:55.780 --> 00:19:59.420
>> Then the bloat tool
will do the opposite.

396
00:19:59.420 --> 00:20:05.660
So if I wanna go up,
make that bigger, bloat it out.

397
00:20:07.430 --> 00:20:10.188
>> You're really starting to give us
some of those inconsistencies and

398
00:20:10.188 --> 00:20:12.570
irregularities you normally see in wood.

399
00:20:12.570 --> 00:20:13.480
Very cool.
>> Exactly.

400
00:20:13.480 --> 00:20:16.120
And another one, I believe it's over here.

401
00:20:19.300 --> 00:20:23.720
There are options here if you want to
adjust anything to have more fun with it.

402
00:20:23.720 --> 00:20:25.920
Advanced mode turns on
a lot of different options.

403
00:20:27.340 --> 00:20:30.980
And yeah, it's fun,
you just like make some notches here.

404
00:20:32.540 --> 00:20:35.640
Just kind of like wood grain
is never always perfect.

405
00:20:35.640 --> 00:20:38.561
And also if you want to
do something else too, so

406
00:20:38.561 --> 00:20:40.985
let's have some fun fingerpainting.

407
00:20:40.985 --> 00:20:45.639
I'll turn off the wood grain right now,
just so we can mess around with the,

408
00:20:45.639 --> 00:20:48.286
let's actually render some clouds here.

409
00:20:48.286 --> 00:20:54.185
Filter > Render > Clouds, so
I'll have some brown and white clouds.

410
00:20:54.185 --> 00:20:58.521
[SOUND] That looks all right,
but I wanna have fun with it, so.

411
00:20:58.521 --> 00:21:00.905
>> LA morning, [LAUGH] got a little smog.

412
00:21:00.905 --> 00:21:02.260
[LAUGH]
>> Yep.

413
00:21:02.260 --> 00:21:06.220
Let's go to Filter > Liquify and
this is when you feel like a kid,

414
00:21:06.220 --> 00:21:08.670
you're like a 4 year-old, just paint away.

415
00:21:08.670 --> 00:21:09.490
>> [LAUGH] Nice.

416
00:21:09.490 --> 00:21:10.080
>> It's fun.

417
00:21:11.220 --> 00:21:18.000
It's a good stress reliever, too, and
it really gets your creativity flowing.

418
00:21:18.000 --> 00:21:19.586
>> Much better than a whole rake and
a cat box.

419
00:21:19.586 --> 00:21:24.750
[LAUGH]
>> Exactly.

420
00:21:24.750 --> 00:21:26.450
Liquefying is really fun.

421
00:21:26.450 --> 00:21:28.580
And you could do a bunch
of cool things with it.

422
00:21:28.580 --> 00:21:29.155
>> Absolutely.

423
00:21:29.155 --> 00:21:31.515
[LAUGH]
>> So we go down to here.

424
00:21:31.515 --> 00:21:32.073
Okay.

425
00:21:32.073 --> 00:21:33.977
And there's my piece of art right there.

426
00:21:33.977 --> 00:21:36.938
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

427
00:21:36.938 --> 00:21:38.548
>> Next, I think we have to do

428
00:21:38.548 --> 00:21:40.315
a little bit of sharpening.

429
00:21:40.315 --> 00:21:40.990
>> All right.

430
00:21:40.990 --> 00:21:42.350
>> But let's go back to an image for that.

431
00:21:43.670 --> 00:21:48.400
Sharpening is kind of something that's, it
would be awesome if it'd always work, but

432
00:21:48.400 --> 00:21:53.170
it's not always the, it's kind of magical.

433
00:21:53.170 --> 00:21:57.810
But it doesn't always do what you
think it will, because if your image

434
00:21:57.810 --> 00:22:01.382
is out of focus, then it's
probably gonna stay out of focus.

435
00:22:01.382 --> 00:22:02.570
>> It's not gonna fix that for you.

436
00:22:02.570 --> 00:22:05.974
>> Right, it could help, but
it won't magically always fix it.

437
00:22:05.974 --> 00:22:09.200
>> Right.
>> So, that's good to have, sometimes.

438
00:22:09.200 --> 00:22:12.528
So we'll try,
let's do a Filter > Sharpen, and

439
00:22:12.528 --> 00:22:16.420
then let's do just a regular Sharpen and
see what it does.

440
00:22:18.780 --> 00:22:23.910
Now we'll have to zoom in to actually see
anything, but it's still hard to see.

441
00:22:23.910 --> 00:22:25.410
So, you can't really tell.

442
00:22:25.410 --> 00:22:31.950
The overall filters in sharpening, it's
very hard to see whether it works or not.

443
00:22:31.950 --> 00:22:37.084
You can go to Unsharp Mask is another
to sharpen images this way you'd

444
00:22:37.084 --> 00:22:42.110
have sliders to work on and
manipulate and see if this will help.

445
00:22:42.110 --> 00:22:45.260
In this case, it's getting grainier so

446
00:22:45.260 --> 00:22:49.740
lower the amount,
the radius is pretty good.

447
00:22:49.740 --> 00:22:51.550
But you see it sharpens a little bit.

448
00:22:51.550 --> 00:22:54.560
And then the threshold
you could change too.

449
00:22:54.560 --> 00:22:58.040
So you see it's blurry right here,
looking blurry.

450
00:22:58.040 --> 00:23:00.665
Lower the threshold,
it'll get a little sharper.

451
00:23:00.665 --> 00:23:02.130
>> Mm-hm.

452
00:23:02.130 --> 00:23:03.780
>> But it's very subtle.

453
00:23:05.390 --> 00:23:09.860
So, with photography, it's recommended
just try to get a clear image.

454
00:23:11.510 --> 00:23:15.420
>> Photoshop can fix a lot but you really
have to have a good picture to start with.

455
00:23:15.420 --> 00:23:17.443
>> Exactly.
>> It's better to have a good picture to

456
00:23:17.443 --> 00:23:18.000
start with.

457
00:23:18.000 --> 00:23:21.133
>> Unless you want to be more creative and
just have some crazy stuff

458
00:23:21.133 --> 00:23:23.932
going on to kind of divert
your attention from the focus.

459
00:23:23.932 --> 00:23:27.171
>> All right, Nick.

460
00:23:27.171 --> 00:23:28.950
Well, a lot of great stuff there.

461
00:23:28.950 --> 00:23:32.960
Good look at all the different filters and
adjustments that we can make.

462
00:23:32.960 --> 00:23:35.640
Kinda getting into some of those
cool filters we've got in and

463
00:23:35.640 --> 00:23:37.950
some really cool tools there
towards the end as well.

464
00:23:37.950 --> 00:23:39.190
So we appreciate that.

465
00:23:39.190 --> 00:23:40.920
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

466
00:23:40.920 --> 00:23:43.740
Signing off for ITProTV,
I'm Mike Roderick.

467
00:23:43.740 --> 00:23:44.650
>> And I'm Nick Page.

468
00:23:44.650 --> 00:23:47.466
>> We'll see you next time.

469
00:23:47.466 --> 00:23:51.030
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Try It Out! Colors and Filters
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.044 --> 00:00:15.341
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.341 --> 00:00:16.900
I'm your host, Mike Rodrick.

4
00:00:16.900 --> 00:00:22.680
Today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC2015,
and specifically in this episode,

5
00:00:22.680 --> 00:00:25.900
it's time again for one of those
exciting try it out exercises.

6
00:00:25.900 --> 00:00:29.301
In this one we're gonna be doing
colors and filters with Mr. Nick Page.

7
00:00:29.301 --> 00:00:30.180
How's it going, Nick?

8
00:00:30.180 --> 00:00:30.900
>> Pretty good.

9
00:00:30.900 --> 00:00:33.850
I'm really in the mood to try
some little photo editing and

10
00:00:33.850 --> 00:00:36.470
I'll show you my workflow so
you can get this whole thing.

11
00:00:37.660 --> 00:00:38.730
I'll wrap it around for you so

12
00:00:38.730 --> 00:00:40.410
it's easier to-
>> All right.

13
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:41.350
>> Take in.

14
00:00:41.350 --> 00:00:42.300
>> [LAUGH]
>> I like it.

15
00:00:42.300 --> 00:00:44.040
All right.
So, we'll start off on here.

16
00:00:44.040 --> 00:00:46.290
I'm gonna load in this
mountain.jpg picture.

17
00:00:47.910 --> 00:00:49.777
This is a picture taken in Tennessee.

18
00:00:49.777 --> 00:00:51.725
It's got nice little scenery and
everything.

19
00:00:51.725 --> 00:00:52.600
>> Mm-hm.
>> But

20
00:00:52.600 --> 00:00:55.320
there's something that I kinda
wanna change about this.

21
00:00:55.320 --> 00:01:02.080
So, first off, I will go through
a few of the layer adjustments.

22
00:01:02.080 --> 00:01:05.970
So I'll go start off by going to layers,

23
00:01:05.970 --> 00:01:08.480
unlocking this because I want
to make some edits to it.

24
00:01:08.480 --> 00:01:12.170
And then let me copy this just so
I have it so

25
00:01:12.170 --> 00:01:15.450
I have my original to go back to and
I'll make it invisible, just so.

26
00:01:15.450 --> 00:01:19.170
I always like to do that to make
sure I don't lose anything.

27
00:01:19.170 --> 00:01:20.200
>> A safety net kind of thing.

28
00:01:20.200 --> 00:01:24.970
>> Yeah it's my safety net so I'll keep
that there and then I'll label it.

29
00:01:24.970 --> 00:01:27.920
If it'll let me label it.

30
00:01:27.920 --> 00:01:32.770
First you right click and
it's not letting me label.

31
00:01:32.770 --> 00:01:33.660
There we go, double click.

32
00:01:33.660 --> 00:01:40.360
All right So I'll put this as a safety
net just so I know it's there.

33
00:01:40.360 --> 00:01:42.561
This one will be my backyard.

34
00:01:42.561 --> 00:01:49.558
All right, so let me go back and
select my visible layer.

35
00:01:49.558 --> 00:01:53.132
And then what I'm gonna do is
go to the image adjustments, and

36
00:01:53.132 --> 00:01:56.650
let's take a look and
see what these auto guys do, again.

37
00:01:56.650 --> 00:01:58.530
Auto Tone, Contrast, and Color.

38
00:01:58.530 --> 00:02:01.412
Auto tone makes it a little darker,
I don't like it.

39
00:02:01.412 --> 00:02:05.170
Let's try again, Image > Auto Contrast.

40
00:02:05.170 --> 00:02:07.450
Eh, still don't like it.

41
00:02:07.450 --> 00:02:10.170
Image, oops, Image > Auto Color.

42
00:02:10.170 --> 00:02:14.250
Nah, they all get too dark and I don't
want dark, I want to kind of lighten up

43
00:02:14.250 --> 00:02:18.490
the bottom half, and darken the top half,
so it'll kinda be more balanced.

44
00:02:18.490 --> 00:02:21.250
Cuz right now,
these trees are in the shadows.

45
00:02:21.250 --> 00:02:24.640
And you don't even know
what color those trees are.

46
00:02:24.640 --> 00:02:27.200
They could be brown,
they could be green, you don't know.

47
00:02:27.200 --> 00:02:29.600
So we'll find out with Photoshop.

48
00:02:30.880 --> 00:02:33.140
So I'm going to go to
image adjustments and

49
00:02:33.140 --> 00:02:36.500
then let's do a edit the shadows and
highlights.

50
00:02:36.500 --> 00:02:37.169
I love this.

51
00:02:38.450 --> 00:02:39.760
>> Wow.
>> Look at that!

52
00:02:39.760 --> 00:02:41.295
It already made my image look great.

53
00:02:41.295 --> 00:02:42.300
>> [LAUGH] It did, didn't it?

54
00:02:42.300 --> 00:02:44.280
>> From nothing to that-
>> [LAUGH]

55
00:02:44.280 --> 00:02:47.190
>> In one click, so I want to tweak a few

56
00:02:47.190 --> 00:02:52.060
more settings to get this right, but
I'm liking where it's going so far.

57
00:02:52.060 --> 00:02:54.480
So let's do a transitive amount of shadow.

58
00:02:54.480 --> 00:02:57.680
I want the shadows to be a little darker,
so I'll put them there.

59
00:02:57.680 --> 00:03:02.920
Change of tone, see what that does, I like
it right about there and it's all about,

60
00:03:02.920 --> 00:03:05.635
you don't really need to know
the exact numbers of it.

61
00:03:05.635 --> 00:03:10.390
It's just going for
what you see looks right or looks better.

62
00:03:10.390 --> 00:03:12.339
So it's all about playing
with the sliders.

63
00:03:13.520 --> 00:03:15.940
>> Yeah, there's no magic number for
each one of these settings.

64
00:03:15.940 --> 00:03:17.774
Each picture is gonna be different and

65
00:03:17.774 --> 00:03:20.752
then your opinion of what looks
good is gonna be different, or

66
00:03:20.752 --> 00:03:24.430
what your market is, so just play with
them until you see what you like.

67
00:03:24.430 --> 00:03:25.530
>> Exactly.
>> Nice.

68
00:03:25.530 --> 00:03:26.126
>> Yep.

69
00:03:26.126 --> 00:03:27.160
So I'm gonna adjust my highlights and

70
00:03:27.160 --> 00:03:31.260
see raising this makes my
sky look bluer right there.

71
00:03:31.260 --> 00:03:32.805
So that's pretty cool.

72
00:03:32.805 --> 00:03:34.780
Change some tone around,

73
00:03:34.780 --> 00:03:39.395
see if I can get some more colors
out of that and the radius.

74
00:03:39.395 --> 00:03:41.960
Yeah, that really brings
out the trees right there.

75
00:03:41.960 --> 00:03:43.440
>> Yeah, the ones right above the horizon.

76
00:03:43.440 --> 00:03:44.640
>> Yep.
>> They really popped out.

77
00:03:44.640 --> 00:03:46.320
>> Yep, so
let's change some adjustments now.

78
00:03:46.320 --> 00:03:49.580
The color,
this is washing out the color right now.

79
00:03:49.580 --> 00:03:51.020
It's looking very bland.

80
00:03:51.020 --> 00:03:54.860
But when we bring it up,
now got some vibrance there.

81
00:03:54.860 --> 00:03:57.060
Then change the mid-tones around,
see what it does.

82
00:03:57.060 --> 00:03:58.760
This is darkening the image it looks like,

83
00:03:58.760 --> 00:04:02.480
so let's bring it back to kind
of lighten it a little more.

84
00:04:02.480 --> 00:04:03.758
So now we're here.

85
00:04:03.758 --> 00:04:07.390
And then let me hit OK to apply that.

86
00:04:07.390 --> 00:04:12.478
Now let's look and see what we just did,
I'll hit Ctrl-Z, or Cmd-Z depending on

87
00:04:12.478 --> 00:04:17.690
if you're Windows or Mac to do an undo and
we'll see what difference this makes.

88
00:04:17.690 --> 00:04:20.800
That's what we started with,
that's what we turned it into.

89
00:04:20.800 --> 00:04:24.290
>> A huge difference.
>> So very powerful image adjustment.

90
00:04:24.290 --> 00:04:27.380
So let's take this a step further now.

91
00:04:27.380 --> 00:04:29.780
Now we adjusted to how we want it.

92
00:04:29.780 --> 00:04:33.330
I want to kind of have some fun with it.

93
00:04:33.330 --> 00:04:34.355
We'll see about this.

94
00:04:34.355 --> 00:04:37.200
>> [LAUGH]
>> Let's do a, I'll make a new layer.

95
00:04:38.440 --> 00:04:41.845
And what I'm gonna do,
I'm gonna name this fire.

96
00:04:41.845 --> 00:04:43.320
>> Uh-oh.

97
00:04:43.320 --> 00:04:45.015
>> With an exclamation
point cuz it's fire!

98
00:04:45.015 --> 00:04:49.600
>> [LAUGH]
>> So on this layer I'll go to filter and

99
00:04:49.600 --> 00:04:52.630
I will render
>> There's a cool thing right there

100
00:04:52.630 --> 00:04:54.100
called the flame.

101
00:04:54.100 --> 00:04:59.050
To do this, though, I'll click it now,
it won't work, it'll give me an error.

102
00:04:59.050 --> 00:05:04.830
I need to select, and I need a path to
show what this thing will be shaped as,

103
00:05:04.830 --> 00:05:06.870
or what it will write on.

104
00:05:06.870 --> 00:05:10.540
In this case, I'll use the pen tool we
learned about a little bit earlier.

105
00:05:10.540 --> 00:05:14.620
It'll probably touch more on it in
a later episode, but in this case,

106
00:05:14.620 --> 00:05:19.620
I'm just gonna do a quick little path,
this anchor point from point A to point B,

107
00:05:19.620 --> 00:05:22.330
and then add a little
bit of curve into it,

108
00:05:22.330 --> 00:05:26.200
just kinda to hug that
ground where the trees are.

109
00:05:26.200 --> 00:05:28.760
So now I have this path,
it's just two anchor points.

110
00:05:29.790 --> 00:05:33.997
I'll go back to Filter > Render > Flame.

111
00:05:33.997 --> 00:05:36.870
So now it's loading.

112
00:05:36.870 --> 00:05:40.630
And then we have, this is what
the flame will probably look like.

113
00:05:40.630 --> 00:05:46.270
I can edit the length and randomize it so
it's more like a regular flame.

114
00:05:46.270 --> 00:05:50.660
It's really no continuity at all,
it just does what it wants to.

115
00:05:50.660 --> 00:05:53.410
So here I'm gonna just
change everything around.

116
00:05:53.410 --> 00:05:55.230
Add some width to it.

117
00:05:55.230 --> 00:06:00.390
Have some fun with the options until
it gets to how I want it to look.

118
00:06:00.390 --> 00:06:01.475
That's not good, no.

119
00:06:01.475 --> 00:06:04.224
>> [LAUGH]
>> I like the straight up and down,

120
00:06:04.224 --> 00:06:05.640
roughly.

121
00:06:05.640 --> 00:06:06.160
That's good.

122
00:06:06.160 --> 00:06:07.300
Let me add a little bit of angle.

123
00:06:07.300 --> 00:06:07.900
That should be good.

124
00:06:09.110 --> 00:06:10.570
And changing interval.

125
00:06:10.570 --> 00:06:13.880
These options do so
many different things so have fun with it.

126
00:06:13.880 --> 00:06:17.990
And there's also different flame
types too, like candlelight.

127
00:06:17.990 --> 00:06:20.968
So you could actually,
you can take a picture of a candle, and

128
00:06:20.968 --> 00:06:24.709
put a flame on it with Photoshop and
it would look real, it's a possibility.

129
00:06:24.709 --> 00:06:28.178
>> That's pretty darn handy cuz you think
with that candle sitting in the middle of

130
00:06:28.178 --> 00:06:31.042
your picture, it really throws
off a lot of your other settings.

131
00:06:31.042 --> 00:06:33.070
You've got this bright light right there.

132
00:06:33.070 --> 00:06:35.890
So leave the candle blown out,
take your picture, and

133
00:06:35.890 --> 00:06:37.120
then light it back up in Photoshop.

134
00:06:37.120 --> 00:06:38.370
>> Yep, it's perfect.

135
00:06:38.370 --> 00:06:39.182
>> Impressive.

136
00:06:39.182 --> 00:06:42.240
[LAUGH]
>> So there's also advanced settings.

137
00:06:42.240 --> 00:06:45.260
Which, even more slider
stuff to have fun with, but

138
00:06:45.260 --> 00:06:48.636
I'll let you do that on your own,
try it out, so.

139
00:06:48.636 --> 00:06:49.293
>> [LAUGH]
>> All right.

140
00:06:49.293 --> 00:06:50.650
So now I hit OK.

141
00:06:50.650 --> 00:06:52.570
Let's see what this does.

142
00:06:52.570 --> 00:06:55.070
And we might have a forest fire here.

143
00:06:55.070 --> 00:06:55.630
>> Uh-oh.

144
00:06:55.630 --> 00:06:56.523
>> There it is, it's on fire.

145
00:06:56.523 --> 00:06:58.252
>> I'll be darned, look at that.

146
00:06:58.252 --> 00:06:59.010
That is impressive.

147
00:06:59.010 --> 00:07:00.620
>> So that's kind of scary, too.

148
00:07:00.620 --> 00:07:01.638
But there it is.

149
00:07:01.638 --> 00:07:03.250
It leads us there and not here.

150
00:07:03.250 --> 00:07:04.105
>> Yeah.
>> We're all good.

151
00:07:04.105 --> 00:07:06.410
>> [LAUGH]
>> So

152
00:07:06.410 --> 00:07:10.210
another thing we're gonna do is add a
tree, cuz we burnt down a bunch of trees.

153
00:07:10.210 --> 00:07:12.140
We've got to plant the tree now, so.

154
00:07:12.140 --> 00:07:18.728
Photoshop actually has the ability to
render a tree, it's weird I don't know.

155
00:07:18.728 --> 00:07:21.628
>> [LAUGH]
>> It just seems random,

156
00:07:21.628 --> 00:07:25.660
I wanna tree yeah, Filter,
let's go to render a tree.

157
00:07:25.660 --> 00:07:27.110
So, let's render a tree,

158
00:07:27.110 --> 00:07:30.060
let me do this on a different
layer though because just like,

159
00:07:30.060 --> 00:07:32.880
it's always good to do different layers
because right here my fire is on a layer.

160
00:07:32.880 --> 00:07:34.430
I could turn it off if I want to.

161
00:07:34.430 --> 00:07:36.650
I want to turn my tree off,

162
00:07:36.650 --> 00:07:39.940
I don't have the option to turn my tree
off so put that on a new layer as well.

163
00:07:39.940 --> 00:07:44.070
So now, on that new layer,
I'll do Filter > Render > Tree.

164
00:07:45.400 --> 00:07:48.920
So now,
there are a lot of trees in here too.

165
00:07:48.920 --> 00:07:51.230
So this is a weird looking tree.

166
00:07:51.230 --> 00:07:55.498
Let me change this around to,
let me reset.

167
00:07:55.498 --> 00:07:56.760
There's a reset button too.

168
00:07:56.760 --> 00:07:59.780
If you had previous settings,
it's always good to reset.

169
00:08:00.900 --> 00:08:03.190
>> I remember the last you
were planting trees, right?

170
00:08:03.190 --> 00:08:06.470
>> Yeah, yeah, planting trees doesn't
always go the same every time, so

171
00:08:06.470 --> 00:08:08.650
you gotta be careful about that.

172
00:08:08.650 --> 00:08:09.820
So lets do a spruce tree.

173
00:08:09.820 --> 00:08:11.470
See what this looks like.

174
00:08:11.470 --> 00:08:12.990
That's a weird looking spruce tree.

175
00:08:12.990 --> 00:08:17.016
Hold on, I might be,
I might have some funky settings there.

176
00:08:17.016 --> 00:08:17.968
That's why.

177
00:08:17.968 --> 00:08:22.015
All right learning this here.

178
00:08:22.015 --> 00:08:27.105
So what happened, why the tree looks so
weird, my path is still there.

179
00:08:27.105 --> 00:08:28.935
So I was actually planting
a tree along a path.

180
00:08:28.935 --> 00:08:30.175
>> So it was along that line.

181
00:08:30.175 --> 00:08:31.395
>> Right, so
that's why it looks all funky.

182
00:08:31.395 --> 00:08:35.225
So now what I'll do,
go to the Paths panel.

183
00:08:35.225 --> 00:08:37.495
And I can actually get
rid of that work path.

184
00:08:38.760 --> 00:08:41.100
We'll see what it does, good, gone.

185
00:08:41.100 --> 00:08:43.860
So now my path is not selected anymore and

186
00:08:43.860 --> 00:08:46.360
I can go back to my layer,
it's already there.

187
00:08:46.360 --> 00:08:48.120
And then let's try planting again,

188
00:08:48.120 --> 00:08:51.290
don't wanna have another path
disaster with the trees.

189
00:08:51.290 --> 00:08:55.450
So we'll plant a tree, and this time
it will actually look like a tree.

190
00:08:55.450 --> 00:08:56.760
There-
>> Nice.

191
00:08:56.760 --> 00:08:57.410
>> A tree.
>> [LAUGH]

192
00:08:57.410 --> 00:08:59.590
>> Now there are tons of trees here.

193
00:08:59.590 --> 00:09:02.680
What would probably go well,
let's do a redwood.

194
00:09:02.680 --> 00:09:05.615
That might go well in the Tennessee area.

195
00:09:05.615 --> 00:09:07.050
>> [LAUGH]
>> So here's a redwood tree,

196
00:09:07.050 --> 00:09:10.420
and I just think it's crazy how
many types of trees they have.

197
00:09:10.420 --> 00:09:12.080
>> That's really specific.

198
00:09:12.080 --> 00:09:13.913
>> Yeah,
there's probably some tree lovers.

199
00:09:13.913 --> 00:09:15.793
They just love-
>> [LAUGH]

200
00:09:15.793 --> 00:09:18.023
>> I don't know, some tree scientists or

201
00:09:18.023 --> 00:09:20.540
something, Photoshop Land.

202
00:09:20.540 --> 00:09:24.150
You could adjust the light direction so
it kinda matches to where the sun

203
00:09:24.150 --> 00:09:28.230
is coming from in your image,
to try to make it blend better.

204
00:09:28.230 --> 00:09:30.130
Certain trees will show
it better than others.

205
00:09:30.130 --> 00:09:32.662
You can see right here,
the light is on the left side.

206
00:09:32.662 --> 00:09:37.432
And then when I change over to here,
the light will probably move to the right,

207
00:09:37.432 --> 00:09:41.570
like that, very subtle, but
you can change that if you want to.

208
00:09:41.570 --> 00:09:42.485
It's good to have that option.

209
00:09:42.485 --> 00:09:46.047
>> And very important, it's one of those
things that will make a picture show up as

210
00:09:46.047 --> 00:09:49.662
a fake pretty quick, when you see that
everything's shadow is moving to the left

211
00:09:49.662 --> 00:09:53.350
and back on the image, except for this one
thing that has a shadow coming forward.

212
00:09:53.350 --> 00:09:55.900
So it's one of those things,
you really have to pay attention to that.

213
00:09:55.900 --> 00:09:57.260
>> Exactly.

214
00:09:57.260 --> 00:09:59.560
I can change the amount
of leaves on here too.

215
00:09:59.560 --> 00:10:03.620
So if you wanna have a very barren tree or
a very healthy tree.

216
00:10:03.620 --> 00:10:04.900
>> Yeah.

217
00:10:04.900 --> 00:10:09.170
>> So I'm gonna go for a moderate there
and there I can change the leaf size too.

218
00:10:09.170 --> 00:10:11.730
More stuff you can
experiment on your own with.

219
00:10:11.730 --> 00:10:16.160
I will leave it as it is now and
then I'll hit OK, rendering a tree.

220
00:10:17.480 --> 00:10:18.420
There's my tree.

221
00:10:18.420 --> 00:10:22.680
So now I'll use my move tool
gonna move it to right here.

222
00:10:22.680 --> 00:10:25.980
Now let me make it a little bit smaller so
hit command or

223
00:10:25.980 --> 00:10:31.770
control T and then I'm going to
pull up the free transform tool.

224
00:10:31.770 --> 00:10:36.540
Now I want to hold Shift and
bring it down by the corner, so

225
00:10:36.540 --> 00:10:38.410
it will keep it proportional.

226
00:10:38.410 --> 00:10:41.810
So now I have myself a tree and a fire.

227
00:10:41.810 --> 00:10:42.830
>> Wow!

228
00:10:42.830 --> 00:10:43.636
Impressive stuff!

229
00:10:43.636 --> 00:10:44.297
>> Pretty good!

230
00:10:44.297 --> 00:10:48.962
>> [LAUGH]
>> So next, I've made some art now, so

231
00:10:48.962 --> 00:10:52.017
I really just wanna frame it.

232
00:10:52.017 --> 00:10:53.978
That's what you wanna do when you-
>> Absolutely.

233
00:10:53.978 --> 00:10:55.197
>> Make crazy art stuff.

234
00:10:55.197 --> 00:10:56.462
So let's do that right now.

235
00:10:56.462 --> 00:10:58.969
Another one of the rendering options, so,

236
00:10:58.969 --> 00:11:03.056
to do this I'll start new layer again,
because always layer.

237
00:11:03.056 --> 00:11:10.540
Also label as tree just to keep
the less confusion in this frame.

238
00:11:10.540 --> 00:11:12.700
>> Yes, Carol will get us if we
don't keep our layers organized.

239
00:11:12.700 --> 00:11:13.629
>> Exactly.

240
00:11:13.629 --> 00:11:17.019
I would color code these, but
I don't have enough time right now.

241
00:11:17.019 --> 00:11:22.039
[LAUGH] So on my frame layer,
what I'm gonna

242
00:11:22.039 --> 00:11:27.080
do is go Filter > Render > Picture Frame.

243
00:11:27.080 --> 00:11:28.290
So I click that.

244
00:11:28.290 --> 00:11:29.770
Easy as that, done.

245
00:11:29.770 --> 00:11:34.553
I could change a bunch of different
styles, I can do a wooden style frame,

246
00:11:34.553 --> 00:11:36.800
I can do some, what was it up here?

247
00:11:36.800 --> 00:11:39.393
A happy little vine, look at that.

248
00:11:39.393 --> 00:11:41.250
>> [LAUGH]
>> Happy vine, it's great.

249
00:11:42.500 --> 00:11:43.310
He's happy.

250
00:11:43.310 --> 00:11:47.680
>> Yeah, in this case, I'm just gonna do
a kind of traditional art frame cuz I

251
00:11:47.680 --> 00:11:49.200
do have a work of art here.

252
00:11:49.200 --> 00:11:50.970
And vine color.

253
00:11:50.970 --> 00:11:53.750
That probably should not be,
that probably should say frame color,

254
00:11:53.750 --> 00:11:56.610
but Photoshop is always
a work in progress.

255
00:11:56.610 --> 00:12:00.180
So let's change it to a, let's do a blue.

256
00:12:01.980 --> 00:12:05.230
There is a lighter blue greenish tint.

257
00:12:05.230 --> 00:12:06.970
So hit OK.

258
00:12:06.970 --> 00:12:08.180
There's my frame.

259
00:12:08.180 --> 00:12:10.750
I'll hit OK and I'll render that frame.

260
00:12:10.750 --> 00:12:16.860
So now I want to fit that into my picture.

261
00:12:16.860 --> 00:12:19.970
So to do that there's a hundred
different ways to do this but

262
00:12:19.970 --> 00:12:25.670
the way I will do it this time
will be a kind of, let's see.

263
00:12:25.670 --> 00:12:28.800
What I wanna do, I wanna copy these and
put them in a, or

264
00:12:28.800 --> 00:12:33.860
I just wanna put all these in a group
because these are all different layers.

265
00:12:33.860 --> 00:12:36.370
And I'd rather kind of
consolidate them into one so

266
00:12:36.370 --> 00:12:38.765
I could resize them all
down to the frame size.

267
00:12:38.765 --> 00:12:39.320
>> Mm-hm.

268
00:12:39.320 --> 00:12:42.000
>> So to do this I'm gonna
select all these three.

269
00:12:42.000 --> 00:12:47.610
So select one, hold Ctrl, or Cmd if you're
on a Mac, and then click the others.

270
00:12:47.610 --> 00:12:49.750
And then I wanna put these in a group.

271
00:12:49.750 --> 00:12:53.810
So I'm just gonna click and
drag down to the folder, down here.

272
00:12:54.880 --> 00:12:56.890
And then that'll make group one.

273
00:12:56.890 --> 00:13:00.138
I'll rename this to My Artwork.

274
00:13:03.249 --> 00:13:04.630
So there's my artwork here.

275
00:13:04.630 --> 00:13:06.740
So you could test out to see what's in it.

276
00:13:06.740 --> 00:13:09.120
If I just turn off the visibility and
everything goes away,

277
00:13:09.120 --> 00:13:10.910
that means I got everything.

278
00:13:10.910 --> 00:13:12.910
So now I wanna keep this here.

279
00:13:12.910 --> 00:13:17.260
And then I also want to flatten it so
it's all one piece.

280
00:13:17.260 --> 00:13:20.510
I could use Ctrl+E to
flatten this entire folder.

281
00:13:20.510 --> 00:13:22.890
But now I don't have my layers anymore so
I'm going to undo that.

282
00:13:22.890 --> 00:13:25.220
I would copy this again.

283
00:13:25.220 --> 00:13:28.350
So I take this folder now, copy it and

284
00:13:28.350 --> 00:13:31.070
copy it by going dragging it
down to the new layer panel.

285
00:13:32.640 --> 00:13:35.010
And then I have my work
copy my artwork copy.

286
00:13:35.010 --> 00:13:39.747
So now I'll do my flattened art.

287
00:13:39.747 --> 00:13:43.902
Okay so I have there and
then I'll flatten this one with Ctrl-E or

288
00:13:43.902 --> 00:13:47.240
I can right click on it and
then flatten merge group.

289
00:13:48.530 --> 00:13:49.880
So now I have this here.

290
00:13:49.880 --> 00:13:50.870
Now I'm able to,

291
00:13:50.870 --> 00:13:55.050
I want to resize this to fit my frame
because you gotta frame your artwork.

292
00:13:55.050 --> 00:13:55.980
>> Absolutely.

293
00:13:55.980 --> 00:13:57.290
>> Let's do this.

294
00:13:57.290 --> 00:14:01.290
I'll go to my flattened art right here and
then I'll want to resize it so

295
00:14:01.290 --> 00:14:02.780
I'll do Ctrl-T.

296
00:14:02.780 --> 00:14:04.210
Or Cmd-T on a Mac.

297
00:14:04.210 --> 00:14:09.170
And then I just wanna hold Shift and
drag it inside.

298
00:14:09.170 --> 00:14:10.840
>> We've still got our original artwork.

299
00:14:10.840 --> 00:14:11.470
>> I do.

300
00:14:11.470 --> 00:14:13.710
So now, that's a pretty cool effect,
actually.

301
00:14:13.710 --> 00:14:14.640
>> It is, isn't it?

302
00:14:14.640 --> 00:14:18.590
>> But I do wanna take off the first one,
so let's see.

303
00:14:18.590 --> 00:14:25.360
They're both visible, so let me make that
one Turn off the visibility so it's gone.

304
00:14:25.360 --> 00:14:28.530
So now I have a beautiful
work of art here.

305
00:14:28.530 --> 00:14:29.500
>> Framed nicely.

306
00:14:29.500 --> 00:14:30.170
>> Framed nicely.

307
00:14:30.170 --> 00:14:31.184
>> Ready for sale.

308
00:14:31.184 --> 00:14:32.551
>> Yep.
>> All you gotta do is send

309
00:14:32.551 --> 00:14:35.021
a check to Nick Page at, no, I'm kidding.

310
00:14:35.021 --> 00:14:36.439
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So

311
00:14:36.439 --> 00:14:40.360
it's pretty cool to just see
here's our final product.

312
00:14:40.360 --> 00:14:43.370
Here's what we started with,
it's a pretty big change.

313
00:14:43.370 --> 00:14:44.190
>> It really is.

314
00:14:44.190 --> 00:14:44.920
>> It's cool to see.

315
00:14:44.920 --> 00:14:46.820
So, the power of Photoshop.

316
00:14:46.820 --> 00:14:47.528
>> Very good.

317
00:14:47.528 --> 00:14:49.344
All right, well, ladies and gentlemen,

318
00:14:49.344 --> 00:14:52.670
I hope everybody out there enjoyed playing
along in this try it out exercise.

319
00:14:52.670 --> 00:14:56.640
Really cool how we start with that picture
and end up with a framed work of art with

320
00:14:56.640 --> 00:14:59.740
fire trees that weren't even
in the original picture.

321
00:14:59.740 --> 00:15:01.890
So thank you for that,
Nick, appreciate it.

322
00:15:01.890 --> 00:15:03.470
Hope everybody out there enjoyed it.

323
00:15:03.470 --> 00:15:06.040
Signing off for ITProTV,
I'm Mike Roderick.

324
00:15:06.040 --> 00:15:06.650
>> And I'm Nick Page.

325
00:15:06.650 --> 00:15:08.751
>> And we'll see you next time.

326
00:15:08.751 --> 00:15:15.624
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Image Correction Tools
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.092 --> 00:00:10.092
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.403 --> 00:00:15.070
Hello, welcome to another exciting
episode here at IT Pro TV.

3
00:00:15.070 --> 00:00:21.040
I'm your host Mike Roderick, and
today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

4
00:00:21.040 --> 00:00:22.601
And specifically in this episode,

5
00:00:22.601 --> 00:00:25.680
we're going to be taking a look at
some of our image correction tools.

6
00:00:25.680 --> 00:00:29.140
You know, ideally, obviously we'd start
with the perfect picture every time,

7
00:00:29.140 --> 00:00:30.780
but that's not always possible.

8
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:33.550
We've got to do some retouching,
some fixing, and things like that.

9
00:00:33.550 --> 00:00:36.900
And there's plenty of tools within
Photoshop to help us do that.

10
00:00:36.900 --> 00:00:39.600
And here to help us to walk us
through those tools, is Ms. Kera Page.

11
00:00:39.600 --> 00:00:40.890
How's it going, Kera?

12
00:00:40.890 --> 00:00:41.510
>> I'm great.

13
00:00:41.510 --> 00:00:44.395
I am all set and
ready to correct some images.

14
00:00:44.395 --> 00:00:45.265
[LAUGH]
>> All right.

15
00:00:45.265 --> 00:00:47.120
[LAUGH]
>> All right, so go ahead and

16
00:00:47.120 --> 00:00:49.470
pull up Photoshop if you
don't have it open already.

17
00:00:49.470 --> 00:00:52.830
And we are actually gonna
start with a file this time,

18
00:00:52.830 --> 00:00:56.360
instead of starting from a blank canvas,
which is a new thing for us, I know.

19
00:00:56.360 --> 00:00:58.380
So let's go ahead and go to Open.

20
00:00:59.850 --> 00:01:04.810
And we are going to grab shells.jpeg
is what we're looking for here.

21
00:01:04.810 --> 00:01:06.990
So we're gonna open it up.

22
00:01:06.990 --> 00:01:08.350
We're going back to the beach.

23
00:01:08.350 --> 00:01:09.940
>> All right.
>> And clearly we like the beach.

24
00:01:09.940 --> 00:01:12.230
So we're going back to it.

25
00:01:12.230 --> 00:01:15.720
So I have this little configuration
of shells and a sand dollar,

26
00:01:15.720 --> 00:01:21.040
and a little piece of plant material,
I'm not even sure what it is really.

27
00:01:21.040 --> 00:01:22.320
But it was washed up on the shore.

28
00:01:22.320 --> 00:01:23.950
So we're just going to go with it.

29
00:01:23.950 --> 00:01:27.230
And we're going to play around
with some image correction tools.

30
00:01:27.230 --> 00:01:30.210
So image correction tools are something
that you use a lot on people.

31
00:01:30.210 --> 00:01:35.120
But you can also use them on still
images as well, so plants, textures,

32
00:01:35.120 --> 00:01:38.670
whatever you need to get rid of or
fix, you can do.

33
00:01:38.670 --> 00:01:41.310
So let's go ahead and dive right in.

34
00:01:41.310 --> 00:01:43.800
So we're gonna go to our tool panel.

35
00:01:43.800 --> 00:01:48.700
And all the way over to the left,
you'll have this band-aid looking thing,

36
00:01:48.700 --> 00:01:50.140
with a little dotted line around it.

37
00:01:50.140 --> 00:01:53.300
That is your spot healing brush tool.

38
00:01:53.300 --> 00:01:55.230
So let's see what that does.

39
00:01:55.230 --> 00:01:59.700
Now you'll notice that I have this
little cross-hair type button here.

40
00:01:59.700 --> 00:02:01.980
This works like a brush, and
we know what brushes do.

41
00:02:01.980 --> 00:02:05.130
We know how to adjust the brushes,
we know how to adjust the sizes.

42
00:02:05.130 --> 00:02:08.220
So, this particular brush is very small.

43
00:02:08.220 --> 00:02:12.430
You'll notice that it's nine pixels in the
top left corner, so you can make it larger

44
00:02:12.430 --> 00:02:15.220
here, or you can you use your brackets,
which I'm going to do.

45
00:02:15.220 --> 00:02:18.130
So I'm going to use my right bracket,
make it larger.

46
00:02:18.130 --> 00:02:22.120
Now I can actually see a circle here,
what I'm doing.

47
00:02:22.120 --> 00:02:25.500
So let's try getting rid of this little,
I don't even know what,

48
00:02:25.500 --> 00:02:26.710
a footprint in the sand?

49
00:02:26.710 --> 00:02:28.230
Who knows what this is?

50
00:02:28.230 --> 00:02:33.960
So I'm going to just zoom in so
we can actually see it.

51
00:02:33.960 --> 00:02:37.240
I'm gonna click, hold, and drag across.

52
00:02:37.240 --> 00:02:37.870
>> Wow.

53
00:02:37.870 --> 00:02:39.050
>> And let go.

54
00:02:39.050 --> 00:02:44.020
Magically, whatever that little thing was,
it disappeared, just like that.
