it the sharper it gets,

283
00:13:54.210 --> 00:13:58.950
but it gets to a point where it
starts kind of adding extra color,

284
00:13:58.950 --> 00:14:02.660
pixelation, so there is a limitation
to your sharpening abilities.

285
00:14:04.130 --> 00:14:05.080
Then we also have smudge.

286
00:14:05.080 --> 00:14:05.970
So smudge is very fun,

287
00:14:05.970 --> 00:14:08.515
it's very similar to the liquefy
tool that Nick really likes.

288
00:14:08.515 --> 00:14:09.190
>> [LAUGH]
>> So

289
00:14:09.190 --> 00:14:12.270
let's just go ahead and smudge this up.

290
00:14:12.270 --> 00:14:14.670
Okay, our pattern's going away, adios.

291
00:14:14.670 --> 00:14:17.012
Let's do some Circle action here.

292
00:14:17.012 --> 00:14:18.396
>> [LAUGH]
>> Yeah,

293
00:14:18.396 --> 00:14:19.892
we're really distorting our image now.

294
00:14:19.892 --> 00:14:20.930
[LAUGH]
>> Yeah,

295
00:14:20.930 --> 00:14:23.140
you can see where it's
blurring it right in.

296
00:14:23.140 --> 00:14:24.170
Yep, you're smudging it.

297
00:14:24.170 --> 00:14:24.770
>> Yeah, so

298
00:14:24.770 --> 00:14:28.290
the smudge might be good if let's say that
you're creating some kind of document.

299
00:14:28.290 --> 00:14:33.100
You want it to look like water
spilled on it, you can smudge it out.

300
00:14:33.100 --> 00:14:36.830
Or if you wanted to smudge out a license
plate or a face, you can do that as well.

301
00:14:36.830 --> 00:14:37.580
>> Nice.

302
00:14:37.580 --> 00:14:39.390
>> There are a few more
image correction tools.

303
00:14:39.390 --> 00:14:41.970
There's also dodge, burn, and sponge.

304
00:14:41.970 --> 00:14:44.500
So dodge lightens an area.

305
00:14:44.500 --> 00:14:48.290
So let's test it over here on this shell.

306
00:14:48.290 --> 00:14:50.290
The other way I could have gotten
to the shell, as a reminder,

307
00:14:50.290 --> 00:14:51.600
is by using our hand tool.

308
00:14:51.600 --> 00:14:54.850
So if I were to click on the spacebar,
the little hand comes up and

309
00:14:54.850 --> 00:14:56.250
I can navigate in here.

310
00:14:57.270 --> 00:14:58.260
All right, so, let's dodge.

311
00:14:58.260 --> 00:15:02.710
So dodging this shell you'll notice
that it's getting lighter and lighter.

312
00:15:04.700 --> 00:15:05.330
Here we go.

313
00:15:05.330 --> 00:15:07.145
So now it's kind of a bright white.

314
00:15:07.145 --> 00:15:08.840
>> Mm-hm.

315
00:15:08.840 --> 00:15:09.340
>> Okay.

316
00:15:10.700 --> 00:15:11.650
Now let's try burning.

317
00:15:11.650 --> 00:15:14.300
So let's burn the sand dollar.

318
00:15:14.300 --> 00:15:18.290
So you'll notice that as I'm burning
It's adding almost a brown tint.

319
00:15:18.290 --> 00:15:21.930
It's as if you were to
tinge it with a flame here.

320
00:15:21.930 --> 00:15:24.060
So if you're trying to make
something look antiqued,

321
00:15:25.060 --> 00:15:27.830
this is one way to do
it with your burn tool.

322
00:15:27.830 --> 00:15:29.070
>> Very neat.

323
00:15:29.070 --> 00:15:30.260
>> And then we have the sponge tool.

324
00:15:30.260 --> 00:15:33.290
So the sponge tool is a saturation tool.

325
00:15:33.290 --> 00:15:36.500
So as you go over the shell,
you'll notice the saturation here.

326
00:15:38.730 --> 00:15:40.820
Those are some examples.

327
00:15:40.820 --> 00:15:43.800
Like I said, I want to show you on text,
so let's open up another image.

328
00:15:43.800 --> 00:15:49.210
Let's go to File and Open,
and let's open Frame.

329
00:15:53.222 --> 00:15:56.930
So, the text is pretty clear here,
but we can make it even more clear.

330
00:15:56.930 --> 00:15:59.090
So let's use our sharpen tool.

331
00:16:00.350 --> 00:16:03.560
And I'm going to click and
kind of drag over the letters.

332
00:16:03.560 --> 00:16:06.000
There you'll notice now
the e is more apparent.

333
00:16:06.000 --> 00:16:07.520
Let's do the same thing with the r.

334
00:16:07.520 --> 00:16:09.310
So this is actual handwriting.

335
00:16:09.310 --> 00:16:10.020
So-
>> Wow.

336
00:16:11.110 --> 00:16:14.120
>> It really brings out
the crispness of the letters here.

337
00:16:16.320 --> 00:16:19.070
Okay so we've sharpened that,
that's a lot easier to read now.

338
00:16:19.070 --> 00:16:22.290
Now we can do the opposite as well,
we can also blur it out.

339
00:16:22.290 --> 00:16:25.990
So if you didn't want to
see exactly what it said.

340
00:16:25.990 --> 00:16:29.230
So you know kinda blurring it out some.

341
00:16:29.230 --> 00:16:33.050
That way, you might want to do this if you
don't want the text to be the focal point

342
00:16:33.050 --> 00:16:33.870
of your image.

343
00:16:35.730 --> 00:16:39.150
There, we can blur it out,
or you can also smudge it.

344
00:16:39.150 --> 00:16:40.930
So smudging is really severe.

345
00:16:42.960 --> 00:16:45.987
So there,
I just spilled water on the please.

346
00:16:45.987 --> 00:16:47.560
>> [LAUGH]
>> You might

347
00:16:47.560 --> 00:16:49.000
want to do that to a restaurant menu.

348
00:16:49.000 --> 00:16:51.600
Sometimes, you're talking with your hands,
and all of a sudden,

349
00:16:51.600 --> 00:16:52.460
the water is everywhere.

350
00:16:52.460 --> 00:16:53.970
>> All right.
>> So if you want to make it look like you

351
00:16:53.970 --> 00:16:55.990
spilled across the menu, you can.

352
00:16:55.990 --> 00:16:56.770
>> Very cool.

353
00:16:56.770 --> 00:16:57.470
>> All right.

354
00:16:57.470 --> 00:16:59.100
So those blending modes I showed you.

355
00:16:59.100 --> 00:17:01.840
I, kind of, want to show you again
with the different kind of image

356
00:17:01.840 --> 00:17:05.900
other than the shells, just so you can
see what all it's capable of doing.

357
00:17:05.900 --> 00:17:08.219
So let's open our bridge picture.

358
00:17:10.883 --> 00:17:14.937
Okay, this is a lovely image here,
but it can look different, so

359
00:17:14.937 --> 00:17:17.020
let's go ahead and copy itself.

360
00:17:17.020 --> 00:17:19.380
So I'm gonna drag, we're gonna copy.

361
00:17:19.380 --> 00:17:20.670
Let's blend it together.

362
00:17:20.670 --> 00:17:23.350
Let's do color burn here.

363
00:17:23.350 --> 00:17:27.520
So if we want it to look like a different
time of day, we can do color burn.

364
00:17:27.520 --> 00:17:31.490
We can also lighten it up so
maybe it's more like morning.

365
00:17:31.490 --> 00:17:35.220
You can do hard light,
vivid light, anything like that.

366
00:17:35.220 --> 00:17:39.890
Hard mix, so, really tons and
tons of different options here.

367
00:17:39.890 --> 00:17:44.270
But remember when you add a color to
it it will really adjust your image.

368
00:17:44.270 --> 00:17:47.630
So let's say that you want
this to look vintage, okay so

369
00:17:47.630 --> 00:17:50.040
maybe this picture was
taken in the seventies.

370
00:17:50.040 --> 00:17:51.350
Maybe your parents took this picture, or

371
00:17:51.350 --> 00:17:55.780
at least they wanted to make it
look like they took the picture.

372
00:17:55.780 --> 00:17:58.760
Let's go ahead and find a nice warm color.

373
00:17:58.760 --> 00:18:00.710
Let's use kind of a yellow,

374
00:18:00.710 --> 00:18:03.510
cuz older pictures tend to
have a yellow tint to them.

375
00:18:03.510 --> 00:18:04.650
So I'm gonna create a fill layer.

376
00:18:04.650 --> 00:18:09.920
And let's go ahead and,
that might be a little bit too much,

377
00:18:09.920 --> 00:18:12.140
but it kind of gives
the effect that I want.

378
00:18:12.140 --> 00:18:17.070
Now I do have options with my layers
where I can change the opacity and fill.

379
00:18:17.070 --> 00:18:19.623
So let's try that,
let's lower the opacity on here.

380
00:18:22.571 --> 00:18:24.330
There we go.

381
00:18:24.330 --> 00:18:26.170
That's about what I want.

382
00:18:26.170 --> 00:18:30.710
And again, you can try additional blending
modes or you can blend one of your

383
00:18:30.710 --> 00:18:34.390
other pictures differently, and
it'll really change the image as a whole.

384
00:18:34.390 --> 00:18:37.620
So, this is a fun way to
adjust it on a layer by layer.

385
00:18:37.620 --> 00:18:38.650
We don't want to subtract.

386
00:18:38.650 --> 00:18:40.980
On a layer by layer basis.

387
00:18:40.980 --> 00:18:45.310
So that way you can really adjust an image
and have a little bit more freedom than

388
00:18:45.310 --> 00:18:47.960
if you were to just do
an entire adjustment layer.

389
00:18:47.960 --> 00:18:50.480
>> Very cool,
all right a lot of great stuff there.

390
00:18:50.480 --> 00:18:55.680
Again more of those image correction
tools, some really amazing things

391
00:18:55.680 --> 00:18:59.690
we can do with our pictures to take
something that we've shot and we liked,

392
00:18:59.690 --> 00:19:01.410
but there's a couple issues with it.

393
00:19:01.410 --> 00:19:03.630
We can fix them right up,
get rid of those red eyes,

394
00:19:03.630 --> 00:19:07.530
move shells across the beach whatever
it is, we can do with Photoshop.

395
00:19:07.530 --> 00:19:09.670
So thank you there, Kera,
we appreciate that.

396
00:19:09.670 --> 00:19:11.520
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

397
00:19:11.520 --> 00:19:14.110
Signing off for IT PRO TV,
I'm Mike Roberick.

398
00:19:14.110 --> 00:19:14.757
>> And I'm Kera Page.

399
00:19:14.757 --> 00:19:18.120
>> And we'll see you next time.

episodes.title: Try It Out Image! Correction Tools
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.009 --> 00:00:10.009
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.318 --> 00:00:15.660
Hello, and welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITPRO.TV.

3
00:00:15.660 --> 00:00:21.071
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, and
today we're doing Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

4
00:00:21.071 --> 00:00:24.486
It's time again for
one of those fun and exciting,

5
00:00:24.486 --> 00:00:28.310
try it out, so
this one with our image correction tools.

6
00:00:28.310 --> 00:00:31.060
And here to help us walk through
all of that, is Ms. Kara Page.

7
00:00:31.060 --> 00:00:32.080
How's it going Kara?

8
00:00:32.080 --> 00:00:32.720
>> I'm great,

9
00:00:32.720 --> 00:00:36.470
let's go ahead and test out your knowledge
with these image correction tools.

10
00:00:36.470 --> 00:00:37.340
>> Alright.

11
00:00:37.340 --> 00:00:40.770
>> So get Photoshop up and
going, as always.

12
00:00:40.770 --> 00:00:45.830
And we are going to be opening up an
image, so let's go to File and Open, and

13
00:00:45.830 --> 00:00:49.344
we're going to select this vacation.jpeg.

14
00:00:49.344 --> 00:00:54.570
So, here's a nice little picture
of my sister and I on a cruise.

15
00:00:54.570 --> 00:00:58.870
Really fun times but, looking back
at this picture a few years later,

16
00:00:58.870 --> 00:01:02.750
we realize our faces weren't that clear,
it can be fixed a bit.

17
00:01:02.750 --> 00:01:06.960
So, what we're gonna do first is we're
going to duplicate this background layer.

18
00:01:06.960 --> 00:01:10.460
So I'm going to unlock it,
let's duplicate it and

19
00:01:10.460 --> 00:01:16.000
I'm gonna name layer zero original,
and then layer zero copy, edited.

20
00:01:16.000 --> 00:01:19.440
The reason why I'm doing
this is because one,

21
00:01:19.440 --> 00:01:22.750
it's not as destructive to the original,
and two, because I want

22
00:01:22.750 --> 00:01:27.240
to be able to show you the difference
between our original and our edited photo.

23
00:01:28.390 --> 00:01:31.790
Okay, so what we're gonna
do first is we are going to

24
00:01:31.790 --> 00:01:34.090
fix some of the blemishes on our faces.

25
00:01:34.090 --> 00:01:37.820
So make sure that you're on your
edited layer and let's go over

26
00:01:37.820 --> 00:01:42.890
to our healing tools, and let's try
to spot healing brush tool first.

27
00:01:42.890 --> 00:01:46.880
So let's zoom in, and you'll notice right
here on my face there is a tiny little

28
00:01:46.880 --> 00:01:50.650
bump, let's go ahead and
click and get rid of that.

29
00:01:50.650 --> 00:01:53.860
So you can kind of look around,
look for anything.

30
00:01:53.860 --> 00:01:58.000
This freckle, I have it but
I didn't have concealer that day.

31
00:01:58.000 --> 00:01:59.525
So let's just go ahead and conceal it.

32
00:01:59.525 --> 00:02:00.905
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

33
00:02:00.905 --> 00:02:01.599
>> It's gone.

34
00:02:01.599 --> 00:02:02.310
>> Yeah, exactly.

35
00:02:02.310 --> 00:02:06.700
So really if you If you wanna fix
up your face a little bit, you can.

36
00:02:06.700 --> 00:02:08.700
If you didn't put on makeup, or

37
00:02:08.700 --> 00:02:12.095
your makeup's not exactly like you like,
you can tweak it in Photoshop.

38
00:02:12.095 --> 00:02:12.603
[LAUGH]
>> Nice.

39
00:02:12.603 --> 00:02:16.270
[LAUGH] >> So there is a little hair of
hers that's kinda overlapping my face.

40
00:02:16.270 --> 00:02:17.730
And you can see it when we're zoomed out.

41
00:02:17.730 --> 00:02:20.170
It's kinda distracting, this little hair.

42
00:02:20.170 --> 00:02:24.260
So let's zoom in and
let's try to get rid of that as well,

43
00:02:24.260 --> 00:02:26.600
so let's try doing this big brush.

44
00:02:26.600 --> 00:02:30.130
So with this big brush
size you'll notice that it

45
00:02:30.130 --> 00:02:33.790
kind of looks streaky which is not
what I want, so I'm gonna undo that.

46
00:02:33.790 --> 00:02:36.160
Let's lower our brush size quite a bit so

47
00:02:36.160 --> 00:02:39.170
that way it's just about
the size of the strand.

48
00:02:39.170 --> 00:02:42.670
So that way when you're clicking,
it's not quite as noticeable.

49
00:02:44.270 --> 00:02:45.940
Okay, let's zoom out.

50
00:02:45.940 --> 00:02:49.360
There, much better,
her hair's not in front of my eye.

51
00:02:49.360 --> 00:02:54.100
So now let's go over to Kyleen, and
do a little bit on her face as well.

52
00:02:54.100 --> 00:02:57.620
So her face,
she has a lot more rosacea than I do.

53
00:02:57.620 --> 00:02:59.805
We actually don't really
look anything alike.

54
00:02:59.805 --> 00:03:00.630
>> [LAUGH]
>> In this picture,

55
00:03:00.630 --> 00:03:03.295
we kind of look alike but in person,
believe me we're really nothing alike.

56
00:03:03.295 --> 00:03:04.540
>> [LAUGH]
>> So

57
00:03:04.540 --> 00:03:08.050
we're going to need to use this
healing brush tool with her because,

58
00:03:08.050 --> 00:03:11.520
if we were to use the spot healing brush
it kind of does some weird things with

59
00:03:11.520 --> 00:03:13.310
the redness in her skin.

60
00:03:13.310 --> 00:03:17.810
So lets zoom in and
I will make my brush a lot smaller.

61
00:03:17.810 --> 00:03:23.080
And remember we need to create a source
point for this, so I'm going to Option,

62
00:03:23.080 --> 00:03:28.510
click and then just click and
cover up this little area here.

63
00:03:28.510 --> 00:03:33.100
Okay, you can zoom out.

64
00:03:33.100 --> 00:03:35.460
There's a spot on her cheek,
let's go in and do that.

65
00:03:35.460 --> 00:03:40.300
So I'm gonna use my spacebar to move so we
can really see what we're looking at here.

66
00:03:40.300 --> 00:03:44.060
Now you'll notice, if I were to click now,
my source point is still

67
00:03:44.060 --> 00:03:48.040
that lighter part of her face, so
we need to create a new source point.

68
00:03:48.040 --> 00:03:55.090
So,let's Ctrl click, and
then single click right here, there we go.

69
00:03:55.090 --> 00:03:57.270
See, continue to go around the face,

70
00:03:57.270 --> 00:04:00.920
really figure out what kind of part
of the image you want to fix up.

71
00:04:04.020 --> 00:04:07.240
But that's already starting
to look a lot better.

72
00:04:08.500 --> 00:04:12.280
Now let's see what would happen if we
blended these two together a little bit.

73
00:04:12.280 --> 00:04:16.970
So let's change our blending mode,
and let's try doing lighten.

74
00:04:16.970 --> 00:04:21.090
Okay not much of a difference.

75
00:04:21.090 --> 00:04:22.890
Screen, big difference, okay?

76
00:04:22.890 --> 00:04:25.970
This is as if we were to have
a huge flash go off in our face,

77
00:04:25.970 --> 00:04:27.460
probably not what we want.

78
00:04:27.460 --> 00:04:30.070
So you'll just have to figure
out what exactly you like.

79
00:04:30.070 --> 00:04:35.050
So multiply, maybe if I wanted it to look
like this picture was taken in the dark,

80
00:04:35.050 --> 00:04:36.610
that might be what we'd want.

81
00:04:36.610 --> 00:04:43.720
But let's go to lighten, since it's not
as abrasive, it's not a huge change.

82
00:04:44.830 --> 00:04:49.480
Okay, so we also learned about things
like Sharpening, things like that.

83
00:04:49.480 --> 00:04:51.740
So let's play around with those.

84
00:04:51.740 --> 00:04:56.310
So let's come over here
to our blur tool first.

85
00:04:56.310 --> 00:04:59.060
Let's say that there's something
that we wanna just blur out ever so

86
00:04:59.060 --> 00:05:04.040
slightly, maybe it's the shine
on one of these bulbs over here.

87
00:05:04.040 --> 00:05:06.030
It could be whatever you want.

88
00:05:06.030 --> 00:05:08.130
So let's make our brush a little smaller.

89
00:05:08.130 --> 00:05:11.210
Let's kind of Blur this out ever so
slightly.

90
00:05:11.210 --> 00:05:16.030
Again, blurring and sharpening doesn't
look like it does all that much, but

91
00:05:16.030 --> 00:05:18.750
it is subtle, subtly change the image.

92
00:05:20.040 --> 00:05:24.230
We can also sharpen parts of the tree,
cuz it's a little bit blurred here.

93
00:05:24.230 --> 00:05:28.030
So, let's go to sharpen,
and if you drag this over,

94
00:05:28.030 --> 00:05:31.420
it will really start to pick up some
of the bristles on the tree here.

95
00:05:31.420 --> 00:05:34.413
So you can do this.

96
00:05:37.317 --> 00:05:39.430
And if we wanted to do that over here,
we could as well.

97
00:05:40.950 --> 00:05:41.450
Okay.

98
00:05:42.700 --> 00:05:43.910
Now if we want to dodge something.

99
00:05:43.910 --> 00:05:46.260
So dodging would be if
you wanted to lighten it.

100
00:05:46.260 --> 00:05:49.470
So if you wanted to
lighten up this ornament,

101
00:05:49.470 --> 00:05:53.380
so it's a little bit brighter, you could.

102
00:05:54.650 --> 00:05:58.190
Or if you wanted to darken part
of the image, you could as well.

103
00:05:58.190 --> 00:06:01.480
So let's just kind of click,
hold and drag around here.

104
00:06:03.140 --> 00:06:06.520
Again, these are just really slight,
slight changes.

105
00:06:06.520 --> 00:06:09.060
The sponge I'm not going to use,
cuz I personally don't really like

106
00:06:09.060 --> 00:06:13.880
the effect of saturation on my photo,
so I'm just gonna ignore that for now.

107
00:06:13.880 --> 00:06:17.745
But I do have this part of the image that
I don't want to stand out quite as much,

108
00:06:17.745 --> 00:06:19.400
it's this top corner.

109
00:06:19.400 --> 00:06:26.550
So let's go ahead and blur that out,
so just slightly blurring.

110
00:06:26.550 --> 00:06:28.250
The other thing we could do, if we want,

111
00:06:28.250 --> 00:06:33.810
is kinda smudge it out too,
if you want so that way.

112
00:06:35.630 --> 00:06:40.250
But, smudging is kind of weird in what
it does, so you just wanna be ever so

113
